reviews.review: We are from out of town and looked on yelp. We found this place and decided to come. It is kind of a hole in the wall and a little hard to find. When we came in  though it was really cute. The person at the front was really nice. We got a kisses waffle that was really good. Not like a waffle i have tasted before also got a vanilla latte with whipped cream that was super good. The bacon waffle also looked good. Next time.

I had a groupon so I kinda went all out.  I ordered the Country Chick Sandwich with avacado, chips and a green tea, a chicadilla, the cinnamon sugar waffles, and the wafflenut with Nutella and almonds-- OMG I'm full!  This place is pretty awesome.  Definitely not a dieting place though lol... Their waffles have got to be one of the best I've tried.  Served up fresh and warm, the waffles are nice and crisp on the outside, and chewy on the inside.  Loved it.  

It's located on the corner of Flamingo and Maryland in the Target complex.  Really chill environment.  Great for breakfast or lunch, or maybe a snack or dessert.  There were 2 girls behind the counter cooking and taking orders.  Super friendly staff.  I think they have wifi, because a lot of college students look like they were meeting to get work done.  

Definitely enjoyed this place.  I just wish it was closer to my house!

Super cool spot. Gluten free soy free waffle was very good. Ask for agave instead of syrup. Atmosphere is dope...great music (old school r & b) playing while u work, write or eat. And the music is at a thinking level lol. One to hit up for breakfast fo' sho' when you are in vegas.

We came here on a Saturday and it was really busy. The wait took forever because the amount of people there. There's also a limited amount of tables available. And from what I saw, they only had three waffle makers. You would expect a waffle place to have more waffle makers than just three, which probably added to the wait. Unless, they have more waffle makers hidden from view, which makes the waiting a little worse if they do. However, I suppose the waffles were worth the wait.

They are pretty cheap for a big (at least for me) sized waffle. Here in California, waffles that big cost about $9-$10 but in Vegas, they were half the price. They have a variety of different waffles to choose from if you prefer waffles or a waffle sandwich. They even have a vegan menu if that's for you. They also have a huge variety of drinks.

I'll definitely be back here again when I return to Vegas. I look forward to trying the different waffles and drinks on their menu.
They have the best tasting waffles I've ever tried. It's just like a hole in the wall but they offer the best breakfast ever. Will definitely be back with more friends in tow.

Vegan waffles, light and crisp, topped with fresh fruit or syrup or other goodies.... A little place in a strip mall, which suited us perfectly, and we enjoyed a really great breakfast before our adventures.

We enjoyed the friendly service and the attention to the preparation - the fruit was arranged, not just thrown on.. 

Beautiful and delish - we shall return!
Great energy, good coffee, nice waffles and good people. Mae the co owner has a great energy
Coffee is super strong. The west coast was SOOOOOO yummy. The customer service was great. Definitely will be visiting again!!!

Random place my friends and I chose while yelping brunch, after getting gas. I wanted to surprise my boyfriend with brunch because he always misses breakfast. Right when we came in, they greeted us. Since it was our first time here we took a while to choose what we wanted.  I ended up ordering a West Coast. It was okay! I wish they put more chicken. The cheese melted with the waffle which made it taste good! I also ordered a honey cream latte. I'm no coffee person so I can't tell what coffees are good but my friends and boyfriend said it was "really" good. The last thing I ordered was a Red Velvet. I personally liked it because it wasn't as sweet. It kinda bothered me because it was so perfect... (Hahahaha). I had a weird urge to stab the holes... When I'm near Vegas again, I am definitely coming back! 

Stars for the customer service! There was one lady who was kind of rude but then two other employees took her place right away when they saw our faces from smiles to me and my friend looking each other giving "She's so rude" look. (Yes, it's a thing haha.) Usually they would charge for Avocado and Chips but they just gave it to us for free with a smile. Thank you again! :D

Came across this cafe on yelp on my weekly Monday breakfast adventure...and I was definitely happy with my visit. My husband I went shortly after they opened and we were the only guests dining in - there was a couple take-outs while we waited and dined (their website permits for online orders).

We were assisted by Mae (one of the owners) who was incredibly friendly and welcoming about our first visit.

My husband had the red velvet waffles, I had the #breakfast sandwich. I had a Carmel apple cider (by far much better than Starbucks) and my husband had a mocha latte (great also). 

While we did wait about 15-20 minutes for our food (not bad by any regular standards) - Mae was apologetic for our time waiting and treated us to a sample of their Churronimo (delicious!).

Will definitely revisit in the future!

I had their best seller, Banana Nutella waffle and Caramel Machiato. 
Waffle was good, coffee too. Ambiance is alright, casual but the music was a bit too loud. 
I'd like to come back to try their savory items.

Cute little place that has great tasting waffles. I ordered a double belgian waffle with vegan butter and a large iced coffee. The waffle had the perfect crunch and the right doughy center. I really like the fact that they offer vegan/vegetarian options. The vegan waffle with bananas and pecans is great.  I wish the service didn't take so long though. The two girls behind the counter are sweet but I don't think their business can handle a rush if need be.

One of the best breakfast I had had in Vegas. EVERYTHING was fabulous. Worth getting there early. Service was great and super friendly. 
Avocado smoothie, kale waffle salad and the chicken sandwich are delicious, not the traditional waffle combination.
Good coffee and good waffles.  Impressed with thr vegan waffle.  Service was excellent
Excellent customer service,  excellent food, and excellent atmosphere. I would recommend this place to anyone. Loved it!!! Very good prices for what you get.

Got a new addiction! Mae's Sweet Dream! I've got to ALWAYS have that along w/my order! LOL BUT here's Wut I also got for my dinner AND breakfast! The west coast for dinner & the Hashtag breakfast sandwich, my drink is Dom's Coffee Cake BZB!
Very yummy! The vegan waffle is so light and has a great flavor(: I think I had the vegan waffle with the cheese if that's what it's called haha? Don't remember it was really good!

Thanks to yelp. we found this local waffle house before we headed back home. Attentive staff and a place with characters. Decent coffee (had to have their Waffle Macchiato...its dessert) only one thing missing was they could of roasted the almond on the Viva Las Elvis. 

Side note and its kind of unrelated: Why can we have a place like this in Tucson? Last time we had the lemon puppy seeds waffle at Mother hubbard's it was disaster...They effing poured the lemon syrup and sprinkled the puppy seeds over the plain waffle. And we waited for 45 min for that lousy waffle. Still pissed me off today!!! 
 
Solid 4 stars.

Not particularly fond of this place. 

My friend got the lavender latte, while I got a cappuccino. The lavender latte was good, not too sweet and had a good taste of the espresso. Mine tasted only like a shot of burnt espresso.

I'm giving 3/5 stars for the concept, but I won't be a regular

Amazing hole in the wall restaurant! I love how amazingly friendly the staff is. We are always super satisfied when we come here. We loved it so much that we purchased a groupon for the whole week we were in town. Everything on the menu is to die for! My personal favorite was the west coast and the hey Arnold Palmer. I definitely recommend coming here. You will not be disappointed!

Ordering process takes forever. Spent at least 10 minutes in line with only three parties ahead of me. That being said, waffle macchiato is delicious as was the West coast sandwich. An inexpensive breakfast just barely worth the wait.

We were visiting family in Vegas and checked Yelp for a place to go for breakfast. All the good reviews on here made us check it out- and we ended up going twice during our short stay. I had the west coast and a waffle macchiato. My fiancé had the golden waffles and a honey cream latte. All of it was amazing! Yes- it took a while to get our food, but they the food is so good that it's worth the wait. We will definitely be back the next time we are in town.

Found this place on Groupon and had to go back! I've never tried waffles with anything other than syrup because I always thought it was weird any other way but this place proved me wrong... Their sandwiches are sooooooo good I tried both the South American and west coast & they were Delicious!!! Their coconut truffle ice coffee is LIFE! If I didn't live so far I would totally replace my everyday Starbucks with their ice coffee!!!

You had me at vegan baffles and almond milk. nom nom nom. Two things which are very hard to find, especially in Vegas. The boyfriend got The Hof (he's the carnivore) which was this pretzel bun with roast beef, arugula, cheese and agave-mustard sauce and loved it. I had two vegan waffles with macadamia nuts and strawberries with an almond milk latte. I also got the kale salad to go and it was really good. Not too heavy on the dressing. Just perfect.
Really cute spot. Not the same boring menu you see everywhere. Very attentive service, good prices. Really happy I found this spot. Taste buds happy :)
Must try: # Tiff's Waffle Macchiato! Yummy coffee. Nice people. The wafflewiches are good too!

I really enjoyed everything, BUT the Caramel Macchiato was a bit bitter for my taste. As a whole, we tried the Kisses waffle--yummy, the Kisses waffle Pacman Style--my 4-year-old ate the whole thing, the Churronimo--simple, but SO satisfying and the Bananatella--perfect with just a touch of syrup! The staff was very helpful, especially for new customers and everything was very clean.

Just ate here first time. Foods are okay. It just took so long to get our two orders. Waited abt.20 min. Long long waiting while not many customers and its Monday late morning. 

I received the reply from the owner to my review bi think we have to try the place one more time. Hope it will be good next time.  

Since the restaurant left me msg, we will try one more time when we go to LV next time. At least they care of review. That is good to know.

We found this little breakfast/lunch/vegan place a month or so ago and it original a delicious.  The Viva las Elvis is great and you can get it gluten free or vegan.  Today I tried the Waffledilla and that's my new favorite sandwich, with the sweet fluffy waffle and savory inside it hits the spot!  Love the trendy coffeehouse atmosphere, music and friendly staff. I would give 4 and a half stars if I could.  After more perfect visits I will give them 5!

I've gone here twice now after buying a Groupon worth $8 each for three visits. My first visit was early in the morning on my way to work and I decided to try one of their lattes and salads out. I ordered the green tea latte to drink there and the kale salad to eat for lunch later on. The green tea latte was very good. The size was reasonable and the price is what's expected even without the Groupon discount. The kale salad was also very good, decently proportioned and reasonably priced. The lady that was working there was very kind and helpful. It's good to say that my first experience there was rather pleasant and I was excited to drop by again to try the waffles.

I came in the second time with my boyfriend so that we could both try the waffles. I was looking forward to purchase the red velvet waffle since red velvet is one of my all time favorite flavors lol. After ordering, I sat down and waited for our waffles to be done. I noticed an uncleaned table the table over us. This table was not cleaned the entire time we were there. Now, I used to work at a food establishment and I can be very understanding in certain situations. One, the place wasn't busy. There were probably 4 people eating including us with a few customers coming in to order. Two, there were three people in the back because I counted 2 guys and 1 lady. One of the three could have easily cleared out the table the entire time I was there. It's just professional to keep your establishment clean. The workers seemed rather distracted and too busy talking to each other rather than checking the dining area for mess.

We finally got our waffles after 15 minutes or so. I feel like that's rather a long wait for just two small orders of waffles. I ordered the red velvet one (of course) whereas my boyfriend ordered the regular golden waffles. We both agreed they were good after finishing them. They only gave us two waffles per order and you'd have to pay an extra $2 for another one. But for the price, you get what you paid for so it was fine. However, on the website's menu, it says that you get more with the waffles like bacon and eggs. This is very misleading because I did not. It doesn't say on the menu at the store so I wasn't so surprised when I got my food. I just think that the website menu should be updated so that future customers are not mislead.

Overall, the waffles were good, the coffee was good and the salad was good. The customer service may need a little work however.
I had the banananutella waffle with a side of fruit and it was light tasting, not too sweet, yummy! The cup of fruit was a pretty good size for $1. Next time I'll try a smoothie.

Stopped by to have lunch with my brother. The menu is self explanatory. I ate the waffle named hashtag breakfast Sandwhich and it was bomb! I also had a blended frap called white chocolate tuxedo. It was SOO good. This place is a very laid back place. Music and the environment is very welcoming! 

First time here and it won't be the last. There is a lot of things I would like to try when I come back.
Thank you for your cruelty free Vegan options!!!!!
Amazing food and great service! Nothing better then eating at a place with good food and smiles from the whole staff. Definitely coming back!
SO GOOD. I got hashtag breakfast sandwich with snickers ice coffee. Everything had great flavor cookies fresh. Boyfriend got red velvet waffles and he said it tasted great. Smoothies were also a hit!

Only had a blended mocha frappe so far. It was really good and I was really happy that the girl who helped me was willing to use their Ghirardelli Chocolate that they use for baking instead of their normal mocha sauce. It was 10x better and the blend is really smooth

Best Waffle House in Las Vegas! Incredible creations and unbelievable tasting waffles. I am so glad I came here for breakfast! Think I'll return for lunch with my daughter and try a waffle sandwich! And I must try the waffle macchiato which I regret not ordering after I saw one served up!

I really love this place. They make an amazing cappuccino, great shakes, and I love the 'kisses'  regular styled waffles. So good. Haven't had a bad tome here yet, so glad I found a great coffee shop, way better then any big time coffee shops.

I love this place!  They have delicious cold brew coffee, and several different amazing vegan options.  My absolute favorite thing on the menu is The Guru Burger.  After I tried it once I haven't been able to order anything else, I'm totally hooked!  A tip for ordering the Guru Burger is adding avocado and daiya cheese, now you have the perfect waffle sandwich!  Also make sure to check the cookie case on the counter for a variety of fresh baked cookies!
Waffles are good, would've liked a side but they only give a circle of egg which looks like it was supposed to be on a sandwich..

This place makes me miss my vacation to Las Vegas so much....the food is beyond amazing and the pricing is reasonable.

The smoothies are absolutely delightful and has really gotten me to eat healthier by making me crave their smoothies all the time and finding the need to learn to make it myself in order to satisfy that craving.

The waffles are so good, both sweet and salty. However, I think I might be more hooked on the salty waffle sandwiches. Its a bit sweet from the waffle itself but overall it is just warm and had a nice balance of fluffy and chewy.

When I entered, no one greeted me. There were at least 5 people on the floor. I looked at the menu for 3 or so minutes when someone finally said they'll be right with me. I ordered their waffle macchiato because it sounded delicious. It's supposed to have a cinnamon sugar waffle garnish.

It took a while to make the drink which it fine. It's hand crafted, blah blah blah, but then he handed it to me without the waffle and he said, "the waffle will be right out. I just don't want the espresso to expire."   why not give me the full effect and make it correctly? Why not wait until the waffle is ready? The lack of urgency and receiving a deconstructed version of what I ordered - killed it for me. 

The drink wasn't bad, not great, but not bad & the customer service needs some help.

Awesome coffee shop with great drinks! Had the Red Velvet Latte and Pumpkin Pie Cream frappucino. The Red Velvet Latte exceeded my expectations and the Pumpkin Pie Cream Frappucino was good but not as good as the other drink. It was a little too thick for my liking and tasted more like a milkshake. It was still very good though. I'd come back here if I felt like getting something with coffee but don't want to go to a chain coffee shop.

WAFFLES + AMAZING STAFF = Why are you not here already? Selene (sp?) was terrific... She has great energy and was very friendly along with the rest of the staff! Customer service is very important to me and they nailed it. 

The texture of the waffles was so so perfect. Soft on the inside with a slight crunch on the outside. I ordered the hashtag and was pretty sad when there was no more left after I engulfed it all. The ambiance was also nice- upbeat music and fun art on the walls.

Definitely an excellent choice for a cheat meal or any day!

Came here for the first time the other day and really enjoyed it. I got the Guru Burger and thought it was quite good- this is definitely a compliment from me because, honestly, I'm not usually a huge fan of waffle sandwichs! My previous waffle sandwich experiences have always left me feeling like I could have made the sandwich at home with two Eggo waffles (and it, honestly, would have probably been easier to eat than the folded, taco-ish style they all go for!). This waffle sandwich blew my Eggo creations to the wayside- their waffles are really flavorful and fluffy, better than I've had in ages. I also had one of their seasonal lattes- the Fa La La Latte, because I'm a sucker for anything mint!- and a bit of the lavender latte on accident... which, leads me to my only complaint about this place. I came with a friend who has a very similar sounding name to mine and when the barista called out her name, we both thought it was mine because I had ordered a few minutes before her... well, we were definitely wrong! I thought the latte didn't have much mint to it (but it was damn good, either way!) but didn't think anything of it until the barista called out my name followed by the name of my latte about 5 minutes later. That could have been avoided so easily just by writing the name on the cup. Having to remake a drink sucks way more than taking the 5 seconds to write a name on the cup! Either way, great coffee and great waffles- would recommend! :)

very nice neighborhood place for a different kind of treats. Yes I'd return. There's an I Hop across the street, this is  better.  Although there is a smaller list to choose from. It's a lot of fantastic food here. Stop in you won't be disappointed.

Really, really slow. I know this isn't McDonalds, but 30 min. to get half our order and another 20 to get the rest? This was 9:30 am and there were only 6 other people in there the entire 1:15 hours we were there. Really cute place, small portions at great prices; but it just doesn't matter when they are so slow. Seriously, the woman behind the counter was even moving slow, no sense that people might be coming to her food establishment because they are hungry. And - the reason for 1 star- I could see her work because I was facing the counter, she was handling all the food with her bare hands. Picking up waffles, slicing strawberries, AND taking cash, answering the business phone, texting on her cell phone, never putting on gloves to handle food AND never washed her hands. Disgusting, I won't be back.

Went to this place during a birthday weekend after I bought a Livingsocial deal, pretty awesome little spot! 

Exceptional customer service, great food, and cool atmosphere. I love small businesses like these, especially in a place like Las Vegas, they are diamonds in the rough!

Trust me, we went to some pretty bad spots using Livingsocial/Groupon deals before here.

John, our cashier was very polite and friendly, and the food was pretty unique. Definitely recommend hitting up this little gem next time you're in Vegas and don't want that tourist Vegas service. :)
Food was bland and didnt appear to be what was advertised. Great atmosphere, employees and drinks.

This place is great! Friendly, attentive staff and nice, relaxed ambiance. But the real star here is the food! I am an admittedly picky diner as I am a pretty good cook myself...Bacon-stuffed Belgian waffle was cooked to perfection!! Wanted to eat the whole thing but was pleasantly stuffed after adding a fresh fruit cup for a dollar and a caramel frappe. :) Fruit cup was amazingly fresh, tasty and ample (for only a dollar extra, mind you), and caramel frappe did not disappoint! Total cost was under 15 bucks with tip. -Not bad for Vegas fare!! Eat breakfast here over the Strip!!!!!

Came here on my recent trip to Vegas because I didn't want the traditional pancake breakfast. This place is located in a strip mall so it was a little tricky to find. No menus just stand up and order from the board. The iced macchiato I ordered was absolutely delicious & came with a piece of churro waffle. My waffle breakfast sandwich was also very tasty and my grandparents loved their meals as well. My grandma had a red velvet waffle and my grandpa had a blueberry waffle. Cute little place and I would return next time I'm in town for your not so traditional breakfast experience.

I am seriously impressed by the quality of these waffle sandwiches - they're not just tasty, the avocado and all the ingredients I have regularly are top notch. Amazing. They may take a little time to make, BUT I promise it's worth the extra couple minutes. The owner is extremely genuine. I never review stuff - but I really am singing high praise. Been back about six or seven times. Waffle breakfast sandwiches for the win!
pistachio Iced Coffee is better than #sex this place has so many creative options from down right satisfying to vegan options. I'm in love   Banana Nutella Waffle
Eat breakfast here with the wife a couple times a month.  If you want a sweet treat get a Tiffs waffle macchiato.  It's got a churro waffle wedge on top.

Food was actually a little bland, waffles had no flavor to them unfortunately, my sister & I got the red velvet waffle to share, she got the vegan sandwich & I got the breakfast sandwich. If the breakfast sandwich didn't have bacon on it, I would've tasted like I was eating nothing. 

Coffee was excellent definitely would return just for the coffee alone. Great atmosphere & the ladies working were very pleasant. Just wish the food had more flavor.

Table was wobbly and not cleaned off, vegan burger came without sauce and was just two boca burger patties with tomato and lettuce between a waffle. Dessert churro waffle came with perfect scoop ice cream but only one waffle for $7.50.  Not worth the drive in my opinion when there are much better places nearby.
Vegan Belgian waffles with tasty toppings!! Fun little place with excellent food, great coffee and reasonable prices. Always hit it up when I'm in town. I recommend the Vegan La Elvis.

It's super cute inside with magazines, games, and good music and the staff was super sweet and helpful. The coffee was sweet but good (got the cupcake latte and the iced dirty mocha chai... The second was too chocolately to be a real chai honestly)
But for a healthy place, they had no egg whites! Which to me is silly. 
We ordered the white macadamia waffle nut which was good but they put the toppings on top, not inside the batter which would've made it better. The toasty Tokyo was good along with the waffle club.  
The groupon and punch cards are a nice touch. Giving it four stars because it's great that a place like this is by UNLV where there are no breakfast places or healthy places.

I wanted waffles for breakfast and this was close to school so I decided to go check it out. I ordered the the Banana Nutella Waffle from the classics and it was delicious! They have many options: sweet, savory, waffle sandwiches and dessert waffles. It was filling and a good breakfast. The prices were about $7-9 depending on what you get. You can sit in or do to-go. I did to-go because I had work. I'll definitely be back and would like to try the Red Velvet Waffle and waffle sandwiches next time. You also get a discount if you show your UNLV Rebel Card.

THIS PLACE. First, the waffles - slightly crunchy on the outside and soft and fluffy on the inside. Combine that with a wide assortment of their toppings and you're golden. Go for extra decadence with their drinks - boyfriend ordered their tiff macchiato (comes with 1/4 churro waffle!) and I ordered their tuxedo frappe, both of which were fantastic, if a little on the richer side. We are visiting Vegas only for a few days and so far we just haven't been able to have something other than Tiabi for breakfast. Kudos to the guy behind the counter, who was really friendly and made sure we enjoyed our stay!

Great coffee drinks horrible service. Wait over a hour for waffles and fake eggs. Under manned and over priced . Not sure if I would go back. But the coffee cake BZB was fire! Luke the thought of the wafflewich but dry and needs a real egg....  which would also make it less dry if the egg was over easy.

So my best friend and I are from Kansas City, and we were on a road trip with one of the stops being in Vegas.  We found this place on Groupon so we figured we might as well give it a try.   I can't even begin to tell you how amazing this place is!!  We absolutely loved it!!!!  Not only is the staff nice, but the food and drinks blew us away!  My friend and I traveled through 7 different states and ate at dozens of restaurants, and by far, this was our favorite place!  In fact, it was one of the highlights of our 14 day vacation, and we miss it already!  We will definitely be coming back here!!  :)

I absolutely love this place! Great location right next to campus. So on long school days, plan on stopping by especially during happy hour and grab a great coffee along with a little snack (the waffle that comes along with the drink!) Service is amazing and the baristas are always super friendly.

I've been here twice now, both with Groupon or LivingSocial vouchers. The food is very reasonably priced without them, so I'd probably go back anyways. Around $6 for a delicious waffle sandwich. I'm not a huge waffle fan, but these are light and fluffy and make a great base for a delicious egg and sausage sandwich. Staff is super friendly. Last time I was in there I ended up chatting with them for quite some time before heading out of town. A+

I decided to come here on a Friday at 1 p.m. while visiting Las Vegas. The pictures on Yelp looked absolutely wonderful which made me really want to go.

Parking is free and was easy to find. The store is located in a strip mall with okay ambience, but nothing that I was too impressed with. 

I decided to order Tiff's Waffle Macchiato because the combination of a coffee and waffle seemed amazing. While the churro waffle was tasty, the coffee was super gross and I could not finish it. It made me wish that I had only ordered a waffle and not gone for the coffee.

While the service was friendly, I was not asked whether I wanted my order for here or to-go and their default was to make it to-go. It was only after they tried to hand me the waffle in a paper bag that I corrected them that I would like it for here. That was sort of disappointing and I wish I was asked while ordering instead.

If I come back it will be for the waffles only and to try some of the vegan menu items. I would definitely not recommend getting coffee here.

A quiet lovely place away from the noisy casinos for good waffles and coffee. Love my red velvet waffles with bananas and strawberries, drizzled with chocolate syrup. The wafflewiches were also delicious, although was not big enough portion for big eaters like us for lunch, more like a snack size. Didn't have a chance to try their smoothies. Will have to visit again.

Excellent latte!   The smoothest and easiest drinking coffee I had on the weekend trip.  It blows away the $7 coffees on the strip easily.

Hashtag waffles - I have to assume they were excellent.  The kid devoured both of them in addition to the fruit toppings they came with.  This was the first time ever she finished an adult sized meal by herself!

Hashtag breakfast sandwich - This was good - the standard eggs and sausage.  If it was a runny sunnyside egg, that would have been much better.   I'd probably pass on this one to get a...

West Coast Wafflewich - now this  was a good combination of flavor and texture.  Put bacon and avocado on anything and you have a winner.

The sample of strawberry kisses was a nice way to end the late lunch.

I think i prefer the round crunchy waffles over the thicker style just because they retained their crunch.   But the coffee will definitely bring me back the next time I'm in Vegas.
Delicious! We tried the breakfast sandwich, West coast, and smores and all were great! We even went back for another breakfast sandwich!
This place is amazing! Excellent waffles and smoothies, and great vegan options!

I like coming here in during the week in the mornings because it's chill. The owners are cool and the food/drinks here are great! 

This past weekend, I took my cousin who was visiting from So Cal to try out the food/coffee. It was my first time seeing the other workers at the shop..

I was shocked to experience a customer having to clean a table for her and her family  when it clearly is not a customer's job to do so. The customer asked a worker for a wet rag so she can wipe down a table that had not been cleaned and still had dishes from the last customer who sat there. Four stars because the worker actually handed her a wet rag. Wtf who does that? 

Then, not too long after that, I experience an angry customer storm out because nobody was at the cash register taking orders. C'mon guys, get it together.

This place is delicious, has a great atmosphere and environment, the barista is friendly and thoughtful. There are cards at all of the tables and the barista will even play with you if they have a little bit of down time. I love local places and this place exceeded my expectations.

I know I'm in the minority but the food here is just ok. I actually left feeling sick to my stomach, this is just before heading to work so I'm not happy right now. I was beyond excited to try this place and went out of my way to come. 

I had the west coast and the honey espresso coffee. 
The girl at the counter was very nice and everything came out super fast... but it was not busy at the time. As soon as my sandwich/waffle was ready I dug right in but it was already soggy and just fell apart. Kinda disappointing but oh well, I managed with a fork and knife. The waffle was tasty on its own but together it did not jive with me.

Honey espresso was yummy, almost too sweet for my taste so likely wouldn't order again. But they have a lot to choose from. 

If I come back I'm just gonna stick to traditional waffle with minimal extras on top to play it safe.
Food is delicious. Pistachio latte mmmmm. The owner is super nice! I drive 40 mins to come here and it's worth it every time.

Love, love, love this place. The staff is so nice and welcoming but the best part is the variety of unique waffles. You must try the Maple Bacon Waffle and the Red Velvet (so yummy and to die for). 

I can't wait to return and try some of their other items.

This was an unbelievably pleasant surprise. I stopped in for a cup of coffee and felt indulgent so I added a Maple Bacon waffle to the order. Holy moly!  Best waffle I've ever had!  And the Americano was delightful as well. I'd return in a heartbeat!

This is an adorable little coffee shop!!
You really feel the love for the bean while you are here!

The french press coffee was SO GOOD! It made me want to go out and buy one!
But having one here is way more fun!!

The lattes and espresso were amazing as well.
Watching them swirl your latte into a beautiful drinkable piece of art! 
And tastes so good! Amazing!!

Oh....And don't say no to the Waffles! Made to order delish!
Love Tiabi!! It is a really special place!

And the owner Tiffany told me they are getting ready to open a roastery too!
Take my money! I can't wait! I hope they have 5lb bags!

Came here as a casual meeting with a colleague. It's a small diner type layout with lots of options for waffles and coffee. I liked the décor inside and felt welcomed. I would come here again. 

tl;dr: Simple contemporary style. Eat and go, self-serve.
This place is new & can get pretty busy.... But the food is awesome & the employees are Great....
I love this place, everything is so cute & it seriously feels so hip, the food hits the spot & the teas are super perfect

After much procrastination, finally decided to check this place out. It was well worth the wait and is an amazing spot. The atmosphere and decor is absolutely amazing. A very relaxed but nice place to go and enjoy a waffle and coffee. The Recommendations given by one of the employees were perfect. Extremely friendly staff and very polite. The Java Jolt, and Tiff's Waffle Macchiato are very delicious. As well as the West Coast Wafflewich. The price is pretty decent for the quality. Definitley will be back again soon!

Super delicious and super friendly, plus their mantra is one that is close to my heart. I got the Viva Las Elvis waffle with Nutella added and it was an explosion of sweet and salty goodness in my mouth. The Snickers iced coffee was also good, but not as impressive as the waffle. I'll definitely be back.
Yummmmmmmmmm!  I cannot get enough of this place!  The kale waffle salad is our favorite!  We split that with the Californian sandwich!

This place is near the UNLV campus and is amazing. I go about every other week with one of my good friends. 

I really like this place and the food is delicious and all fresh made. I am a big fan of avocado and a lot of there waffle-witches have avocado on them an its so appetizing and filling. They have man options too, including vegan options which is really nice. This is perfect for breakfast, brunch, or lunch. They have amazing coffee too. The drinks are so yummy and cute. They have a special menu in front of the cash register as well. They have a lavender vanilla latte that is so yummy and it has a soft lavender flavor. Also, I am not a big fan of honey but they have a honey creme latte that is so soft and decadent. It makes me smile and it is perfect.

The workers are also very friendly! They are also so nice and help out.

This place is serve yourself though, so they make the food and the coffee but you get the utensils and the maple syrup on a table across from where you pick up the food. 

They are always packed in the morning when I go and I really enjoy coming here.

Oh gezz I picked the perfect place for my waffle indulgence! Waffle is amazing, looks like a piece of art! Perfect hot coffee, great atmosphere. They even have playing cards at every table! Need to bring some friends next time!
Good coffee.. the waffles and waffle sandwiches were under impressive, ambiance was fine nothing special

Where do I even start? I've driven by this place a zillion times & never knew it was there. I'm so glad I found out about it. A bunch of us went one day for lunch & the ONLY unfortunate thing was that it was already crowded so we waited for our food for quite a while. But it was worth it & I can't wait to go back & try more items! I had the west coast wafflewich which was seriously delish. I tried a bite of a friend's waffledilla which was also yummy. The owner (?) brought out churronimos for the table due to our long wait & holy yum. Appreciated the acknowledgement & gesture. Looking forward to my next visit!

This place is so cute! I haven't tried the food but the coffee and service is on point! Great music and good vibes here. Perfect place to chill, read, or grab a coffee to go. They also introduced me to Epoxy. Buy 10 coffees get the 11th free!
OMG this place is so good!!! I loved their red velvet chocolate chip frappe and wafflewiches! I had the west coast wafflewich!

Eggs tasted like they were pre-frozen. Turkey sausage was cold, and inedible. Cappuccino was it's only saving grace. No need for apologize, or ask me to come be and revisit and give you a second chance. Sometimes in life you have one shot, so make sure each meal you prepare is a make or break. Save the long reply and just put your words into actions.

All the things I love: coffee, tea, and waffles!! Once you walk in, you immediately know that you're in for a great experience. With everything prepared to order, the food and drinks are fresh and high quality. 

They have a very interesting coffee menu with things like red velvet lattes. The flavors offered are rich and well executed. 

This has a small cafe environment with open seating for all people. The clean and friendly environment makes for a great meeting or work space. Free Wi-Fi is offered for your internet needs.
Great waffle sandwiches.  Great prices.  Nice place to hang out in Vegas that ISN'T a Starbucks.

Delicious and friendly staff/owners! I went here with some friends after a hike with at Mt. Charleston and this was definitely what we craved! The 'Waffle macchiato', which was actually a cinnamon vanilla latte that came with a delicious cinnamon sugar covered waffle was PERFECT. We all enjoyed (this is a very modest statement because everything was fantastic) our food. We will be coming back again!

I wanted to pick up some morning macchiatos, so my friend suggested I try out Tiabi. I was greeted by the friendly cashier who was open to answering all of my first time client questions. I ordered two regular caramel macchiatos and also received a macadamia/caramel Lolly waffle for checking in. The macchiatos barely had a caramel taste, but did showcase the fresh coffee it was made with. Definitely better quality and more refreshing than any chain coffee shop. The Lolly waffle was satisfying but had an awful amaretto after taste and was undercooked in the center. If they gave their waffle maker a good scrubbin' and ditched the almond tang, I think the lolly waffle could have a chance to be great. Overall, the customer service was friendly and coffee was tasty, but the lolly waffle and cleanliness of the establishment need improvement.

The staff is friendly and even came around with free dessert samples...which now I may need to get because the churro waffle was incredibly good.  The prices are cheap (2 people 2 lattes a waffle-wich and a waffle was just about $20).  The lattes are great and unique (never saw a pistachio latte before) and the food is great.  If you want a cheap great place with a very relaxed coffee house type atmosphere check it out!!!

My Vegas family and I met here when we were visiting Las Vegas. Great,simple delicious food! It's like breakfast sandwiches,but served on waffles! The coffee's wonderful too! The staff were very friendly and accommodating. We had a group of seven adults and two children,and no reservations,as none of us made them!They let us sit at a large table that another group had reserved.(Some of that party had an emergency;and it was ok with the half of the group that was there.) Some of us waited a bit to get our food,but I didn't mind, as we were visiting.Our family was there for two hours!-I'm surprised they didn't ask us to leave?! The staff was just so nice!

I would have given them 5 stars, but I don't know why they have been so slow lately. I LOVE them here. They have great coffee, the waffles are de-lish and they have a plethora of vegan waffles. The wait time is a little excessive though. I come in a lot and every time have waited over 30 minutes for my order! I never complain, but when this is a recurring problem then they should find a solution. I will definitely continue to frequent this place, but be warned that you'll be waiting a long time, so plan accordingly.

We wanted to grab lunch before heading on our long road trip ahead.

We ordered a coffee, Snickers drink, 2 wafflewichs.

We sat and waited and waited. There were 2 people working only.

We waited about 30 minutes before getting our drinks. Then another 10 minutes for our food.

My drink was okay, but my guy said his coffee was good though.

The wafflewichs were okay, but a bit soggy. Definitely use the syrup since I think it enhances the flavors. The fruit were strawberries and bananas, but the strawberries weren't that ripe. I did enjoy the chips.

I thoroughly enjoyed my waffle sandwhich and drink! I had the west coast wafflewhich (the tiabi sauce was AMAZING) and I had the strawberry sunrise smoothie. After I had those two I felt energized and ready to take on my 3 hour drive! This was a great place to stop and eat! My husband had the hashtag breakfast sandwich and kale champ smoothie. We both agreed my drink and sandwich were better but his was good too. You definitely have to smother the hashtag breakfast sandwich with maple syrup! YUM!

This place was great! Fantastic coffee (pistachio and their notorious waffle coffees were amazing!) Waffle breakfast sandwiches were terrific. They ran out of turkey sausage which sucks, but even with bacon, the sandwich was really good! Would highly recommend! Affordable and great tasting food and coffee.

This place was my favorite a couple of years ago when they first opened and had only one location. Today I had a random craving to get the one drink I sideways get from them, kale champ smoothie. 

Out of all the kale drinks I have tasted and tried theirs was by far the best and I literally had it every other day. Today though, years later, my bf went to pick one up for me. 

When I first saw it my initial reaction was that it looked more green than usual. And then when I tried it, it was definitely NOT the kale champ I knew and loved. It was waaaay too bitter and I felt they left out an ingredient, maybe banana. Had I gone there and ordered it myself and tried it before leaving, I would have asked them to recheck it or add something to it to make it drinkable. I feel it's a waste of money just throwing it out so I'm forcing myself to gulp large amounts of it. I may have to adjust it myself too but it's just disappointing...

So it's located in the plaza with Target on the Maryland Parkway side. It'd be easy to miss it if you don't know where to look! 

It's a small cozy cafe with seating for around 30-40 people? It's super close to UNLV which makes it a prime place to go to for a coffee break and possibly to study. They do have free WiFi! And the owners are pretty cool and really nice.

I ended up getting waffles and tea, more specifically I got the vegan version of Viva Las Elvis with vegan ice cream. It's a waffle with peanut butter, honey (agave if vegan version), and coconut bacon with a scoop of ice cream on top. It was pretty good, nothing too spectacular. The peanut butter melted into the waffle which was pretty awesome, because I mean melted peanut butter on anything is delicious! And the ice cream was well vegan vanilla ice cream and wasn't too special to me. 

I'll probably not get tea again, only because it was $2 for a bag and one cup of hot water. I'm not sure if they'll give you more hot water, but one bag and one cup of water doesn't seem like it's worth it. 

My biggest gripe was that it was DIRTY. I mean the tables, I went through two tables and they were both dirty. There was dried syrup on them and stains from the last customers. I looked down to see if there were any other tables, but most of them seemed like they were dirty to me. I tried cleaning some of it off, but most of it didn't come off with a napkin and some water. That to me is disgusting especially since it seems most people leave their dishes and the owners clean it off. That's just how it looked to me, when other customers ate and then left. When I got there the whole cafe was empty but as I sat there there were people that came and go. So they didn't really have an excuse to be dirty. 

I do however want to try some other menu items the next time I go. I just hope it's cleaner this time. I like the owners, they're pretty nice to talk to. I like the atmosphere. I like the location. I like some of their food so far. But I don't like dirty tables where I'm going to eat especially at cafe/restaurants/etc.

Came in here cause of the reviews , I was expecting for this place to be soooo good and to be worth the drive , but I didn't like there food at all , the sausages  looked like there are just put in the microwave and they just tasted horrible .!!!!! I also had asked for one of there ice coffees and was expecting them to give it to me in the jar like the  pictures I've seen in Yelp , but they gave it to me in a to go cup !!!!! I seriously won't be coming back here again. There food is just nasty !!!!!!

This hidden gem is definitely my new favorite breakfest spot!!! The restaurant is tucked in behind the target shopping center. Tiabi is decorated way beautifully and have a very interesting beverage, smoothie, and food menu! I wish I could try everything on the menu so I will be back! The food was amazing and the staff were SOOOOOO nice and friendly!! :)

We found this hidden gem on happy cow on our way back from Hoover Dam. Its in a small strip mall. We walked in to a fun and compfy shop. We were greeted with happy smile and very friendly service. We ordered the West Coast for me and the vegan Guru Burger for my boyfriend. Both were amazing and super tasty. We also split the Green Nut smoothie. I would tell everyone to come and try this gem whether your vegan or not, there is something for everyone.

Very cool local business. Excellent customer service and a great menu. Places like this make my mornings happy :)

Excellent prices, fun ambiance, healthy menu options, and super chill staff. Highly recommended.

This place was alright, I liked that they had a vegan option however it was not that great. It had avocado, tomato, and spring lettuce (I think) with their "special sauce". I didn't like the sauce at all, and it just wasn't anything special at all. I think it was around 6 bucks, however I also got their pistachio iced coffee and LOVED that. My friend got a regular waffle which just tasted like a waffle lol & got the peach tea which she said tasted like water but I thought it tasted good. So overall good place if you think waffle sandwiches are cool and you just want to try one but don't expect anything outstanding.

What Will You Get At Tiabi Coffee and Waffle?

Tiabi Coffee and Waffle is a rather unique counter-serve waffle place in Las Vegas. Located at 3961 South Maryland Parkway, it is at the Mission Center just north of the main UNLV campus. This place has some appealing waffle options that are different from what you'd expect elsewhere.

This spot focuses heavily on unique waffle creations. These include traditional waffles as well as some sandwiches that use waffles.

A Different Approach

Tiabi Coffee and Waffle is a contemporary dining spot that offers various types of waffles. It has many vegan food options and plenty of different coffee choices. It was established in 2013 and continues to be an entertaining place for waffles.

This spot has a rather modern look that isn't too unique or different. Still, it is an intriguing place to visit. It has a friendly look to it that stands out as an inviting spot for all members of the family.

What Does It Take To Get Waffles?

The food here at Tiabi is excellent but it can take a while to get. We waited about twenty minutes to get our food. However, we assume that this is because the food is so intricate and designed with an immense approach to detail.

The people here are friendly and do well with getting orders down. They always ensure that the food is made precisely as desired. The fact that these people can work with vegan requests if desired is an attractive point too. It ensures that people can get a great waffle even if they have particular limits on what they will eat.

Great Foods All Around

The foods here start with plenty of great signature beverages. Tiff's Waffle Macchiato has cinnamon vanilla macchiato with a churro waffle and whipped cream. This has a brilliant design that is creamy and detailed.

The Stiles Java Jolt has a vanilla breve misto and vanilla with a bit of extra espresso. This adds an extra amount of caffeine to create a good taste. Various frappes and teas are all around the place too.

The creative nature of this place is particularly highlighted in the waffle sandwiches it offers. The Waffledilla features chicken, Tiabi sauce and melted cheese and an optional avocado. This is carefully made with waffle patties to establish a great flavor all around.

The classic options here are interesting to see as well. The Strawberry Kisses waffle mixes sliced strawberries with a chocolate drizzle. The Viva Las Elvis waffle has bananas and peanut butter plus chopped bacon. A bit of honey is added to create a stronger flavor too.

I found this place Yelp and with a shining review from my fellow Elite-er I decided to give it a try. I kept it simple...large coffee and a coconut orange muffin. DELICIOUS muffin and a great cup of coffee. Small spot with counter service and easy parking. I'll be back for more !

I tried this place this morning and it was a great experience. I ordered an iced Tiff's Waffle Machiatto and it was bombdotcom. Just the right amount of sweetness, just the right amount of milkyness, and just the right amount of ice. The quality of the coffee is legitimate. A+ on the drink.

I also ordered some golden classic Belgium waffles. Finally, I find a place here in Las Vegas with real waffles. Waffles are supposed to consist of a juxtapose balance of crispy exteriors and soft almost custardy interiors. These waffles had that. They were so delightful to eat that I didn't even bother drenching them with maple syrup or butter. 

I would definitely go again for their coffee and 2 nice little Belgium waffles to accompany my delightful coffee. Great job Taibi!
-Ozzy

Their Waffle Carmel Macchiato, Bacon infused waffle and red velvet waffle sticks are TO DIE FOR! This place has it all and they are close to the strip and convention center for quick made to order catering needs!

Once I heard about a waffle bar in Vegas, I knew I had to try it, but unfortunately, I was a bit disappointed with my experience here. I arrived at eleven with a party of six, and another decently sized party had just arrived a little earlier too. We ordered, and waited such a long time for our food. There were only two employees working there, and we understood how difficult it must be preparing for two medium sized tables, but the thirty minute wait for our food was just too long, and that ultimately contributed to my three-star review. :( 

On the other hand, I'd give the food a four. I split a West Coast and South American. I'd highly recommend the classic waffle with sandwiches instead of the Belgian! They ran out of ham for the South American, but they compensated it with bacon and chicken; it basically became another West Coast though. Our party also checked into Yelp, and received the wafflenut. I tried the white chocolate macadamia, and although it wasn't exceptional, it was still delicious. :)

I came here for a meet up with friends and hour both a waffle sandwich and a desert waffle. The sandwich (cali one) was tasty as can be. It had a great chipotle style sauce. It truly stole the show. However, my desert waffle (kisses)looked 10 times better than it tasted. The waffle was way too crunchy. 

Needless to say, my overall experience was fantastic. I had very little wait time to receive my food. The staff was nice and always smiling. The place was clean, cute, and comfortable. It really wasnt with complaining about the overcooked waffle because at that point I was pretty full. To full to eat a perfect one.

Definitely go check this place out if you are a Lesley Knope!
Awesome spot!  Fun, fresh, funky great waffles!  Fantastic service from the fun and extremely nice employees!  You should order two things though if you like to eat a little more than average..

I just ordered coffee here.  I gave it three stars because the coffee was a little weak for my taste. I wanted the coffee with a little kick.  
However, the service was very pleasant.  The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. 
Again, 3 stars strictly because of weak coffee
Would like to try their food next time.  They have a interesting menu items I would like to taste.

AMAZING WAFFLES! I love to come here for coffee and waffles on my mornings off work. The employees are always friendly. I sit down with a book, and someone brings my food to me. There isn't a lot of seating, but I have never seen it completely full (yet). This is one of my favorite restaurants in all of Vegas.
I ordered the breakfast sandwich and substituted the bacon for avocado. It was a dry waffle with a side of smelted cheese, 3 tiny slices of avocado and frozen eggs than were disgusting.

Was in town for a concert with friends and wanted to eat breakfast/brunch somewhere not on the strip as we normally do and try someplace new. We found this place on Groupon, turn out our Groupon couldn't be used but still decided to try it. Walked in staff was very friendly, specious place, good music playing, cool art on the walls. Lots of different waffles to try! If you love waffles you'll love this place. I got the "Golden Waffle" with a side of fresh fruit and my friends both ordered the "West Coast" Waffle Sandwich. Everyone loved their food, the waffles are made to order. Will definitely come back when I'm in town.
Great study place when it isn't during busy hours. The drinks are good, we have to try the waffle dishes next time!
I wwnt in today for the first time.  The coffe was well made and delicious.  The manager was very friendly and even made me try one of the waffles, which was fantastic.  I will be back!

What is tiabi you ask? "To inspire and be inspired." What an awesome statement. This little waffle shop/cafe is a vegas gem. It's one of those home town places where you want to bring your friends. You can hangout and have brunch or stop by for a late snack and dessert. They have all different types of waffles that will satisfy your craving. I personally love the waffledilla. It's the cheapest waffle sandwhich and will melt in your mouth! It's chicken, cheese, special sauce (that is sooooo yummy) in between a waffle folded in half and is super scrumptious. You can add a fruit bowl (variety so I'd ask what kind they have that day in case you are allergic or don't like a certain type of food) or homemade chips just for $1! Sweet deal! And it's pretty much a meal. They have a water pitcher towards the back. But they also have teas and smoothies. I haven't tried the smoothies but I want to! I like the "Just Peachy" tea. It's not too sweet but has a good taste. I always suggest this place because it's very central, it's cheap, they have dessert waffles too (try the red velvet) and they're friendly. It's located inside the Target plaza so there's a lot of traffic goin on around the place. But definitely a place to try if you haven't!

I've seriously lived within 5minutes away from Tiabi for 3 years now and I can't believe I have just barely discovered it! I would always go to the target in the same plaza and Sakana sushi right next to it, so I always saw Tiabi's sign... I just never actually went in until a few weeks ago! Since then I've been addicted and wish I walked in to try it sooner! 
So far I've tried the Break Your Fast, Hashtag Breakfast Sandwich, Tokyo Sandwich, Guru Burger, and the churro waffle as well as the Honey Cream Latter, Lavender Latte, and my favorite yet - the Pistachio latte!! I am seriously addicted. 

Needless to say, customer service is amazing. The staff are all so welcoming and kind. 

As for the food.. The way they make their waffles is so different than I'm used to. They're thinner than typical fluffy waffles, which give their sandwiches the perfect crunch and texture! I assumed the waffle sandwiches would be soggy, but they weren't at all. Also, for the dessert waffles, the waffles have the perfect texture. While the outside is crispy, the inside is still quite fluffy despite how thin it is! Specifically for the churro waffle, the cinnamon sugar was not at all too strong, it was perfect.. Not too sweet and not at all lacking flavor. Also don't be shy about trying out any of their waffle sandwiches, at first I was skeptical because I've never tried a waffle sandwich, but each one I've tried have been really good. Tiabi puts flavors and items that really compliment each other. I don't even know what their Tiabi sauce consists of, but it's a great flavor in many of their items. 
Okay now for the drinks... If I had to single out my ultimate favorite Tiabi menu item I would have to say 100% the PISTACHIO LATTE. Hahaha. The staff must think I'm crazy because I've been coming back so many times for that drink. I get it hot with soy and ahhh it's literally heaven. It's so good that I make any of my friends around me to try it and each one of them were in love too. It's so silky with that perfect flavor of pistachio - seriously spot on pistachio! I have also tried the Lavender Latte and the Honey Cream Latte, which are good as well, but no where near the pistachio latte! Hahah

So by my review I think it's only obvious that I'm in love with this little whole in the wall and would recommend anyone to stop by. Aside from their food and drinks options, the little cafe itself is so adorable!! The decorations are cute and it's so cozy to do homework/study or even hang out with friends. Even though it's a bit small, they actually have plenty of tables/seats and even a cozy couch! Plus each table has a deck of cards and they also offer of board games for people to play as well. Awesome place, great food/drinks, with a lovely staff :)

Delicious!!! I got an avocado, bacon, lettuce and tomato waffle sandwich! It was great and just the right amount of food. Also got a coffee that came with these churro-esque waffles. Overall, friendly staff and had a cute atmosphere. Would definitely return the next time I'm in Vegas.
Excellent food & service. I will definitely be back. Lots of Vegan options and super friendly staff.

They wrap up bacon, cheese, chicken, and veggies in a waffle. This really should be all you need to know about this place to make you want to eat here. But, I'll expand. They wrap bacon, cheese, chic...

I decided I needed a pick-me-up and Tiabi popped up on my coffee radar (the yelp app) and I headed that way. As I parked my car and walked towards the door, I became skeptical about this place considering this neighbor can be non-friendly at times. I walked in and did the classic Hanna-Barbera/ Scooby Doo surprised look. This place was clean, inviting, and I was greeted with a giant smile and brief intro on the place. Great way to start my waffle fueled experience.  

I ordered the, "West Coast Waffle Wafflewich" and the "Stiles Java Jolt". The "West Coast", I was told is the fan favorite and if you read what I wrote above, that's easy to believe. This sammie is big, about half the size of an average dinner plate. The tasty ingredients are added to the savory waffle, then folded over to immediately give you this pocket-like snack item. As I ate, I was afraid of two things; all of the food falling out of the opposite biting side, and a weird sweet waffle paired with cheese. My fears waffled away as the crunch of the bacon filled my ears, the tender & juicy chicken, cheese, and veggies came together in the warm waffle. This sandwich was fantastic, and turned out to be one of those food items you realize you haven't put down since the first bite. This Wafflicious sammie was paired with seasoned homemade waffle chips. Fantastic mutated breakfast/ lunch combo.

The Stiles Java Jolt was delicious. Espresso, coffee, and just a tad of vanilla flavoring. I went half on the flavoring, because I don't have a huge sweet tooth, but Normally it comes with four pumps of vanilla. I could have drank two more of these delicious caffeinated bullets, but then I might turn into Spider-Man and climb the walls.

It's a waffle heaven place, the must try things here for me is a west coast waffle that has chicken, bacon and avocado on a classic waffle and for dessert order a Belgian waffle with banana, strawberries and of course some Nutella. You haven't lived until you'll had some!!!
Great service! They were all very friendly and helpful. Great atmosphere and good prices. Hashtag breakfast sandwich and the hot Mocha latte were very good. Great fresh waffles and coffee!

Bought the groupon so I had the opportunity to check out this spot 3 times. Suffice to say, after all 3 visits, I thought that it was OK.

I guess that this place focuses mainly on waffles used in a traditional sense, with sweet toppings, as well as savory preparations, such as using a pair of waffles as a bun for a sandwich.

First off, I would say that using the groupon was pretty difficult here. I had 3 of them, good for $8 to spend. The waffles ranged from 5-6 dollars, and the coffee drinks ranged from 4-5. You do the math. I think it would have been better to offer 2 $5 for $10, instead of the 3 $4 for $8.

The good news first. The fillings and toppings they use are great! For the hashtag breakfast sandwich, the egg and turkey sausage was cooked perfectly and well seasoned. For the Tokyo sandwich, the chicken was moist and tender, and the veggies were very fresh. The sauces they use are well balanced, the sweet ones aren't too sweet, and the savory sauces are packed with flava!

The bad news. I hated the waffle. I've tried both the thin waffle they use for sandwiches, and the thicker Belgium style one. My conclusion is that I frankly don't like their waffle recipe. They both had a strong metallic taste that resonated the more I ate it. This happens when I eat biscuits or other quick breads that use too much leavening, such as baking powder. This may be the culprit. The interior of the waffle is pretty doughy as well. 

Also, it took a little longer that I though it would to receive my order. On my last visit, I ordered a waffle sandwich, lolly waffle, and small hot coffee, and I timed them at 16 minutes. It would be better than to rather than to stack 3 separate customer orders at the same time, it's better to do one order at a time, because the 2 other people received their orders 1 minute after mine was ready :/

The coffee is ok but pricy for the portion size. The employees are nice and friendly, but also they seem to be easily distracted.

Wasn't the worst waffle, but not the best. Slightly middle of the pack is where I would put them. If you are in the mood for a savory waffle sandwich, this place would be the place to go because no one else in town is doing it (RIP Bread and Butter). Liked everything 'cept for the waffle itself. 'Nuff said.

I came here with some friends yesterday and we shared a number of items. As I walked in, I noticed how lovely it smelled and was excited to try their waffles.
 
We sat and perused the menu for a while and I was a little disappointed that no one really checked on us or even asked if we wanted waters or more menus than just the one for our group of three. We finally figured out what we wanted and went up to the counter to order.

The lady behind he counter kept interrupting my dining companion as he started to order by yelling behind to another person who worked there. I thought that was a little rude, so that definitely put me off.

Our food took a while to come, but it looked really pretty. 

What we ordered:
-red velvet wafflenut 
-Nutella and almond wafflenut 
-The Fat Elvis waffle
-Strawberry and chocolate waffle
-Vegas churro waffle with honey, cinnamon, sugar and vanilla ice cream

Everything was solid. The consensus was that the churro waffle was the favorite and I personally enjoyed the strawberry waffle, minus the chocolate sauce. 

Service needs work and the location is awkward, so I don't see myself making much effort to come back to this place in the future.

Tiabi is a cute little place hidden in a strip mall. Their concept is simple: WAFFLES. They have waffles for everything, with everything. Waffle breakfasts, waffle sandwiches, waffle coffees. We went here in the afternoon when it was slow; no lines and plenty of staff running around. My party ordered three food items and three drinks. The first two waffles came out in about 10 minutes. The third took 30 MORE MINUTES. The first two were done with their meals (and then drinks) before the last waffle came out. There were three staff members basically standing around looking at the waffle makers. No one looked like they were in a hurry to get our food out. There was no apologies or anything as to why the food took 40 minutes after ordering to be prepared. 

The food and drink were good once they were out, but I expect a business, whose sole food item is waffles, to be able to put out items in a reasonable amount of time. I suggest they order an extra waffle maker (or dozen) so this isn't a hamper on their business anymore. I sincerely hope they fix this, for an otherwise fine cafe.

It was great!!! Very accommodating to my vegan needs!! And my boyfriends non vegan needs! :) it's a shame it's so far away from me and not in the greatest part of town! But don't let that scare you away! It was top notch quick breakfast!

If you are really hungry. This is not the place to order, waited for my food about 45 minutes. It was not as good as the reviews made it seem. I deff recommend Bruxie on Las Vegas Blvd, I mean it's very Good.

It's been a while since I wrote a review, but I wanted to write one about my favorite cafe - TIABI.

TIABI - "To Inspire And Be Inspired". I discovered this little place through a student organization at UNLV. They are super close to campus and an excellent place to "be inspired," in my case this is the only place where I know I can sit down and focus on writing and studying. I've been here several times already and have accomplished so much (yelping reviews is the bottom of my list up until now). 

First, the only downside I can mention is that there is only one wall outlet (that I know) where I can plug in. That little area has become my personal spot. Other than that, I thoroughly love this venue.

Location/Open times: TIABI is down the street from UNLV. It is in a secluded area of the Target shopping plaza right next to a great sushi place. As a potential schoolteacher, the 7am open time is right when I have to get to class but it is open until 8pm on most days making it a good place to have breakfast on my off days, lunch, or chillax after class/work.

Aesthetics: Local art, waffle "hashtags" everywhere, a couple of couches and sturdy tables and seating. The wired art light fixtures  add a nice rustic look (though they tend to accumulate dust quickly). Nothing is too distracting, and I can zone into my work or a conversation easily. Their playlists are provided by Pandora and varies by the people working, but I have enjoyed the musical tastes of the staff thus far, ranging from islander to indie.

Food: In the words of a lego dude, "EVERYTHING IS AWESOME!!" There are plenty of options, especially health and allergy conscious, handcrafted on the spot. I have always enjoyed that "fresh" taste and have never suffered a regretful feeling leaving (as is sometimes the case with Chipotle or even Starbucks). As I am writing this review, I am having their red velvet waffle (so sweet and delectable) paired with a new beverage, the Frankenstein frappe, a cool and refreshing drink lightly sweetened with agave but not so much as to overpower the taste of the coffee. I am enjoying myself and am getting my morning kick (which is why I can write). 

Service: The owners, Tiff and Mae, are both super awesome and have taken care of me on numerous occasions. Their staff are just as kind and sociable, and I haven't had a problem striking up a conversation as I am often here alone. I feel as welcome as sitting at a desk in my own living room. I'm surprised that not as many people come to just hang out, but I'm certain that will change as more people come to know about TIABI.

I like small hole-in-the-wall local places, and I feel especially at home at this one. Hope this review was inspiring!

This place was so so good. Got the pecan candied vegan waffle just for kicks (not vegan) and coffee with almond milk and vanilla. So fantastic. Can't wait to try this place again. They seemed to have a fantastic variety of fresh juices too.

My girlfriend had a groupon which landed me here on a Sunday morning, well morning for me, which was 1 PM. The place was slammed and the four employees behind the counter were busy making fresh smoothies, espresso, waffles, and the like.

My iced honey latte was perfection. Fresh espresso, cream, and a touch of honey. It wasn't overly sweet and it still tasted like coffee. Really enjoyed it. It was just too small. I had to order another.

I got the Hashtag Breakfast Sandwich. Really nothing too special about it. Fresh made waffle, egg, cheese, and sausage. Wasn't awful, wasn't knock my socks off. It was offered with either a side of fruit or house made chips for $1, I opted with the fruit (because this was a total fat kid breakfast).

As I stated previously, the place was slammed. My friend and I snagged a table after a group of four left. We stacked up the dishes and ate at the "dirty" table because we are savages and needed the immune system boost.  We sat at that dirty table and the place had died down, not once did the 4 people behind the counter begin to clean the place up or even clear our dishes. 

Decent spot, coffee was the bombDOTcom, food was meh. Definitely would go back for the coffee, but I'd skip the food.

Totally random in a weird little shopping plaza. Quaint inside, but everything we ordered was delicious. Hard to find a good vegan waffle and this place has it! Also, the woman behind the counter that served us was super nice.

A pleasure to rest, drink, and study at! Staff is friendly and kind, coffee is strong and good, and the waffles taste like how waffles should: a delight. Music is not at all loud which is also appreciated. They've done a good job with this place.

I love tiabi it's one of my favorite restaurants, the honey I'm home waffle is seriously so good it doesn't even need syrup. All the waffles are incredibly moist and delicious. I wish the prices weren't so high though! Without the groupon I would never go

Great breakfast spot! It wasn't crowded when we were there and the staff was so friendly. We ordered some coffee and got the "Honey I'm home". I would def recommend this to anyone looking for a sweet breakfast.

Loved the coffee.

Got one of the smaller stuffed waffles from the front case- It was pretty and cute but I didn't really like the taste- kind of mushy on the inside. But I will prob. try something different next time. Super friendly owner and I love the idea. I will most differently be back for the fairly priced delicious coffee and espresso!

I'm glad I came across this place. local spots are much more engaging with customers and the vibe and atmosphere is great if you want to enjoy some good espresso.  

Super friendly and the food is tasty...crispy to perfection.

Decaf coffee flavorless. Was told that people don't know the taste of coffee that order decaf. Bacon was microwave, waffle thickness of toast. Two drinks and two waffles for over 20 bucks could have make better at home with my money. Guy at counter was super nice but he service wasn't enough to want to ever return.

The remark about the decaf coffee was made by the young lady who made the coffee. The flavor of your waffle was good. It was the quanity and quality of your other ingredients used that were not good especially for the price.

This place ruined all food for me. Like a virgin touched for the very first time nothing will ever quite live up to the Western Wafflewich, (more like a waffle taco),  and the golden waffle smothered in butter and sweet syrup. Two course breakfast! The memory of this meal will forever linger, sweet and savory, a place I can visit in the annals of my mind when the world is getting me down and leave smiling a happy satisfied smile.

Leslie Knope is my spirit animal and one of the traits we share is our love for waffles. As a vegetarian who dabbles in veganism, Tiabi's wide array of sweet, breakfast waffles satisfies my sweet tooth and my dietary needs. Thank you ladies for opening your shop and making Vegas a little sweeter :)
Food is rlly good, tastes fresh & not greasy or fattening. A little pricey, but worth it, you get what you pay for. They also have vegan options which is cool (:

I LOVE this place. Absolutely delicious! I had the vegan Elvis waffle and I ate every last bit. I also had a house coffee. The staff is super friendly and you can tell that they truly care about customer satisfaction. Next time I'm in town I am definitely stopping back by. Awesome!

This place is has got to be one of my favorite spots locally for coffee and a quick bite in vegas!  I've tried the vegan Wafflewhich and not that I'm vegan but thought I give it shot and it was DIVINE. I will definitely be going back to try the rest.

Hmm where to start. This was my second visit here.  It's a lovely upbeat place with excellent customer service who doesn't give yú attitude when yú have a "complicated order".  We both ordered the Frankenstein thinking it was going to be a hot coffee.  Our cold frothy drinks were presented to us at the counter.  We didn't realize that a blend means it is blended with ice. We thought it was a blend of roasts.  We spoke to the nice gal behind the counter and she explained the differences to us.  My friend then ordered the Java Jolt (which is out of this world good).  The cashier brought out the J.J. when it was ready and wanted to make sure we were satisfied with our drinks.  We tried to pay for the third drink but she refused and said it was on them and apologized for the confusion.  We also asked for a low carb option, she said they could do a sandwich without the waffle, so we opted for that.  It came out perfect and the eggs even had the waffle iron griddle marks.  They have earned a spot on my list of local favorites to visit for Vegas.  Thanks again and keep up the great work.

I hate to leave a poor review for them because they are super nice and cute concept. We have tried this place multiple times wanting to love it. We always have a super long wait, I'm talking 45 min for two waffles, there is no consistency (order is ALWAYS different) and our orders are always wrong. To wait 45 min for cold wrong food is just so disappointing. Missing key items that are listed on the menu like whipped cream on a waffle that literally has 3 toppings is just sad and inexcusable or missing items you specifically ask for every single time is just not good.

Bookmarked to try this place for brunch, and I managed to go here this past Friday with the Mom and Sister. They were hesitant 'cause they hadn't been here before and were expecting to to one of our usual brunch places, but they ended up being extremely happy with the experience.
Customer service was awesome. After greeting us, the cashier noticed that we were probably new to the place, so he told us a little about the ordering process and menu (regular items, faves, and seasonal specials). Pretty chill and nice guy. 
The sister ordered the Halloween-themed menu for a waffle and a cold latte. Mom ordered a Halloween-themed hot latte with a West Coast Wafflewich. I ordered a cold Chocolate Coconut with a West Coast Wafflewich. Hahaha... The sister liked her waffle and her drink, but she wished she had ordered the same wafflewich as us. It had a pretty amazing sauce, and the ingredients tasted as fresh as can be. I will admit that I wish I had their latte though. Don't get me wrong 'cause I liked my drink, but I tasted more chocolate than coconut, and I'm looking for a balance. 
The cashier also kept making sure we were okay as I got the food whenever it was ready to be picked up from the counter. He also happened to be the busperson, nice enough to pick up after us when we were done. Sorry sir... I'll be sure to put our stuff in the bucket thing on the side when we're done. Thanks though!

Very solid little cafe off the strip to get a waffle and coffee fix that won't leave you broke. The creations are also pretty darn creative so you don't really lose with any choice, sweet or savory.

I went with the Viva las Elvis cause peanut butter, bacon, and honey are a match made in heaven. My only complaint (and I feel like I'm disappointing so many people saying this) was that there was too much peanut butter. It completely overwhelmed the bacon. I also had visions about adding some chocolate to this dish so I stole a chocolate chip off my brother's waffle and yes, it was 100% worth it. Also, paired it with a honey cream latte - yum!

Brother went with the red velvet waffle. He said it was pretty simple, but it was still very good. Mom and dad shared their choices a wafflezilla and west coast waffle with a fruit cup. Both enjoyed the savory/sandwich twist for their breakfast and they were also impressed with the fruit cup which featured fresh chopped fruits. Mom had the pistachio latte, which is definitely more on the sweet, not really coffee side. The only caveat was that food prep was a tad slow. Each person's meal came out one by one. Hard to have a holistic breakfast this way....but it's a small operation. 

All in all, it was a delicious experience.
Amazing waffles and coffee. Service is great.  Staff is super friendly and the atmosphere is awesome.  We are in town for a few days and will definitely be back.
