Gluten free waffles were delicious! Next time I think I'll get it well done for a bit crispier bite. The West Coast waffle sandwich was super tasty as well. Service was fast and friendly. I would definitely go again!

The waffles and coffee here are good. Honey in coffee? I know sounds weird, but it's good. Wish they had real eggs  though, they only have egg patties. The utensils could be cleaner, they had a lot of hard water spots that might bother some people.

I ate here alone a few days ago and as far as customer service goes they were great! The lady at the front was very personable and actually conversed with me personally. Most places ask you what you want and want to get on with their day, but it's nice to walk into a restaurant for the first time and get acknowledged like they are happy you chose them as a place to eat today. It was a very cute/creative place. I love how there are cards at all the tables. I will have to bring my boyfriend just for that! Lol. I ordered the guru burger. (Vegan) and it was  interesting. I tasted the waffle and burger and it was weird at first but not gross. I definitely will go back. There is a few smoothies I would like to try.

I keep on coming back every time cz I started to crave waffles now that I know what they are. I actually had waffles for the first time in my life at Tiabi and I don't regret it at all. 
Girls that work here are so welcoming.  Feel like I'm invited to their house, and they're such amazing hosts. CLEAN and healthy. Very tasty .. The owner gave me this vegan cookie to try as a sample and I tell you.  It tastes amazing.  I'm not vegan nor vegetarian but I'm in love with this place.

Honest opinion is that it's all right, nothing at all to rave about other then maybe the atmosphere of the place. 

The two sandwiches I tried was flat out BLAND, the waffle in itself was uninspired with no actual flavor. The break-the-fast was overwhelmed by the bacon, I could not taste the cheese or egg. And the other was completely forgettable, left a "why" in my mouth. Why did they add two together, it tasted gross. 

Maybe I'll come back and try to test out other products they sell, see if standalone items like waffles or coffee would be a reason to comeback. But don't let the hype fool you, it's a 2 Star at BEST. And that's because of how the atmosphere felt.
Captain Crunch frap is the business!  The honey cream latte is amazing as well..... House made chips and waffle sandwiches oh my!!
Spent a day doing my homework here and really got thing a done! Quiet place to study on weekends. Loved the Waffle with strawberries!
This place is so cute! It has a great atmosphere, the staff is really friendly and the food is great!

Such a cute place with an awesome staff! The menu is very creative and have options for everyone-- from carnivores to vegans. 
Although my order didn't come out how I had ordered it (hence the 4/5 stars), I enjoyed every bite.

When I came to Vegas on vacation, this was my last breakfast stop before headed back to NYC and I wish I could have taken it with me! :( I miss this so much, I crave their mixed coffee drinks! They've inspired me to try out recipes and maybe open up a food truck. HA love it though and can't wait to come back to Vegas and make this my go to breakfast spot!

Enjoying a nice breakfast with the family. 
Food was good. Options are great. And best part is they didn't up charge me for substitutions.
The pistachio latte is very light flavor.
Great portions too. 
The only complaint is dry waffles. Need sauce for sure.

Gluten free batter that tastes incredible?  Yes! This place has wonderful waffles and you can get any made with aforementioned batter. I highly recommend the maple bacon waffle. Friendly staff and service. If you're lucky enough to live here in Las Vegas,  this is where you should be eating breakfast no less than every single day of the week. If you're just visiting and you want a vegas breakfast that isn't over priced and mediocre than come here! You will not be disappointed!

I used to love Tiabi, thought it was the best waffle place in Vegas for vegans. Until the past couple of times I've ordered my waffles to go & they were completely burnt to a crisp!!! The first time this happened I called them & they replaced it but I had to drive back there to pick it up which was annoying but because I loved their waffles that made it worth it. Now, this just happened today. I ordered 2 vegan golden waffles. When I picked them up I had to check them to make sure they were okay because of the previous incident. So One waffle was soft & warm like it should be while the other was hard & stiff, resembling a piece of card board! So I have my boyfriend take it back to them to make me a new one & he showed them the difference between the waffles. He then asks my boyfriend if he touched it like duh! Why would I waste my time returning it. So we were in a rush & couldn't wait an extra 15 mins for a waffle so we told him we'd be back. When we come back the waffle was SO COLD & EVEN MORE HARD & BURNED THAN THE FIRST WAFFLE. I was furious. HENCE MY REVIEW. I've never had service like this before they've always been kind & helpful. So basically when I go in I show him the first waffle that I kept, I picked it up showing how it can actually move & is soft then show him how hard the "new" waffle he gave me & how cold it was!!! Like I honestly don't understand how someone that works in the food & beverage industry feels okay handing out COLD food to a customer?!?!?! Even McDonald's employees know better than that (not to speak down on them). I think he must of been new or something because he tried to tell me that it's because of the batter that vegan waffles are hard & that it's been sitting out waiting for me that's why it got cold. I told him I come here often & I've had soft vegan waffles & I also told him it's unacceptable to serve cold food! I was completely frustrated I just asked for a refund so I gave them back their cold hard waffle & the other waffle I held on to & received a refund ... I suggest going in the morning when they open, the guy who opens (I forget his name) is very kind & always makes my orders great. Also the black guy is very kind & assists with any issue or concern ... if this didn't happen today Tiabi would've gotten 5 stars but because of this guy & his poor service it dropped to a weak 3.... I honestly might just have to drive to the summerlin location to get better service

The Good
A very pleasant and nice staff with reasonably priced items.  

The Bad
The food and the wait. My wife ordered the banana Nutella waffle which came out first and the waffle was overcooked and very dry. The Nutella was flavorless and limited as it was drizzled on. My only other experience to compare this type of waffle with was at Disneyworld and there waffle was moist, soft and warm with the Nutella adding a great accent. 
I ordered the hashtag waffle and a banana Nutella for me. The hashtag was again an overcooked, dry and burnt in some areas waffle with turkey sausage that tasted like they came out of the frozen foods section at Von's supermarket.  Completely flavorless. The egg that came with it I cannot not even explain what it looked like.  My banana Nutella waffle did not even look like my wife's as by the time I got it I was told they were having issues with there waffle maker. It reminded me of one my 12 year old made me for Father's Day. 

The Ugly
Due to technical problems everything took twice as long as long as it should.  I even saw A gentleman get up who had been waiting there before us asking why was it taking so long for his food.  For my inconvenience of waiting so long they offered me a cookie. At that moment they should've offered to discount my food at least. 

One of the things I hate having to do on a yelp review is do a negative review. Hopefully, for others they will not receive this type of food or delay.  My goal is always to stay away from the chain restaurants and find those little hidden gems in the city.  Unfortunately, I didn't find the gem.

Not recommended. Tables are sticky from the syrup. Waffles are burned. Also, a nice lady came in when we were here and had a small cup in her hand. She asked for a little bit of ice. The woman working declined with a statement to the affect of "we don't give things away for free, you have to buy something". 100 degrees outside and you won't share a little ice. Not for me

Been here many times. I only order online cause it's easier to see my options and when I get there the wait is not long. I've ordered their smoothies, coffee, waffles, salad and from their lunch menus. I would drive 35 minutes almost every weekend just to come here. Great prices. Great staff. This is my Starbucks :)

OK, this is a lengthy review.  here's a summary:  The wait is FOREVER.  If you're disabled or in a hurry, skip it.  If you're fully-abled with plenty of time on your hands, Tiabi is probably worth the wait.

Now for the actual review:

This place is very popular - there wasn't an empty seat in the house.  This is a problem for me as I'm disabled.  I was feeling halfway decent today and decided to take my daughter out for a (long overdue) mommy/daughter date, since I don't get to do that very often.

We went inside and stared at the menu for a few minutes.  It's big and on the wall near the front of the store, which is convenient.  After deciding what we wanted, I walked around to find the area for placing an order.  There are 3 sections where the counter is open, so they all appear to be there for communicating with the people behind the counter.  After examining the other items at the counter (there's stuff everywhere), however, it wasn't obvious where to stand to place an order.  One of the staff members saw the lost look on my face and directed me to the right place.  Once there I noticed an ipad on the counter which I assume they use to take orders.

We moved to the appropriate counter spot (which is at the front of the store, by the menu), and then waited to be helped.  I was able to wait for 10 minutes, but that's when my back issues kicked in.  In that time, we were given an apology, but no other eye contact or acknowledgement.  I got the impression that they were overwhelmed and didn't WANT to take anymore orders.  I've worked in retail and food service, so I know how that that is.  It was probably a blessing that they didn't take my order, as I wouldn't have been capable of standing around much longer to wait for the food.

In their defense, all 3 employees were shuffling around and working very hard.  The place was just seriously understaffed.  They could've used AT LEAST 2 more people today.  Since my back issues don't allow me to stand for extended periods of time, I hate to say that I won't be able to return to this establishment.  For anyone in the same boat - having limited physical abilities - I'd suggest ordering Tiabi for delivery if you live close enough, or just try a different waffle bar.  The one at Tivoli has plenty of seating and wasn't busy when I went.

I was very disappointed.  My young daughter was VERY excited to try some new and desserty waffles.  It kills me to get that far into the process, only to break her heart and go somewhere else.  It also sucks because I'm usually in too much pain (or too medicated) to even leave the house.  So when I do leave the house, every minute counts and is very special to me.  Don't take your good health for granted!!!!!!!!

Not entirely related, but worth noting:  Across the street from Tiabi, the wash runs between Toys R Us and Seafood City.  This part of the wash spawns a lot of water pokemon, which are hard to find elsewhere in the desert.

I kinda wish I could leave a review without giving a star rating.  Although I couldn't try the food, it's obviously good.  They wouldn't have been that busy if they weren't doing something right.  I just REALLY REALLY REALLY wish the owners would staff it better, or maybe expand or something.  We aren't all fully-abled college students with the ability to wait around all day.  I also want to mention that I'm NOT the type of person who expects everyone to cater to ME and my specific needs.  My belief - no matter what side of the counter I'm on - is that if your customers are important to you, you don't make them wait more than 2 minutes to be rung up.
Came back the very next day. I will be craving the Guru burger for weeks. This seriously needs to be on a vegan foodie bucket list.
Literally sweetest group of people. The owners are very friendly with genuine, great hospitality. The food was AMAZING and extremely affordable. One of those hidden gems in town.

The coffee was the best part of my meal! My husband and I both got waffle sandwiches and the waffle itself was thin which is perfect and tasty but I had one with chicken and the chicken tasted like that pre-packed stuff. Got the coffee with the cinnamon waffle on top and the waffle was awesome on that so I would go back just for sweet waffles and coffee.
Interesting wake concoctions, such as the red velvet waffle or the maple bacon waffle. However, very dry, they were too crispy for my tastes, but they were cheap...so...ehhh
I was craving waffles while on my vacation in Vegas, and this place did not disappoint! Reasonable prices, welcoming staff, delicious food and drinks. The maple bacon waffle was great!

This place is really cute- the atmosphere is hip and eclectic, and they even have decks of cards to play with at the tables. The establishment is clean, and they have a few  yummy looking things for vegans on their menu. The staff is passionate and friendly, and I loved the small business vibe that it had.

I didn't personally have a great overall experience there, but I realize from other's reviews that my experience was definitely not the norm.

When my fiancé and I ordered our food, I didn't think it would take much more than 20 minutes to get it on the table, but the guy working there did warn me that it might take a couple extra minutes. No big deal. After waiting about 45 minutes, I needed to leave for work but we had already paid for our food- which I found out hadn't even been started yet. There was only one other couple in the restaurant, so I went to find out what was going on. It turns out, the one person working there was filling a 30 sandwich catering order before making our 2 sandwiches. The owner/manager person came out to see what was wrong, and ended up basically yelling at her employee for not offering us a free upgrade to Belgian waffles so that he could use the other iron and get our sandwiches out quickly.

Now, yes, that would have been a smart thing to do, but what about the possibility of putting the only two waffles ordered in the last hour in front of the 30 catered waffles? Or the possibility of not charging for the meal we had to take to go and I still ended up late for work? Or at the very least not chewing out your employee for a unfortunately handled circumstance that could not have possibly been covered during training? 

Also the manager/owner lady was worried that I would give her a bad review on yelp, and kept bringing it up and asking that the employee's mistake wouldn't cost her a good review. I don't go on yelp just to give people bad reviews, but it's not often that I have an experience this bad either.

The sandwiches and coffee themselves were absolutely fabulous, and since the service was definitely situational, I would not be opposed to going back sometime to give it another shot. Even more than being late for work and not getting any sort of complimentary item as an apology, I just really don't appreciate the lack of professionalism that the management showed the day I went in. I've been in situations where my boss embarrassed me in front of customers before, and it's really the worst thing.

But like I said, it was just a poorly handled situation, and the food was so dang good that I would not be opposed to giving them a second chance- I'm just not chomping at the bit to walk through those doors again.

Awesome food! I had the hashtag waffle and could have had three more just to keep the taste in my mouth. The staff was also really nice and made recommendations for me when I couldn't decide what I wanted.  

The place was a little tucked away off Maryland parkway but when you find it, it's like finding one of Vegas's secret gems. It's is very well priced and the ambiance is really chill and inviting. 

I will defiantly be back and would recommend this place to everyone!

I was surprised to see that such a highly rated Yelp restaurant was offering a deal on LivingSocial. I knew I just had to get it and try the place out.

I ordered the Mixed Berry Chicken Salad. It came with two yummy waffles. The salad itself was fresh, lots of fruits and chicken to fill you up. The waffles itself reminded me of the HK egg waffle taste, except not as sweet.

For my drink I ordered a Dirty Mocha Chai. It came in a cute mason jar cup. I could mostly taste the mocha but not so much the chai. It was a good drink but don't think I will get it again.

Can't wait to come back and try some of their waffle desserts!

Ok let me start off by saying i absolutely love this place super offbeat in the best possible way, the quirky decor and i love the huge chalk wall the message is totes me. Right away when you step into the doors you feel relaxed and welcomed. Between the chill atmosphere friendly staff you never want to leave, bonus they have playing cards on the table to entice you to stay a while. Perfect for an after work chill spot or rejuvenate after a long day of shopping!  The prices for the portions are redonculous! Averaging about $6 buck. I got the Banatella Belgium waffle and i know you can see my face but its covered in drool! the waffle is crispy on the outside and fluffy warm goodness on the inside i had mine topped with a scoop of Thriftys (yes i said Thriftys) ice cream and my waffle stood up to the scoop the bananas, delicious Nutella drizzle and almond slivers without ever getting mushy! My friend got her own creation (she's a bit of a mad scientist) She had the traditional waffle with chocolate chips, strawberries and caramel and she had no complaints. I will definitely be back hope to see you there!

The waffles are magic in your mouth. I'm not a big waffle fan, but this place does it right. Crispy on the outside and nice and airy on the inside. There's a variety of waffle sandwiches and waffle desserts and the coffee choices makes it hard to pick just one.

Tiabi is on the Maryland Parkway side of the Target shopping center. Right now they have a tarp sign that says something to the effect of "Coffee and Waffles" instead of their name.

Although there is a chalkboard menu on the wall grab a menu to get the full details of the items. Order your food at the counter. Ordering was slow when I went, but hopefully will get better with time. Then find your own seat. I would recommend ordering 2 wafflewiches since they do not come with sides (besides chips) or adding items to your sandwich to make it bigger. They are petit. Here's what we ordered:

Break the Fast Wafflewich- The actual waffle is delicious. I like that it's a little sweet. It's also a harmonious texture combo- sturdy and moist. Inside were scrambled eggs, thin bacon, and cheese. The items inside were sparse and the bacon was the thin kind. The price is right (about $5), but I would gladly pay more for a fuller sandwich. I think next time I will ask for extra eggs and maybe avocado on the side.

B.A.T Wafflewich- Same great waffle housing bacon, arugula, tomato, and a delicious sauce. We also wished this sandwich was fuller. The tomatoes were great. I bet this one would be great with avocado.

Regular Coffee- I drink mine black. This coffee was a-ok and came in a to go cup.

Iced Americano- Also a-ok and definitely caffeinated.

I'll definitely be back now that I have a better idea of what to order. Businesses in this area need our support so give Tiabi a try.

Delicious food! Had the #breakfast sandwich, west coast sandwich, red velvet lollipop, and strawberry sunrise smoothie and everything was delicious. Employees are helpful and friendly too. Matter of time before lines are out the door!

I LOVE this place. My favorite restaurant hands down! Vegan options, fair price, and delicious fresh food. It usually feels like they don't really have quite enough people on staff, but I don't think the wait is ever unreasonable. Most employees are friendly and listen well. They give student discounts and have cool lil events every once in a while. They have also a Leslie Knoppe quote on the wall, so they clearly have it together. Definitely give this place a try. True Vegas gem

Loved this little coffee shop in the middle of a not so great area. Was looking for a caffine lift and found this place nearby where I was. When you walk in it is a very cafe vibe-not so much coffee shop. The decorations are super cool and there is a lot to see inside this small place.

They have a nice variety of waffles both regular and vegan. I think this is a good choice for breakfast and even for vegans and non vegans so they can eat well together. They also have meat waffles such as bacon, fruit waffles and tons of other tasty choices. 

 They have a hot lavender Infused latte which I loved, and many options for cold coffee as well. If in the area its a great choice for a nice homemade waffle and a good coffee.

Great place. me and my lady tried it. food was delicious. service was very good. the woman was very thoughtful and took care of us. forgot to leave a tip though. felt bad about it. looking forward to returning even though its far from my house.

SMOOTHIE IS THE BEST THING HERE......not coffee....or waffles

For a place that is specifically a coffee and waffle place... Both the coffee and waffles are not that great. The coffee is mainly milk and barely any coffee. We tried a skinny latte, iced coffee, tiffs coffee with a waffle on top. The coffee flavor is not strong at all but mainly milky ... Maybe next time we should just order black coffee. 
The waffles on the other hand are kinda soggy. They are topped with so much whipped cream and sauces that is what probably took out the good crunch in the waffle. 
The best thing at this place was their smoothies surprisingly. I would give their smoothies a 5! The Green Nut is absolutely the best smoothie ever! And it is healthy with almond and kale it is so refreshing!! I would highly recommend it to anyone. I would come here again but ONLY to get another smoothie not for anything else. 

Also there is a good groupon for this place my friend and I tried it out we each bought $24 worth at this place. But interestingly enough the Groupons  come in three separate Groupons worth $8 each. I am ok with that because we can come multiple times, but when I came with my friend he had his groupon and I had mine and they had the audacity to question us and tell us that we cannot use it when coming within "one visit" well he bought his separate and I bought mine. It is a different transaction who cares it is also separate visit because it is his visit, then my visit. 
Also,what if I wanted to use my second groupon would it be considered a "different visit" if I walked out the door then came back in? They are sticklers about this rule so if you bought a groupon then watch out they are going to grill you about it!

I thought this place was going to be a little different. I thought it was going to be more like a diner and not a cafe. I had a bacon and maple waffle and it was delicious. My two year old ate most of it. I also got the pistachio latte. Amazing!!!! The things I didn't like, there was only two people working so it took a long time to get our food. Each meal came out one at a time. My youngest fell asleep before his breakfast came. The other thing I didn't like was that they didn't have high chairs. That means that I can't bring my kids back. So I would say great food but not really as family friendly as I was expecting for a waffle place.

A bit pricey for some waffles and coffee, but VERY WELL worth the money (and wait, since my boyfriend and I had enough time to play solitare and a couple of games of speed before our food came). The lady noticed that I was vegan when I asked for almond milk with my mocha frappe and she gave me a heads up and let me know they use milk for the base so I ended up just drinking water instead (which is free, they have a cute little water station). I ended up ordering the guru burger and my boyfriend got the vegan wafflewich and we also decided to get the churronimo. It's a quick little breakfast bite but it was so good! I know I'll end up coming here from time to time now that I know about this place.

Another fantastic visit! Had a vanilla cold brew & a waffle breakfast sandwich. The sandwich was DELISH and the coffee is so good that I literally look forward to the one day a week that I can drive across the Valley to have my fix.

Great waffles, coffee and vibe. 5 mins from UNLV can't wait to go back and try a waffle sandwich. The waffle macchiato was amazing! Wish the cashier was a little more friendly considering it was our first time. Didn't really give any suggestions.  Deff worth checking out!
This place had us hooked from day one. May and Tiff are so sweet and very innovative with their menu. I always get the same thing because it's just too damn good. Love the vibe of this place.

Saw a Groupon for this place and was intrigued. I was surprised that after attending UNLV the past few semesters that I had never heard of this place from anyone since it's so close to campus. It's a a whole in the wall with wonderful charm. I really love that there are decks of playing cards at every table and board games to play if you so desire.

Now for the food, my boyfriend and I asked for the cashier's opinion about what was popular and we went with four of her top recommendations. Both she and the guy in the back were super nice and helpful. I ordered the Kale Champ and one of the waffle sandwiches. My boyfriend got a hot caramel coffee (which they brought him a cold version instead of the hot he ordered, but he enjoyed it) and the Elvis banana peanut butter bacon waffles (Seriously amazing, the crispy bacon worked so well with the all the other ingredients, a must have). Everything was really delicious and despite the small mix-up we'll definitely be going back again.

BY FAR MY FAVORITE FOOD SPOT IN LAS VEGAS!

The food, drinks & service are AMAZE BALLS! lol.
Saw that there was a Groupon but we wanted to try it out first.
We ended up buying the Groupon because we knew we would be back for the remainder of our stay :)

You walk in & the menu is to the left. 
I love how it's set up, cafe & you can see them making the food.
They take your order & ask for your name (they will call you name when your order is ready)

The FOODS:
- Lemonade: So yummy! Sweet, just how I like it!
- Tiff's Waffle Macchiato: THE BEST DRINK EVERRRR! lol. It comes with a waffle that is dusted with cinnamon sugar, it's messy but worth the mess. So yummers!
- Pac-Man Waffle: Exactly what it sounds like. Pac-Man shaped waffle with blueberries & raspberries as the thing that Pac-Man eats. Lol. Super cute!
- Vegan Wafflewich: Tomato, spring mix, avocado & Tiabi sauce toasted. Pretty much like a salad in a waffle, sandwich styled. Sooooo good! I ordered this with the Macchiato every time I went here.

The employees are AMAZING! They remembered us & they're super friendly.

I totally recommend this place, RECOMMEND, RECOMMEND! You will not be disappointed!

I really wanted to like this venue as it's a small business & the items on the menu seem fairly tasty,  but the service was lacking. 

We came with a family of four. The kids were served their food & finished eating (20 minutes) before the other food arrived. I was truly floored!  The kids initially wanted to wait for our food to arrive, however, had they waited their food would have been cold. 

We also ordered a side of eggs & bacon to accompany the waffles we ordered. That too was served 20 minutes apart. 

The hostess/owner apologized & said their was a "mixup" but I wasn't impressed with the lack of concern that was given with our poor dining experience. 


I know this is a new venue & only opened a month ago but sometime & effort really needs to be put into the flow of business. We came to eat as a family & that did not happen. I'm extremely disappointed.

My husband took me here for our first breakfast after we got married! It was SO GOOD. Really fun and friendly staff - tasty waffles and great options. I was worried it might be too sweet because I don't have a huge sweet tooth but it was perfect! I couldn't recommend it highly enough! And it's not too pricey either.

Cool, unique, hole in the wall place. Every dish I've had has been great. Staff is always friendly and helpful.
Just a great place overall.

I decided to try this place! It's located in a strip mall near Target! It's small but the service was good and the employees very friendly! I ordered the Viva Las Elvis, which is a waffle with bananas, peanut butter and honey, with bacon cooked into the waffle! It was very tasty! I definitely recommend this place, great taste and fresh ingredients, and a nice change of pace from the pricy strip coffee shops and the waffles are spectacular!

This is a small 3 person operation.  My wife ordered the bananatella Belgian waffle with a nutella drizzle, slivered almonds and whipped cream topping.  I sought nirvana by ordering a hashtag breakfast sandwich - Belgian waffle with turkey sausage, eggs and cheese.  I enhanced my sandwich with a generous douse of breakfast syrup.  Both entrees were very good as was the strawberry sunrise smoothie that we ordered to go.

We chose to eat here at tiabi before our first day at Edc, with my husband and I from Sacramento and a bunch of our friends from Los Angeles, we were really excited to try out this really cute waffle shop. Seeing the pictures and menu on Yelp, I already super intrigued by the banana and Nutella waffle. 
With a big group entering the shop, we were sort of aware that maybe we would have to split up our group to sit down and eat. 
It was self serve, so we each ordered our meal, standing around at first trying to find a spot to sit. Eventually we found a table big enough for us if we all squished together. 
The food sort of took a little while to get to our table, but we did get our drinks first. 
I ordered the Serena tea (or something like that I don't remember), but it was super refreshing. Especially against that Las Vegas heat. Some of our friends had also ordered several other drinks, and they loved theirs as well. 
When our food finally came, we got the sandwiches first. Most of my friends had ordered the west coast sandwich, and they were super pleased with it. Another one of my friend ordered the Thai chicken and he was really glad with that one as well.
Overall I'd say that tiabi was pretty satisfying for my group of friends. Although small, it does give off a comfortable vibe. Very easy going and relaxed, the customer service was also pretty great.

We randomly found this place on google and thought we'd give it a shot. We're always looking for local restaurants to try in Vegas and this one did not disappoint!! 

The staff is incredibly friendly and genuine. You can tell they at happy to serve you. They smile when they work and seems like they all love what they do, like it's more than just a job to them. They also take the time to get to know their customers. While we were there, they greeted multiple customers by name and had casual conversations with them.

There are a lot of options on the menu, for both drinks and food. We got the Viva Las Elvis (amazing), Tiff's Waffle Macchiato (amazing), Hashtag Breakfast Sandwich (good, but sausage seemed like it was a frozen patty), and Snickers Latte (good, not too chocolatey).
 
Overall, this place is a gem! We'll definitely be coming back :)

The atmosphere was perfect! It was just the right amount of cozy and chill, and the noise level was just right. The brew of the day was Guatemalan which I loved because I could drink it black. It wasn't too bitter and I felt it was sweeter then most other beans. I had the hashtag breakfast which was tasty. The waffle had a good balance of softness and crunchy. I also had a side of chips which I believe were barbecue flavor and it was way better than the Lay's ones. 10/10 would want to come here again to try their other items like the normal waffles or the dessert waffle taco.

This place is a amazing find!!! Found them in a deal on groupon! This will be a stop on everyone of our Vegas trips! They have incredible food and the service was fantastic. Told them I was lactose free and the made my coffee with soy for me and even gave me the vegan waffle on my sandwich since the other one has milk in it - so nice of them to care!! The food was so fresh - they made the waffle on the spot as you order! I had the west coast and my husband has the break the fast - both delicious! We will be back. Clean restaurant too! Thanks for the yummy food! We will be back!

I heard great things about this place from a lot of UNLV students, so I had to check it out. I expected it to be just a waffle. While I really like waffles, I can also make them at home, so they are usually just okay, in my opinion.

I ordered the waffledilla sandwich without tiabi sauce. It was spectacular. The flavor of the waffle is off the charts. It had just the right about the sweetness, and the texture was a perfect balance of soft and crispy. The chicken was also moist, and I really enjoyed the whole thing. The chips are also pretty good too, which was unexpected as, again, they are just chips. 

Finally, for dessert I had the cinnamon sugar covered waffle with ice cream. It was really good. I surprisingly enjoyed my sandwich more, though, because the sandwich was more so something that I would not be able to replicate at home. 

Tiabi also frequently has living social or Groupon deals, so this place ends up being super, super cheap. 

I will definitely be back for more.

Went here for the first time the other day before class and it was a little hard to find at first, but the atmosphere is great and the chocolate coconut iced latter was wonderful! I didn't get a chance to have a waffle but they smelled great. Wifi is secure which is nice, but a little loud if you're trying to study

I went with a group of seven and all of our dishes were great. Their smoothies are large and super refreshing. Great vegan options, highly recommend the Elvis (yum!) The workers took their time to perfect all the waffles which made the wait time worth while.

I visited this place for the first time last week and will definitely be coming back.  I ordered a large Tiff's Waffle Macchiato.  Compared to other coffee shops, the menu at Tiabi is reasonably priced.  My large macchiato was $4.75, and it came with a churro waffle. The macchiato was delicious and had a prominent coffee flavor while also tasting sweet from the caramel and vanilla.  I wish the churro waffle contained more cinammon sugar just like an actual churro, but it was still good.

I loved how there were playing cards at the sit down tables, and my friend and I ended up staying way longer than we expected from playing a game of cards.

Had what I honestly consider to be the best waffle I've ever tasted in my life. Bacon, egg, and cheese on a crisp, soft-centered, golden brown waffle with Siracha sauce and maple syrup so good it probably just came from Mayor Rob Ford's favorite Canadian Maple tree. So good I'm just going to crush some work and stick around for lunch too (apparently they do burgers and sandwiches on waffles too?) Check this place out if you're in town. You'll be glad you did.

Incredibly good. So good. My avocado was a little hard. It that couldn't overcome the rest of what was going on with that waffle sandwich. My new favorite place in Vegas. No Smoke. Woot woot. Had a Red Bull Apple Cider. Shazam!!!  Order it.
This place is amazing! If you're looking for amazing breakfast and lunch this is the place to be! Very trendy and the environment is fun! We're definitely coming back!

Great waffles and coffee specialties. Nice atmosphere and very friendly service! 
We came here on a Tuesday morning and it was not crowded at all so we could order right away. 
We had the banana waffles and the one with strawberries. Both were really nice. The latte and the cappuccino were very nice, too. 
I can definitely recommend this place if you like a sweet breakfast!

I found Tiabi through Groupon, and I am so glad I did! I have been here so many times. The coffee is great, the waffles are yummy (I have only tasted the savory ones). I think Tiabi is excellent for a quick bite.

The establishment, itself, is very clean and well maintained. The ambiance is relaxing and inviting.

The individuals working here are awesome, welcoming, and provide excellent customer service. I have been greeted by someone every time I have stepped into Tiabi. 

TLDR: Service is excellent, atmosphere is relaxing, and coffee/food is yummy!

I think I may be in heaven. I found this place by luck since I am going to an event at the Clark County Library. When I walked inside, the batista was very friendly. There is so much to eat and choose for, but it's not overwhelming: it makes me want to come back and try more! With this being my first visit, I got the Tiff ' s Waffle Macchiato. Why yes I would love a waffle with my coffee. As I'm writing my review, I'm thinking of ordering more food because I need these speciality waffles (breakfast, lunch, and dessert) in my life.  I just received my drink. First sip and I am in love.

(Vegan here) I had a lavender latte (sub dark for white chocolate, and almond for dairy milk) and the churro waffle, sans honey, drizzled w syrup, topped w non dairy ice cream and it could not have been better. Friendly service, clean, unique character. Recommend!

Recently hit up this ADORABLE spot on our recent trip to Vegas since we had a groupon and oh man was it worth the trip from the strip! 

The place itself is adorable and throughout my various trips to Vegas (yes, we explore off strip, weird I know), it seems like small local businesses just aren't as popular like here in Austin so I love to see that..but I digress. 

Onto the yummies: The hashtag breakfast sandwich was the shit. Not too heavy but totally delicious and filling! The waffle my fiancé had was outstanding! Forget what it was called but it had Nutella and pretty much blew my mind. 

The owners were there and we chit chatted and they were so nice!! Wonderful food, GREAT staff, and overall a much needed break from the Vegas strip. Can't wait to try it out again in April when we go back!

Waffle bar. Those two words were what initially lured me into this place. I mean, who could resist the thought of personalized-topped waffles? Add the incentive of a groupon, and I'm on it...but unfortunately, I have to say that I was slightly disappointed both times I went.

I had gone to eat here when they had opened a few months ago. I didn't particularly have an optimal experience - my boyfriend's hashtag waffles were served a little cold, and though we were the only customers there, I remember we had to wait a good amount of time for our food to arrive. I understand that this place was just starting out and just getting into the groove of things, so I chalked it up to that factor and refrained from writing a negative review. Additionally, the location is kind of sketchy, but they have no control over that really. 

Flash forward. I decided to give it another shot a few months later. I ordered a dirty mocha chai and a West Coast waffle sandwich (bacon, chicken strips, avocado, tomato and cheese), which was the same exact order I had the first time around. The sandwich is what I'm giving the extra star for. It's worth a try, pretty good. It was better this time too as far as the amount of toppings go. Very filling. 

The bad news: Service time is still pretty lousy. I even added the pre-tip in hopes of speeding up our food, but it was in vain. The employees are friendly, but I was expecting a smoother and more efficient delivery. They should train the people in charge of preparing the food a lot better. It shouldn't take long to make a waffle and add the trimmings. Especially if the trimmings don't require much maintenance and cooking at all. I'm all about trying small businesses and was really rooting for their success, but it was just disappointing to see that this place hasn't fully quite worked out its kinks yet.
Amazing vegan waffles, I loved the guru burger. We were just driving BG through Vegas and had been looking for vegan waffles since we left Virginia. We were not disappointed.

Amazing small business owned by 2 women of Guam!! I first found this place in search of white espresso! I moved here from Seattle so you can imagine we are well known for our love for coffee. Anyway, the yummy looking food and coffee pictures is what summoned my family and I! As we pulled up we seen a Guam sticker proudly represented on the entry way! It made me feel proud to be a Chamorru but even prouder to see a small uniquely owned island business in sin city! Strange how this place stuck out and so happened to be of the same cultural background. Amazing customer service by the young lady and man who was working. She thoroughly explained good items in which we were interested in regardless of how many questions we threw at her. I myself being a server in the food industry know how tedious it could be. We ordered a few items off the menu! 
Red velvet waffle 
Maple and beacon waffle 
Southwest waffle sandwich
Banananutella
And the Tia waffle iced mac. Coffee

All tasted lovely and reasonably priced! Go support a small island owned business!

I found this place on Groupon and had to stop by after reading the yelp reviews. The shop itself was not very busy at the time, so it gave us some time to chat with the owners. They were super friendly and gave us recommendations on all their yummy waffles. I ordered the red velvet waffle, nutella wafflenut, and a Hey! Arnold. I loved everything, but the Hey! Arnold which is just an Arnold Palmer (cute name though!). My boyfriend ordered the Amaretto Power which was really good! We had a nice breakfast together & definitely recommend!

This place is my new favorite for breakfast or lunch. Their waffles are EXCELLENT, and who knew you could make a slammin savory sandwich or burger with waffles? SO FREAKING GOOD!! The smoothies are also delicious. I'm vegan and gluten free. The waffles are already vegan, just ask for the gluten free mix. They are super friendly and accommodating. Try the coconut bacon and the banana peanut butter smoothie. And the Tiabi sauce is great. Yay, waffles...!!
A good quick quiet brunch stop. Clean, soft good tunes, a gathering place with cards on the table. Simple tasty waffles. Coffee better than Starbucks - and I'm not saying their coffee is bad.

My first time here! Coming to get a cup of coffee and waffle before going to wait my lunch at Oyster bar. The staff was super nice!! I had so many requests and she was very patient to listen to me and explain to the barista! Will come back again for sure on my next Vegas trip :) 

Nutella waffle and honey creme latte are recommend!

I love waffles! I saw this on Yelp and I had to make a visit. It was a cute place. Good atmosphere. I got the hashtag breakfast sandwich, which was good, but it wasn't amazing. It was a waffle sandwich with turkey sausage, egg and cheese served with fruit. Something I could make at home. I also got the "Honey I'm Home" dessert waffle. It was like a churro waffle with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and I loved it! TIABI is good, but not amazing compared to other waffle sandwich places I've visited in California. Their waffles aren't as good quality. Other places are more light, crispy and fresh.

On a business trip to Vegas and was craving for some waffles. A buddy and I decided to check out some waffle house with good rating and we decided to give this a go. And it was forsure a good pick. Food was great and the avocado smoothie was amazing! Definitely recommended

This is a very small place with two ladies working the orders.  They are pretty slow, but everything is made fresh to order. They have playing cards on the table, and after a 20 minute wait, we found out why. 

I got the Mango tea, which was very good.  I am not a big sweets person so I put very little sweet and low in my tea if any.  This flavor did not need any sweetener. 

Then I ordered their B.A.T. on waffle instead of bread. It was just ok.  The waffle seemed overdone to me and the sandwich was lacking taste.  Nice fruit side bowl, but strawberries were on their last leg. 

I think most of the positive reviews were for the waffle desserts. So if I ever come back again, then I will stick to the sweet side of the menu, even though sweets are not my favorite.

Amazing waffles. Amazing coffee. Amazing prices. What more can you ask for? 

Everything that we got was delicious. The snickers iced coffee was perfect, and the bananatella waffle tasted as good as it looked. Will definitely come back when we return to Las Vegas. I highly recommend this place!
Had the west coast waffwich and it wasn't what I expected. It exceeded it! Great job guys. Def be back.
Great selections and coffee! Waffles are too crispy..almost burnt! I would recommend asking for them not to cook your waffle so long, unless you like them that way!
Found them next to our favorite sushi place. Delicous red velvet waffles with a pistachio latte.. yes please.

Really cool they have real freshly made waffles. The works are super polite. Got the breakfast sandwich with beacon and eggs. Too bad the eggs and beacon are industrial made thousands of miles away. They taste and look totally unfresh. Too bad.

Went here from the Strip on my vacation with the Groupon deal and enjoyed it!  Had the Waffle Breakfast sandwich and it was pretty good, could have used more sausage though.  The owners/cooks/cashiers were very friendly and helpful and really made us feel welcome on our visit.  They explained the whole menu and asked where we were from and were very helpful in deciding what we should have.  You should check it out!

Um the frankestien coffee has five shots of expresso and it made me tired...  It's over priced coffee and I've tried a few flavors for 5$ really isn't worth going there.  It's good to try it once and try a unique coffee.  Waffles are weird

Still full of Awesomeness...no matter which waffle I try I have yet to be disappointed.  And you can get anything you want gluten free and vegan.

On this particular visit 3-7-16 I believe one of the owners was in the store because the staff was not as warm and friendly as in the past.  There was a totally different vibe in here then in the past 3 or 4 visits.

Not sure what was going on but the food was still amazing, the drinks were amazing and this is a place I not only highly recommend but will come back to as well.

To me this is one of those places you just cannot seem to get enough of.  You can get breakfast or lunch stuff anytime and you always leave satisfied.

Finally after the longest time being in my bookmarks, I got to try this place today!! Located in the shopping center on the corner of Maryland Pkwy & Flamingo with the Target, next to Sakana. Clean and spacious on the inside and I like that they had playing cards on the tables, feels like a place you could spend an hour or two catching up with friends.

I was pretty surprised at how large their drink and food menus were! They have coffee based drinks, frappes, smoothies, teas, and other non-coffee drinks. Cool selections like Red Velvet, Chocolate Coconut, Honey Cream Latte, Java Jolt, Kale Smoothie & Raspberry Lemonade! Tons of different options! My boyfriend and I settled on the Chocolate Coconut Latte and non blended White Chocolate Tuxedo. The Coconut one had some coffee but I'm pretty sure the White Chocolate one didn't. Great flavors but I was expecting them to be more coffee based. The White Chocolate Tuxedo tasted Iike a World Class Chocolate ice cream shake from Baskin Robbins! Both super tasty and an amazing price at $3.75 & $4. Score!

Now the food items! Waffles, waffle sandwiches, salads and desserts! I was also pretty suprised at the amount of vegan items they had! I think I counted about 9 options for food, Awesome! We settled on the West Coast waffle sandwich. Oh and all waffle sandwiches can be substituted with ciabatta bread. It came with chicken, tiabi sauce (vegan aioli), avocado, bacon, cheese and tomato. I was expecting some tiny thing but it was kind of around the size of a 6 in' sub. And for $5.99! Perfect! The waffle was nice and fluffy, had great flavors, and filling!

Our bill for the three items was $17.84 (including tax & 20% tip)! I will definitely be back especially since it's near UNLV. Thank goodness as I was getting tired of all the Chipotle-styled bowl & burrito places. Yummo!

Not bad. I come here because it is so close to UNLV. Good drinks- try the waffle macchiato! 
Food is A-OK. I like that they have vegetarian and vegan options, but the waffles and sandwiches aren't anything too amazing or memorable to me. It's worth a try if you're really into waffles, but for me the food menu items are just whatever. So far I've had the cinnamon waffle, elvis, and vegetarian wafflewich. I'll keep trying more items and update if anything deserves recognition.
The location is a bit shabby so I make sure to bring my stuff with me. I wouldn't think of this place as comfortable- so it's not a place that you would want to study at. Eat, chat a bit with friends, and go. 
As for customer service, don't expect too much. They get the order done. 

Groupon has some deals for this business ($24 for $12 or so), so be sure to check that out.

this place is delicious! it lets you get your cup of Joe and a little more!
the customer service is great!! they're all so nice! The ambiance is relaxing and you can just sit around and read your favorite book :)

I've been going to this place since the open in 2013 and it's stayed a favorite of mine. The staff is always friendly and before they expanded, it was the owners Tiffany and Mae working everyday and they would try to know everyone personally. The drinks and food are great but it's even better knowing you're supporting genuine people. 

If you're into coffee, they have some quality beans and drinks for you. If not there are smoothies and teas. Lots of veggie options for food, which is nice but they pretty much cater to any preference. They are from Guam, and I've found that islanders have a pallet that leans more towards sweet flavors, so expect that when ordering food lol. It's not a bad thing, you can definitely taste that a lot of their inspiration comes from their home. Food is made fresh and to order. 

Anyway, check this spot out and tip your baristas.

Guru burger is the best veggie burger ive had in vegas (besides the ones I make) 

Its just a boca burger i think, but its just so delicious wrapped up in a fresh waffle! 

The vegan viva las elvis was tasty, but a bit skimpy on the toppings.

The lady who helped us was very friendly and helpful. I forgot to get her name but we went at 7 or 8 am on thursday.    

Lattes with Lots of unique flavors here (like pistacchio) 

Next time ill try the churro waffle!

I wish the prices were a bit lower or the portions a bit bigger, but overall i was very happy with my visit and cant beleive i waited 2 years to try it!!! Will def be a regualr!

Absolute best place to get waffles in Vegas. The waffle has an excellent texture and is soo tasty. The whipped cream on the top is one of the best parts.
The sandwiches are also really good. 
The kale champ smoothie is good if you're a fan of kale. If you don't like kale try a fruity smoothie because you can still taste it.
So far I haven't had a bad meal here!

Got here at 11:15am today for brunch. The cashier told us that it's gonna be a 15-20 minute wait and since we were hungry and didn't wanna go anywhere before my friend's flight, we opted to wait. 

I ordered a breakfast waffle and iced coffee, while my friend ordered a smoothie, latte and west coast wafflewich. 11:45 and still no food or drinks. The place was packed and there's only 3 employees- 1 cashier and 2 food prep staff. 

Since it was already 12:00, we decided to take our food to-go. Coffee was okay. Nothing special. The waffle was crisp and crunchy which was good. Breakfast wafflewich was delicious but needs a little maple syrup, which we didn't get to have anymore bec we took the food to-go. Prices are reasonable. 

I'll think about whether giving this place another try. Otherwise, they should add more staff.

My constant companion and I decided to try this place after an excursion to Target.  Despite living in the area, and walking as my primary mode of transportation, I hadn't noticed this place before as it is tucked away on the East side of the Target shopping center.

What a delightful find!  This corner of Las Vegas is not known for it's culinary delights, and Tiabi Coffee & Waffle is a gem.  We ordered a nutella, banana, and almond waffle which was delicious, and my constant companion ordered some sort of coffee.

Honestly, I'm not a huge coffee drinker, but my constant companion didn't seem overly awestruck by the coffee.  The waffle was delicious, though, and the waffles at the tables near ours looked equally scrumptious.  I look forward to slowly eating my way through the entire menu in future visits.

I definitely recommend as this as one of the better breakfast places in the immediate area, and the waffles beat any of the waffle/crepe places I've eaten at on the Strip.  Definitely worth moving off the Blvd for a better breakfast meal at a much better price.

Sampled the southwest waffle sandwich and while I enjoyed the combination of ingredients I felt that the waffle itself was satisfactory. The waffle was not as crispy as I liked it and almost a little under cooked. The interior of the cafe was cute and I felt that it would be a cool place for friends to hang out.

My husband and I visited this place while we were in vegas for our one year anniversary.  We give this place 5 stars. Taste is great and menu is original. It is a smaller joint and if busy be prepared to wait. Love the food, environment, and music. Would come back here if we visit vegas again.

I really want this place to succeed (who wouldn't want two young entrepreneurs to be successful?)  but some improvements are needed. We were lured here by a Groupon offer. I hope this critique is viewed by the owners and taken into consideration with this in mind. I love the concept of a waffles and coffee shop. Our coffees and waffles were very tasty and we did enjoy the food (maple bacon and red velvet). However, a place that specializes in waffles really needs more than one regular waffle iron and I would also like to see the option of a Belgian waffle added. Heck there are even waffle irons that make waffles shaped like the state of Texas...that would be a fun addition. Invest in more waffle irons! When ordering coffee to drink in the restaurant it is much, much better served in a glass coffee cup/mug. The paper plates and very cheap plastic utensils did not provide the best presentation. At the very least try to budget for a better quality of eating utensils. Again- the coffee (an iced snickers coffee, a latte and a cupcake coffee) were all very good, so maybe glass mugs can be added to make them perfect. The atmosphere is okay but I would encourage the addition of some cozier seating and décor...I would have ordered another coffee and stayed longer. I liked the chalkboard wall. The place was a bit cluttered with trash, overflowing trash cans and our table was sticky with dried syrup from what seemed to be days old. There were no pastries in the pastry case which made me sad. The music was too loud at first but was adjusted and included a nice variety of genres. This place has big potential. I realize it takes a lot of money to open a business and hopefully the owners can make some adjustments and improvements to make Tiabi a place to return to. Good luck girls!

I was looking for something breakfast-y, about 1230 PM on Sunday. I had seen this place since I live in ghetto area around here--it's in the Target shopping center. I dropped in and it smelled great.
I'll admit I'm not a big fan of waffles (prefer eggs/hashbrowns kind of breakfast) but the menu of waffles looked interesting.
I tried the waffle with bacon inside. When the server was getting it ready, she asked me if I wanted butter and I said no, which was okay. 
At any rate, waffle was good, bacon was crisp and I switched out the sugar free syrup for real stuff. The downside was that sadly, I was still sort of hungry but decided not to order another one :) Price is reasonable.
I don't do coffee, so I can't speak to any those offerings.
I'll go back and try it again sometime.
Kinda disappointed... I search good coffee on Yelp and show this shop. I got signatures drink ... coffee was okay. Maybe I should get waffles... next time I'll get waffle not coffee

Just had a sugar free frappe , hazelnut. Quite good. They give you a choice 5 of many different types of milk, so that's nice to be able to choose.  Nice atmosphere. .. no smoking.  Music not too loud.

Is there anyone here willing to argue that waffles aren't delicious? That's right, I rest my case. 


Anyway, this place was not exactly what I expected when I read the Yelp reviews... I was picturing a cute little café with table service. What I got was essentially a coffee shop that happened to have waffles in a strip mall. This is not necessarily a bad thing, it just was completely unexpected. I was planning on getting a waffle and egg sandwich, until I found out that they use those weird egg patty things (they don't, you know, cook an egg), so that was out. Ended up getting the Elvis, waffle with peanut butter, bacon, and banana.... of course this was good, how could that be bad?!?! I also had their specialty latte with the cinnamon that comes with a triangle of the cinnamon vegan waffle (got the latte sans vanilla syrup, you know, being healthy and all... lol).... oh ya, super tasty. Definitely a dessert. The waffle was crisp and delicious, the latte was sweet and dessert -y. The breakfast was cheap and satisfying. I would return!

Super enthusiastic & excitable staff.  They were excited to know that we're local (I'm British so easy to assume I'm a tourist.)  Completely sold us on the Vegan Choc Chip Cookies and even brought out a free sample before we dove in. The people working there today are a real credit to the shop and the owners should be proud to have such devoted staff.

Onto the food, we got the Guru Burger on Ciabatta & Vegas Wafflewich.  It was amazing, enough said.

Verdict: We'll be back....

This place really took a beating on Yelp from some of my friends. Did they have a bad day or what? Maybe they've just improved overall? I love this place so far.

TIABI has been over on Maryland near Flamingo for a quite a while now. Maybe it's just out of sight, out of mind for me (since I haven't been to neighboring restaurants like Sakana that often), but it's certainly not too far from one of my workplaces. I was able to stop by for lunch to try their menu at long last.

They seem to be having some issues with music skipping (streaming lag perhaps), but it's a pretty quiet place either way with plenty of seating for studying or just enjoying food and drink. Baristas have all been friendly so far, and it was easy to use the Groupons that I'd recently purchased.

The iced Snickers coffee ($3.35 for 20 oz large size) is appealing, even mildly addictive. Although it doesn't perfectly capture the peanut-y essence of the candy bar, its chocolate and hazelnut combo are a reasonably sweet flavor fusion that provide both fuel and happiness. Plus, it's quite reasonably priced compared to other places.

The West Coast waffle sandwich ($6.59) is an obvious choice for a savory lunch. I was pleased first and foremost by the lightly crispy and spongy, fluffy waffle that's creased so that you can just pick it up. The chicken and bacon satisfied my carnivorous sensibilities. The delicious, fresh veggies (avocado, tomato) brightened the dish up. Finally, although the sauce wasn't that distinctive alone, it served as a perfect complement. Nothing was limp about any of this.

I went for the Pumpkin Truffle Latte ($4.65 for a large) on my second visit, opting for hot rather than iced. What a treat. It's a perfectly sweet, creamy drink with a moderate spice accent, and I wish it wasn't just a seasonal item. Maybe if I just ask nicely and bat my eyes, it won't be just seasonal? It's the drink that has finally sold me on that whole annual fad.

I also had the seasonal Zombie Waffle ($6.50). This red velvet waffle has bacon cooked on the inside. I had to ask because they're not immediately visible, but using a knife (obtainable at a station near the counter) to cut and even cross-section the waffle, I saw the thin fatty strips. This dough otherwise had the same texture as my wafflewich, which means it rocked. Flavor-wise, it's actually mostly savory, with the chocolate syrup drizzle serving more to accentuate the red velvet batter than to tilt the balance toward sweetness. This also needs to be a year-round treat.

TIABI has impressed me so much on my two visits that I wish I hadn't been so apathetic before. It's a great spot for caffeine and fuel to carry you through the day, and I'll be back even after I use the last of my Groupon 3-pack.

Yummmmm! Hubby and I shared 3 different waffle sandwiches this morning and all 3 were phenomenal! We will definitely be back... There are so many more menu options to try! Not to mention coffees and smoothies... Gotta try the kale champ smoothie... So good!
Cute little place. Seemingly startup and had delicious waffles and coffee both iced and hot in mason jars(iced). Vegan and regular waffle options available in all flavored and styles.  Very good!

The place has a really nice vibe to it. Very laid back, but the wait was a little too long. My girlfriend and I waited for at least 20 minutes for two sandwiches and a shake. The sandwiches and their prices were good, but they weren't that very filling for a person who is hungry. I'd like to come back here, but maybe on a slow day or when I'm not in a rush.
Cute coffee shop off the strip.  Coffee was good and the waffles were nice and crispy.  We ordered the waffle macchiato, tuxedo frapp and the Thai chicken waffle sandwich.

Omnomnomnom. We came here after reading a review on a vegan website. I'm the only vegan so we love finding yummy places that have vegan options. 

We had the new vegan waffle burger, a caramel syrup macchiato with almond milk, a hashtag breakfast sandwich with bacon waffles, kisses waffle, and a strawberry sunrise smoothie. Everything was nom to the max (see first line). The sauce with the new vegan burger sandwich was amazing and we loved everything else. 

The employees were very friendly and we loved playing cards while our food came. Thanks, Tiabi, for a great breakfast and living up to the hype! We'll be back.

Food is really good! However, the service is very time consuming  tuxedo frappe was amazing along with the Tokyo wafflewich! Definitely come by and enjoy one of their wafflewiches if you have the time!

Fantastic food and coffee. We were all happy about our selections - the waffles are way better than anticipated as part of a sandwich or a quesadilla. The food took longer than expected for a counter service restaurant, but it was delicious and creative.

Tasty, but realistically 5-7$ for a single thin waffle is a little steep. Can't comment on any of their drinks, but their waffles were very light and crispy. 

To the guy who gave them a 3 star rating for their decor alone, I don't know what you're smoking but you really ought to stop.
店員さんも親切で美味しかったです。コーヒーの種類が多いのでコーヒー好きには、良いかも〜私は紅茶派なので、ちょっと残念。ワッフルは、美味しかったです。

Tiabi aptly stands for "To Inspire and Be Inspired" and I was inspired to stuff my face hole with waffles.  

Visited on Sunday 6-26-16 at 10AM.   $28.34 got us a breakfast waffle sandwich, two drinks, a side of fruit, a cookie, and a variety waffle. This restaurant is located two doors down from Sakana on Flamingo & Maryland behind Target.  

I had the viva las elvis waffle for $6.99 which is a waffle topped with honey, peanut butter, bananas, and chopped bacon.  I was literally in heaven.  It's one of the best things I've ever eaten.  My only complaint would be they serve real maple syrup which I hate...I'd rather have the fake Aunt Jamima stuff clogging up my arteries and killing me slowly.  #DIABEETUS

I also had the Tiff's Waffle Macchiato for $3.95.  I had the iced version and it was wonderful.  I loved the whipped cream topping and the waffle on top was still warm and covered in cinnamon and sugar.  

Service was fast and friendly.  I highly recommend this place.

I got the West Coast, and it tastes awesome! Couple it with syrup and it tastes amazing! My wife got the Banatella with strawberries instead of bananas and a side of vanilla ice cream and milk. Overall, I'm from Cali but I'm hitting up this place every time I come! Totally recommend!!

This place was amazing and awesome and this is my new regular spot. I'm glad Ian told me to stop by and the Vegas option was great. I took a bite of her sandwich and was already prepared to be disgusted but it was actually amazing. I got a west coast and had to come back for the breakfast sandwich

Delicious pumpkin latte best I've ever had. I order this at many different coffee shops and always get a sugar punch to the throat. This one is not over syrup grossness, it's perfect. The organic toasty Tokyo is light and delicious too!

Unfortunately, only 1 waffle maker was working when me and my party of 8! came in. I'm sure rolling out one dish at a time is not the norm. Personally, I don't get waffles as sandwich breads. But, everyone else in my party will give this place 4 or 5 stars for the food. Customer service and coffees were on point.
Bacon inside my waffle mmm. Had breakfast there yesterday and really considering going back for lunch today. Tiffs waffle macchiato is fantastic! Love Tiffy and Mae. Love Tiabi.

Eh... Was going to order waffles but they had no ice cream, so I went with the avocado drink. Ummmm... No bueno. Too much ice, no flavor, and I don't think the avocado was ripe enough. I make avocado drinks and it should turn somewhat green. My drink was a pale green yellow. The lady was nice so I gave her a star and then another star for the drink. Absolute fail. Sorry guys... Just speaking the truth. Make the avacado drink more milky less icy. Or just don't call it a smoothie cause it's far from that.

This little waffle bar is adorable. It has a cozy ambiance. It is clean and the staff is friendly (hugely important). 

The waffles and sandwiches are warm and light and infused with amazing flavors and unique combinations. They are healthy comfort food stepped up a notch!

Add coffee, tea, smoothies and a laptop or a friend and you've got your morning or afternoon neighborhood place to go if you just want to kick back and you're not in a hurry. 

Bravo! Well done Taibi! You get it!

I love this place!!! I love that it's not super busy. The waffles are so soft and fluffy and perfect. I plan on coming back many many times. I attend UNLV and it is so close to campus that it is perfect for an after school lunch, snack, coffee, etc.

This place is a must when you visit Vegas. Its a little way off the beaten track but worth the short trip from the strip.  My husband and I got the west coast and hash tag breakfast sandwich and strawberry sunrise smoothie. The west coast was good BUT the hash tag breakfast sandwich was hands down..the best waffle sandwich I ever had. The waffle was so airy, fluffy, and buttery and the sausage and egg was puuuurrrfect. The smoothie was the best I ever had.  The guy at the register was so chill and patient while we couldn't make up our mind! We also had a red velvet lollie and it was was such a treat. I give this place 2 thumbs up!

There is nothing like the smell of fresh waffles and coffee in Tiabi!!!
As soon as I walked in I was engulfed by the smell of butter, sugar, and the smell hot irons. I thought I walking through heaven, this is intense.  

These guys have a great list of waffles ranging from sweet to savory.
My favorite sweet waffle is the Vivas Las Elvis
Bananas, peanut butter, chopped bacon and honey on a Belgian waffle. Vegan version-sub bacon and honey for almonds and agave.

I believe the place stands out for the Wafflewiches.  
The West Coast wafflewich is chicken, tomato, avocado and bacon in between a toasted waffle.
The lightly crunch with the saltiness of the chicken and bacon combination is over the top.
Definitely something you must try!

On top of that they make fabulous coffee too, complements the food.
They carry all types of coffee you would expect with few specialties the one I'm eager to try is Tiff's Waffle Machiato; Cinnamon vanilla latte, whipped cream and caramel sauce and served with a churronimo waffle on top. 

The customer service there outstanding!! 
Mae is a delightful person and shes cool to have conversation with. I was fortunate to have similar food interests with her as far as finding new things in town to eat. 

I'll definitely be going back!!

It seems to be so rare at times, but they've got it here. Perfect customer service. Friendly, cheerful, helpful, inviting. Felt like I'd known them for years or were neighbors. Food was great too. Need more tables, but place was clean. Music cheerful and modern indie. They thanked everyone too as they left. This was our last stop on our visit to Vegas this trip. I'll be back in a week and likely swing by for breakfast again. I got the golden waffles.
We drove 20 minutes from our hotel to get to this little spot and I'm glad we did. It's unique and the waffles were worth the wait. West coast waffle and the chocolate coconut latte were amazing!!!

The waffle sandwhiches are amazing. Very light but still filling and very fresh. Staff is extremely friendly and it has a very comfortable atmosphere with comfy couches, as well as tables and chairs. And wifi ;)

As I'm writing this review, my mouth is watering. I found this spot on Groupon. After some confusion about using 3 separate groupons for 1 person, we were able to order. Based on the line behind me, I knew the food should be good. I had the Churronimo which is the vegan waffle with cinnamon sugar and a latte. OMG, I normally don't order cinnamon sugar items but this was so good. This makes me wanna leave Maryland and hike it to Nevada. The "chefs" were friendly and accommodating. My only gripe is that it took a long time to get our food. Other than that, I would go back in a heartbeat.

Best waffles I ever had! Nice and crispy on the outside with a beautiful golden brown color to it, and absolutely delicious fluffy insides~ Just as a waffle should be! Menu is very healthy, me and my boyfriend visited for a small breakfast and it was wonderful! I got a waffle macchiato, which is a splendid coffee toped with whipped cream and a waffle piece on top. The waffle was covered in a cinnamon sugar, so yummy! We also tried some kale chocolate chip cookies, don't be afraid of the color (or kale haha) they were soft and mosit and very delicious! You can't even taste the kale that much~ Great place for waffles or coffee (or both ;D) we will be visiting again to try out more of their menu!

Hastag breakfast is surprisingly McD like, just with waffles instead of buns! West Coast Wafflewich is delightful, just right for those who like small morning bites. Maple Bacon Waffle has Bacon made into the Waffle! That's another pleasant surprise. 

Strawberry Sunrise and Banana Berry is both very good healthy smoothie.

I love their waffles, crunchy and light! We had a golden waffle with green tea ice cream and a West Coast Wafflesich, the food is clean and fresh. If you like something light and refreshing(more of a Japanese taste than American style), definitely come here!

The have an interesting, diverse menu, but I've never had anything I didn't like. The staff and owners are awesome people with a passion for food. Everything is reasonably priced and you get a satisfying meal every time. Love it.

The first of its name! The prodigal child of both coffee and waffle! The place where it all started and the original bringer of delicious not to all. My experiences are short here but oh so memorable. It is comforting to have the consistency in flavors and service that I have come to look forward in my every day life on both sides of town. I know come here and expect to get any one of their signature drinks or waffles and it to blow away my taste buds like no other. I also know that I can see the same great attitude and customer service from anyone in the staff. They are all kind and eager to help in any way they can and are always professional. If I ever find myself frequenting this location as much as the location in the north I know I will never be disappointed which is something that few coffee or waffle or both can guarantee so well as they do. No matter where you are in Vegas do not be afraid to venture out or go somewhere so delectable that should blow your mind. I know when I see opportunity for something Fantastic I am always down. Ps. I am always excited to see the new items they have to offer. Yum!

I came to Tiabi to scope it out for future use with my dessert meet up. I am not hugely familiar with that area, but it was easy enough to find. Up the street from the Boulevard Mall, in the Target parking lot. 

When I arrived I was kind of nervous because we were the only people there on a Saturday around 4pm. I took the lack of business as a bad sign, but I was wrong!! Maybe not enough people know about it?? I'm not sure, but if you aren't going to Tiabi, you are totally missing out.

As I said, this was a recon mission, so I had to order a little of everything, right?? We ordered 3 of the Wafflenuts - the white chocolate macadamia, the red velvet, and a vanilla one that wasn't listed on the menu. For waffles we got the Strawberry Kiss, but instead of strawberries we subbed bananas (on a Belgian waffle) and customized a classic waffle with blueberries and white chocolate. Everything was fantastic!! Everything was cooked to order perfectly. Hot, melty, sweet and so delicious!! I almost always get a to go box, and this is one of the few times ever that it was so good...I couldn't stop. No to go box needed.

The have lots more on the menu I would like to try...including their coffees. I am excited to go back. I, also, heard there might be ice cream coming in the near future. Fingers crossed!!

You should definitely check them out. They are worth a drive even if you don't live down that way. They are pretty affordable...$20 for everything I ordered plus a bottle of water. Portions are perfect...not too big or too small. The establishment is clean and relaxed. They have games and decks of cards on the table should the mood strike. Staff is super friendly and helpful.

I will definitely be back!

Atmosphere: naturally well lit, café style layout with open counter and free WiFi.

Beverage: pistachio latte with no expresso. Very tasty and addictive. Dipped my strawberries in it and was great.

Food: chicken berry salad with waffles. Super fresh and abundantly flavorful. Waffles make a neat crouton like crunch. Waffles are light and crispy crunchy with light soft inside. 

Waffle breakfast sandwich was delicious. The cheese was great.

Service: very friendly and bubbly like. Offered more dressing and asked if we needed any else a few times. No gossiping behind counter unlike most casino cafes. They seemed all very happy, adding to the light atmosphere. 

Clean restrooms

Definitely going back.

I heard from some people in the neighborhood that a new waffle place opened up right down the street on Flamingo & Maryland Pky, so I had to try!

It's a small order at the counter type of place, but everything is reasonably priced (use a Yelp! check-in to get 15% off, or UNLV students get a discount as well!)  The special here is waffles done in all sorts of ways (with toppings, or as a sandwich in some cases).  

I went with a waffle with almonds, bananas and Nutella on it for about $6.  The taste of it was OK, presented and cooked well, but nothing too special about the batter.  The disadvantage was it took what seemed like forever to get it (maybe just because I was hungry?).  I also got a hot chocolate which was just so-so.

For the price it's a wonderful place, and it's close to Target so I could see coming here for brunch and doing some shopping, I know I'll be back, but the location and low pricing is the main driver.

I had an amazing red velvet waffle with chocolate and whipped cream. The West Coast sand which was really nummy and filling. I enjoyed the little shop even though the area isn't located in the best part of Vegas. The coffee was tasty for a non speciality location. I would visit again next time I am in Vegas. Maybe try one of their dessert coffees or a vegan option.

Had such a great dining experience here! The food was awesome and service was excellent! We ordered the kisses, bananatella and break-the-fast waffles. The waffles were light and very flavorful! Crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside, the toppings were fresh and goes so perfect with each other. For drinks, we had the purple ube frozen frappe, dom's chocolate caramel frozen frappe and tiff's waffles hot machiatto. Each drink was unique and super yummy! (didn't drink them all by myself - shared them with friends) My fave would be the chocolate caramel! 
The ladies of the cafe were all so nice even though we used their livingsocial deal. They were also very accomodating to customers with kids. TWO THUMBS UP to TIABI!!
So I got myself the waffldella.  Who was the first time there surprise my wife was a red velvet waffle

Second time here and second yelp review. This place let's you basically make your own smoothie!! You can pick what goes in it and what you want to leave out. Plus it's very decently priced. Ironically cheaper than Jamba Juice and Tropical Smoothie even though it uses real fruit when the other chains DON'T.

Delicious, healthy, unique & all around great. Also reasonably priced. Cute little spot with amazing coffee & waffles for coffee & breakfast lovers like me! They even have vegan & vegetarian options. Love the friendly, super welcoming & helpful staff. You must try this place. I'll be back to try more!
Once they get their sign they may be easier to find. The food was Ok.

Nice concept, average execution. So far we had

- The West Coast with chips
- Hashtag breakfast sandwich with chips
- Golden waffles
- Bananatella
- Waffle macciato

The savory items had the potential, but it was a failure due to the lack of freshness. To be fair, they aren't pricey, so I think it's a reasonable middle ground, but I hoped something better than this.

I tried to love this place because it looked good and was close to where I was living but I just wasn't impressed.
