I ordered the green tea drink, they were out of green tea and what they gave me instead just wasn't good. The waffle sandwich and strawberry cheesecake waffle were just okay. The lemon blueberry muffin was the best part. Although they forgot it in my order and I had to go back for it.

found this gem via living social.  
Break fast waffle (waffle, egg, cheese, bacon).  Simple and yummy.  I can see some people preferring some kind of sauce on this but this was right up my alley... perfect.
Ice cream taco waffle (waffle with ice cream, chocolate chips, and nutela drizzle.  Amazing!  I wish I didnt have to share this with the wife.
This was probably my favorite place I visited on this Vegas trip that included some much more pricey places.

Great service / good vibes / great food.


Pros: 

-Both Vegan & non Vegan friendly

-They have a all flavors for those who love sweet & savory as well.

-good music

-comfy seating

-VERY CLEAN 


CON: 

I can't find any to be honest

The vegan options here are so amazing and are so delicious.  The staff are also extremely friendly.  The food is so tasty that we had to come back before we leave Vegas.  I highly recommend this spot.

Not only does Tiabi do amazing waffles they also hold the coffee game down! "To Inspire And Be Inspired"! I love the quote and your food and coffee are inspirational to me!!!!

So far I have not tried the sweet waffles, but on the savory waffle front I'm in love with the Waffidilla add the avocado and the West Coast. Both full of cheese and meaty goodness inside a perfectly cooked waffle. 

The coffee is amazing! On your first visit you must have the Tiffs Waffle Macchiato. It has a churro waffle in a very strong, slightly cinnamon flavored coffee. My favorite is the Espresso Frankenstein. It's perfect if you enjoy the taste of coffee. Plus, as sweetener they use is agave. Yay!

The service is spot on and everyone is talkative, energized and helpful. If you go in often you will get to know them and how sweet they really are. The atmosphere a is pure coffee shop, random tables that don't match and chairs that are odd. I do love the long wood bench that runs the length of the wall. Plus, the cool art on the walls are really unique and cool. 

My love of coffee shops runs deep and Tiabi Coffee has definitely become close to my heart!

I love this place! I've gone twice and every time, the food and coffee are on point. Service is banging. You really can't go wrong. I love their vegan options and just the simplicity of the place, waffles.

Enjoyed a simple Mother's Day lunch at this fun spot in the Target shopping center. We each got a different waffle and shared. My daughter always goes for the breakfast sandwiches and got the Hashtag sandwich. She loved it. I got the Waffledilla and the hubby got the West Coast Wafflewich. All were very good. Unfortunately, their Belgian waffle machine was down, so we couldn't try that type of waffle. Also, the drinks look yummy, but we just opted for water. Service was very friendly and there were games and cards around the tables leading to a killer game of War (I did not win).

Looking forward to returning soon to try one of the sweeter concoctions.

I found this place randomly about a year ago when I was craving some breakfast food on the way to UNLV. Just a quick search for "waffles nearby" and I came across this lovely gem, and boy, I am glad I did!
I've come here often enough for the staff to recognize me and have tried a number of things off their menu (and there's still plenty more to try!). I've recommended this place to people and have brought friends and family here, each trip ending up in a generally positive reaction the the food, atmosphere, and service.
The waffles and drinks offered here are numerous and delicious. From savory wafflewiches to sweet treats, theres something for just about anyone. The most popular item amongst the people I've brought here is probably the West Coast wafflewich or the Bananatella waffles. But if you can't find anything tempting on the menu or can't decide, you're welcome to create your own. And that can be anything--drinks, waffles, sandwiches, salads--if you can think it, they'll make it for you. Just to prove it, my boyfriend decided one day that adding chicken to their Bananatella would be a great idea (he's an interesting one). And while our server found it an odd request, they fulfilled it anyways. (Surprisingly, it didn't turn out that bad!) For the less daring, my personal favorite is a customization as well: the Strawberry Kisses waffle with bananas, paired with the Snickers iced coffee.
As for the place itself, the atmosphere is chill and welcoming. They have a nice rotation of music playing and a deck of cards on every table. The furnishings are quirky; tables with mismatched chairs, antique-style lights, and plenty of photographs and waffle-and-pop culture inspired paintings on the walls. It's a perfect place to eat and chat with friends or to catch up on some studying while sipping on some coffee. The servers are nice and friendly, always up to explain the menu and the new, seasonal items they're promoting at the counter (ex. Egg Nog Latte at Christmas-time or the Pumpkin Spice Waffle during the fall). The downside is that it gets pretty busy in the small space during peak lunch hours, and service can begin to get slow. The place isn't usually meant for a take-out and run, it's definitely better suited for people willing to sit, eat, and chill.
I definitely recommend this place to the Leslie Knopes of the world. In other words, it's the perfect place for a waffle-lover with time to chat.

A casual place for great waffles! Each waffle is made to order, so be prepared to wait for a little bit. The ladies behind the counter are friendly and have great recommendations if you want to try something different. This is a cool local spot to go with your friends and just hang out.

Tiabi is a small little cafe located next to Target. I saw few students there studying since they offer free wifi. The prices were reasonable. I ordered the red velvet chocolate chip waffles. Some of the coffee beverages sounded yummy but I held off from getting one. I went during the evening so it was pretty much slow but there was some what of a wait to get our food. The waffles were good but it wasn't filling enough for me. Compared to Babystacks, Tiabi was just average.

Very friendly staff, amazing waffles and the coffee was epic.  Try "Tiff's Special"!  It is a cinnamon latte topped with a churro style waffle.  Amazing!  Can I move the restaurant to the East Coast?!

Love this place. Cheaper than Starbucks. I had the frankenstein espresso and hubby had the signature iced macchiato that comes with a waffle. Both delicious and huge drinks for under $10.  Minutes from the strip. Will def be back.

Really love this place. Purchased a Groupon which got me in the door but I will definitely come back. I ordered an Almond Joy iced coffee which tasted more like chocolate to me that any notes of almond or coconut but I still found it to be delicious. Had the break the fast and the South American. Came cut so that way my bf and I could each get a half of the sandwich to try it out. I like the crispiness of having a waffle as a substitute for bread and both of the sandwiches were satisfying. 

Recommend this place as the service was amazing. Everyone was very nice and welcoming from the moment you walk in. Also, they have a deck of cards at each table to play some games while you wait for your food. The bathrooms were clean and appealed to my inner nerd by having a Star Wars sign outside of the bathroom to indicate the gender.

I love this place. The service was great and so was the food. My son ordered the waffle that looks like Pac-Man, and for the first time in a very long time, he ate it all! I got the red velvet waffles, and boy were they great. Their raspberry lemonade was to die for. My son actually got this but I drank some. Overall it was a great environment; they even had games and books to read which made it feel like a hangout spot.

A joke.  If all you want is a coffee and a waffle allocate an hour.  It took over five minutes for my mocha and over 25 minutes for a single plain waffle.  They weren't even busy.

Even worse was watching the cook literally man handle every waffle that came out. Hopefully his gloves aren't latex because he would send anyone with a latex allergy to the hospital with his pulling waffles hot from the iron off with his fingers and then flipping the waffle between both hands then shoving them back on to the iron if he decided it wasn't dark enough. Despite the constant fiddling my waffle still managed to come to me cold.  It couldn't even melt the butter on it.

Flavor wise its not worth anything. My mocha was so over chocolated that the only flavour from the coffee was a bitter under note.  As for the waffle it was so nothing I might as well have had an eggo or poured bisquick shake and pour into my waffle iron 

Oh, and they no longer offer Belgian waffles.  

Just skip it. Unless you are a hipster wanting to be seen to be tragically hip, there is no reason to waste the time.

This place instantly reminded me of one of those like little coffee joints that you find in like Seattle or New York! I had actually been looking for a place like this for a while!! The atmosphere is amazing but not only that! The food is amazing as well! Good portions for what you pay and the mocha is amazing!
Came here after reading Yelp reviews (thanks!) and was so glad I did!  The Westcoast was amazing! Staff was so friendly. I'll def b back.

I've always come here for drinks. First time I tried food there was yesterday and had that West Coast Wafflewich. Amazing! Not too heavy for all those flavors and that Tiabi sauce was out of this world! Had a Sirena Tea to go with the wafflewich, very refreshing. A must-return-to-restaurant for sure.
Loved the food, coffee, and the service. Vegan and Gluten Free dedicated waffle makers are a welcome sight.
Tasty and inexpensive, this little gem is a great spot for a coffee or yummy waffles.   Be sure to note the Vats of Nutella.  :)

My first time here. Liked the vibe. It was perfect for a break from the office. Food was better than I expected and I was delighted at the light and tasty fare. Enough protein to get thru day. I'll return...for dessert! Don't be in a hurry.

Yummy!  From their speciality coffee creations to the waffle sandwiches...everything was so good!  The two ladies working also seemed to enjoy their job and life in general, which is nice to see. The only deduction made was due to the wait time.   Only one worker to prepare food?  Seems inefficient, particularly during a morning rush.

Met up with a group of friends on a Saturday morning around 11 am. The place was packed and it is a little on the small side. We were lucky to get a table by the front door. The menu is impressive with a lot of options. You can have breakfast or lunch, I opted for breakfast. I had the Viva Las Elvis waffle (peanut butter, bacon, bananas, and honey) and it was pretty good although I could of done without the bananas and I added maple syrup. Others in the group seemed to enjoy their meals.
Due to the small size of the place and how popular it seems I did notice that there were several people who came in but left because of the lack of seats.
I am not sure if I would come back again just because of the location. It is a little farther than I would drive just to have a waffle but if I was in the area I would go back.

This place was very chill, reminded me of the places they have in San Jose. I ordered the Bananatella waffle, and an iced honey cream latte which was ON POINT! The waffle is very filling, and of course Nutella makes everything better! I will definitely come back for the coffee though, as that was my favorite

I love that there's a breakfast place near UNLV that has vegan choices! Actually their yums, including waffles and smoothies are great all day long and their dishes are artfully displayed (like their vegan waffle with strawberries and bananas on top)! I love their vegan waffle burger, and my go to smoothies of theirs are the kale champ and the banana berry ones. Mae and Tiffany, the owners of To Be Inspired And Inspire are always happy and positive and their helper bees are great too! They also play a great mix of great tunes in their shop!

Tasty waffles. The vibe is still being figured out but the variety of waffles and what you can put in or on them is good. A hip little trendy spot that offers coffee drinks and a variety of savory and sweet waffle options.

Small biz coffee shop in a strip mall that tries hard but falls short on quality and style. The coffee was fresh brewed and good, waffles made fresh are a plus too but my breakfast sandwich had that "instant" egg square and bacon slices. 

The decor needs to come together a bit but overall it fits the eclectic college clientele of the area.

We ordered Elvis waffle without any meat, bananatella, a regular coffee and a caramel
Macchiato. Waffles were good, not great - not super sweet but just right! The coffee was not great but their caramel macchiato was delicious!

I walk in and everyone is so upbeat in the morning which I miss. I've worked in customer service for too long, but I was greeted genuinely. I've never been here before up until recently and tried the churro iced coffee. Please keep it up. Will return soon!

When I first walked in, I thought, Crap!. Crap! not again.. Another crappy-overpriced hipster wanna-be "cafe" . . .  chalkboard paint, hand-drawn menu, attractive employees that are smiling. Dammit. I reluctantly ordered the Vegan Waffle-"burger", with a side of peanut sauce, for 6 bucks. For 6 bucks, that's amazingly cheap for Vegas. Ok, then I added the Frankenstein and my friend ordered. A Steel Pulse song came on the overhead, and now, breakfast for two, was under $20. Yes. This, is what is up. Definitely my new go to spot.

I'm so excited to eat this west coast wafflewiche. Got big reviews that it's the best sandwich. 
Shoutout to Jessica for her awesome customer service and helping me because I've never been here. 
She was a true help, THANKS :-)

This was a gem I discovered by accident through a coupon. The staff are friendly. They offer a great selection of waffles and blended coffee. They have plenty of vegan options and also make gluten-free waffles on request. My boss eats gluten free and forgot to mention it, but they switched her waffle out with a gluten free one with a smile. I love the laid back atmosphere and the 70s music!

The waffles taste great and you can find something for almost anyone as long as you like waffles. I can't wait to go back!

Wait time was way more than expected, 38 minutes for a waffle is insane. When my partner and I finally got our waffles, they were cold and hard.  

My partner requested no whip cream due to her being lactose intolerant. Watching you guys scrape the whip cream off is lazy and unprofessional. There's still traces of whip cream on there...

Customer service wasn't very friendly. We found Tiabi through Yelp based on their reviews and the overall experience was NOT up to par. It was very disappointing. 

Environment was overwhelming crowded. The layout is a bit compact and not ideal for a large group of people. We had to sit at a dirty table until 2 mins before we received our food. It was disgusting. 

Our drinks (teas) were also not given to us until 2 mins before our food arrived. Water wasn't even offered. 

Don't get me wrong, we weren't expecting Ritz Carlton service BUT the basics of dining at a cafe. We might try it again when it's less busy, but I would give our overall experience 1 out of 5 stars.

This Was My First Time Here At This Location and The Two Girls Working Helped Me With The Menu And Also Recomended Some Items For Me. i Ended Up Getring The West Coast Wafflewich. Sooo Good. The Food Is Light And Fresh,You Dont Feel Bloated Or Tired After Eating Eat. I Will Most Def Be Coming Back

I ordered the west coat which was actually very good the only problem was the waiting it took over 30 minutes to make my sandwich which was a little upsetting since they said it would only be 15 minutes. Friendly customer service maybe they were short staffed ? Because the resteraunt wasn't very busy. the sandwich was ok too me I think bruxxi on the Las Vegas strip is better. The waffle isn't as crisply as I would like it's more of a regular house type waffle which is still very delicious.
Very good food and service! The waffles are perfect consistency and the drinks flavorful.  Please build one in Henderson!!

Rate: 3.5

So glad I came here!! There is a variety of different type / style of waffles. ..from breakfast to lunch/ snack.

Southern waffle: diced ham, melted cheese, w/ avocado. 

Prices: very affordable. 
Environment: clean and friendly

Items ordered:
"Snickers" Iced Coffee
Lollies - Red Velvet, Nutella & Almonds
Kisses - Sliced strawberries, chocolate drizzle and whipped cream, served Belgian style
Viva Las Elvis - Bananas, peanut butter, chopped bacon and honey
Honey I'm Home - Vegan Churronimo waffle tossed in cinnamon and sugar topped with vanilla ice cream and honey

Tucked away in a small strip mall off Maryland Parkway and dotted with cute décor plus paintings from local artists it was alongside two friends that I sat down for a midday snack at Tiabi Coffee & Waffles and as much as I really wanted to like the kitschy little spot and their menu of made-to-order takes on the European classic our experience could best be described as mixed, an effect of dogmatic rules regarding the use of discounts and coupons alongside batters that proved utterly unremarkable, the toppings alone serving to save the day in the case of standard and $1-upcharged "Belgian" options, both.  Apparently named as an acronym of the underlying motto "to inspire and be inspired" with free WiFi and an innovative drink list including a rich caramel and cocoa infused iced coffee for myself plus a heavily praised honey cream iced latte for my friend it was after only a few moments of indecision that our order was placed and chatting while we waited the tasting soon began with a duo of $2.50 "lollies," the single strips of spongy dough pressed between hot metal proving paltry in portion and largely flavorless save for the sweet finishing drizzle that unfortunately warned of things to come.  Entirely eschewing savories in favor of items far more sweet it was after perhaps a twenty minute wait that our proper order arrived and beginning first with a doughy Belgian topped with fresh berries beneath artificial tasting chocolate I quickly turned my attention to the alternatives, the Elvis faring a bit better by balancing sweet and savory over a slightly more study base while the "Honey I'm Home" proved the best of bunch in its sugar-crisp coating overlying a somewhat dense crumb - its "veganism" thoroughly compromised by honey and ice cream but the result all the better for it.

Pretty decent food, but the drinks are awesome. A good selection and all made with the best ingredients and care. The waffles are, just OK. Nothing spectacular, but OK. The chips, meh. I let them be... not really worth it. We tried a couple of things. The Viva Las Elvis was good, but another meh. I loved getting off the strip and trying something a little more local, but with all of the options in Vegas... this just doesn't quite cut it. Go if you want a good Chai Tea or Smoothie. The staff is definitely friendly, but I wouldn't recommend it for a meal.

I love the small business feel of this restaurant. Reasonable prices for great food. I almost always order the vegan version of the Viva Las Elvis and it never disappoints. If you're confused on any part of the menu, they will take the time to explain anything to you. No pushy upselling either which is definitely a plus. Be prepared to wait based on the amount of people ahead of you since everything is made to order. However, definitely worth the wait!

The only negative I can think of is there's no storefront visible bike parking, though I can easily lean my bike and against the window and lock the tyre to prevent theft.  This place makes a bomb espresso for your training espresso shot. 

This is my favorite place to grab lunch or breakfast in Vegas.  I live within walking distance and go about 1-2 times a month.  The staff always remembers me and I don't even have to mention that I'm vegetarian since my first visit.  My favorite is the Viva Las Elvis, they make this awesome vegan bacon that is made from coconut flakes in place of all their regular bacon items.  Another favorite of mine is the Guru Burger.  They are happy to try new combinations too if you ask.

My roommate is a carnivore and we always go together.  He really enjoys their non-vegan options as well.

Edit/Disclaimer.  I work here now as of a month ago.  This review was prior to my employment.
I'm such a fan of this place! Quality ingredients that you can taste for a fair price! Everyone that works here is super friendly and upbeat. Try the West Coast sandwich as soon as humanly possible!

After seeing other great reviews for Tiabi on Yelp, I finally ventured out to check it out! Parking was a bit of a tight squeeze as this location is crammed in with other small businesses next to Target, but the restaurant itself was quiet and laidback. 

I decided to try the Red Velvet frappe, which the employees upgraded to a large for me for free because it was my first time! Nice! The frappe was delicious but a little too sweet for me to drink the whole thing. 

Now that I know where Tiabi is and have had a good experience with the employees, I definitely want to come back and try the waffles and other drinks.
Great vibs owners are sweet def luv the reggae music waffles are ahhhmazing  overall best breakfast spot off the strip!! :D

The food was great. But had to knock off a star for the service. Maybe could use another personnel be out on the floor to clean up especially on weekends. I mean why give the customer a wash cloth to clean the table themselves. Other than that it's a must to go try out the food.

Full from a weekend of eating buffets in Vegas?  Think again.  While you may be stuffed to the core, what you thought was going to be a to go stop at Tiabi Coffee & Waffle will end up being a sit down eat everything on your plate once they serve it to you no matter how full you are kind of afternoon.

It's just that good.  While you thought you were full, you didn't realize how hungry you were once you take a bite out of one of their delicious desserts, that they serve to you on a plate since it looks better that way than to go.

Peaceful atmosphere. If you want strong coffee, it's a good place to go. They also make different tea. Chill music. Reminds me of artsy Philadelphia PA vibe. Would be great if they allowed vaping and or made it into a hookah bar.

If I could give this place 0 stars, I would. The owner was ridiculous!!! They were having a special on the pumpkin waffle and a Halloween waffle. I wanted the pumpkin waffle, which come in a Belgian waffle style. However, the owner informed me that she only had enough batter for the original or regular waffle in pumpkin. She attempted to make me get the Halloween waffle, but I did not want that. I requested the same style of the Belgian pumpkin order in a regular waffle style since they could not accommodate what was on the menu. She began to harp on charging me for glazed pecans because that  was how the original came. I told her why would she charge me considering they could not provide what was on the menu? She began discussing that the pecans cost $, and had an attitude the entire time. Also, we almost choked on smoke inhalation. While I support small businesses frequently, this was a mistake and I encourage anyone who wants polite, fast and great service to turn elsewhere.  Tiabi SUCKS and that's putting it lightly. Needless to say, we took our business to the Crab Corner. DON'T DO IT!!!

We had the red velvet and strawberry kisses waffles. They were both delicious! Tried the pistachio latte, it was divine. Prices are decent. Girl behind the counter was helpful with selections since it was our 1st time there. Will definitely visit again if in the area.

#breakfast sandwich was super delicious. Waffle with scramble egg and maple bacon. Jon had the strawberry Kisses breakfast. Both were served hot and scrumptious!  We shared a Strawberry Sunrise smoothie.  Oh my gosh, it was just the right sweetness from the fruit.  All the people  working here a are great, so friendly!  I really appreciate that.  The cherry on top of this put stop is the prices. They are so reasonable.  What you need after a three day stay in Vegas!  Lol. Let's just say I am super satisfied!

I have to start by saying that I have been a TIABI customer since they first opened. I truly love the concept of their establishment along with the ideals and communities that they promote. In a town that lacks a sufficient number of locally-owned, independent restaurants and coffee shops, TIABI was always a beacon of light; particularly for the neighborhood that they established themselves in (the UNLV campus community and surrounding areas).

The reason why I have decided to leave a one-star review today, after years of supporting TIABI, is that I have noticed a steady decline in quality - and today was the tipping point for me. Prices have gone up, which is understandable for a young and local business, but quantity and quality need to stay consistent to justify the increase in prices. My partner and I spent $26.15 (that was INCLUDING a student discount) on a breakfast sandwich, a West Coast (chicken sandwich) and two 20oz smoothies, and a very small side of fruit. While the breakfast sandwich on a waffle was of "standard" size, the West Coast is easily comparable in size to a fast-food dollar menu sandwich.

The part that pushed me over the edge follows here: While I did understand that this was a high price for a relatively small amount of food, I decided to still purchase regardless because I believe in supporting businesses like TIABI and the food is creative and light on a hot summer afternoon. However, when I order a chicken sandwich, I do expect there to be more than three, one-inch, pre-sliced chicken bites on the sandwich. What I was served was a bacon, avocado, cheese sandwich with a hint of chicken. This is not the end of the world, but then I come to find that the strawberries in my small side of fruit was spoiled and sour. Then my partner proceeds to pull out a piece of plastic from the sausage packaging in her breakfast sandwich. Since the sausage comes in individually wrapped packages, a large chunk of plastic wrapping made its way into her food. The restaurant was not busy at all, so there was definitely no rush to prepare the food, and there is no excuse to find plastic in one's sandwich; that's absolutely careless food preparation.

As a college student, I would love nothing more than to go down the street, grab a smoothie and a sandwich from a local coffeehouse, and enjoy myself without spending ridiculous amounts of money and finding plastic in my food. I am really saddened to see what has happened to TIABI over the last few years, and I hope they fix it. The owners are such great people, but things need to change before I can return and recommend that my friends and family return as well. 

(As a side note, a supervisor/manager should remind the staff that it is not appropriate to mention that you "can't stop sweating half of your body weight in the Vegas summer heat," only to then turn around and prepare a customer's order.)

Coffee is bomb, waffles are deliciously crispy yet soft ... The staff is cool also, this place is so unlike other coffee shops in Vegas in that it feels like Portland Oregon or San Fran!! I study and chill there !
Great food! Great coffee!!! Love their Espresso Frankenstein, it's pretty is AMAZING! It's the perfect blend! We came to visit Las Vegas and had to come back a 2nd time while we were out there!

Even though I'm only giving Tiabi 3 stars, I'll be back. Why? 
-The prices are fair
-the atmosphere is clean, welcoming, and work friendly
-the employees are extra helpful
-the food is just okay

While the waffle alone is tasty, there's nothing extremely unique about it. And when put in sandwich form, the only unique thing is that it's sandwich stuff....inside a waffle. If you're expecting to be full, you may need to order another menu item as well. 

Here's what I've had:
-Golden waffle- tasty basic comfort food
-Vegan Tiabi Waffle- no difference in taste/texture so also tasty
-West Coast Wafflewich- bland and not filling 
-Tokyo wafflewich (i think that's what it was called. pretty much chicken, lettuce, and special dressing)- bland and not filling
-Avocado Dream Smoothie - not my jam
-I had a really delicious Coconut/Lime drink not listed on their menu online

Like I did state before though, the atmosphere is top notch. Everyone is warm, friendly, and very helpful when it comes to making food decisions. The other day I was there to pick up the golden waffle and I was kindly offered syrup, utensils, a back, all with a smile :-D The service definitely makes up for the okay food, and I'll probably just stick to ordering things on the sweeter side as opposed to the savory (bland) sandwiches.
Food was good, place was decent, waiting for waffles to be prepared was a bit tooooo long. With lots of good reviews, they need to buy more waffle makers to speed up service

My friend and I were looking for a new coffee shop type place to go to and we came across this little joint. It's very hidden, in the ghetto. It's on Maryland and flamingo in the target shopping center. We walk in, there's no where really to sit. It's a very cute shop but really small. Super clean. Everything on the menu sounded sooo good. I literally couldn't decide for like 15 minutes lol. The service was great. I got a waffle and coffee, and my total came out to like 14 bucks! I was so confused. I could've gotten Starbucks and a Belgium waffle from Egg Works for less than that. Definitely not worth that much money. I would go there more often if it wasn't so expensive and in the hood of Las Vegas.

Do not eat here!!! Gross waffles, I am assuming someone screwed up the waffle mix recipe that morning because if that's how the waffles taste everyday I'm truly surprised that place hasn't gone out of business yet. 
The waffles just had a weird texture and an off taste. They just did not taste right. We also ordered a "hot" coffee but it was cold, probably had been sitting out all day. If you serve nothing but coffee and waffles you better have fresh brewed hot coffee and decent waffles but they couldn't even get that right. 
Worse than the sub par food was the service, when the server came to check on us and asked how the food was I told him it was not very good and he just said "okay" and avoided eye contact and walked away! Wth!!! What kind of service is that?! No apology, he wasn't even interested in asking why I didn't like the food for the sake of feedback. He did not offer to call a manager over, just said "okay" and left... That is NOT OKAY!
The West Coast and Kettle Chips are life changing. Love this place. Their juices/smoothies are good too.
Really nice hangout place. Wait was a little long but understandable due to how busy it was. Drink was lacking sweetness but waffle was delicious!
I absolutely love the service here and the food. They have really perfected the art of the waffle!

A couple of months ago on a beat the street campaign (as I like to call it) a young lady came into my gym and handed me a flyer to this coffee and waffle bar.. Well, fast forward to today and I decided to come in for a coffee and bite to eat. I was instantly met with a lovely charm that was warm and refreshing to my soul. Adrian greeted me with a smile and kind patience as my indecision kicked in. I ordered a white mocha with almond milk (huge win) and the flavors that came from my cup tickled my senses and angered me because I deprived myself for so long from this treat. Anyway.. I look forward to being back soon and seeing where else this Vegas gem can take my senses..

Thank You Adrian!

Found this place on yelp when I didn't feel like walking 2 miles to dunkin donuts. Right from the start great customer service. Incredibly friendly cashier and most importantly amazing food. The waffles had the perfect texture and the fruit was so fresh. I'd recommend this place to anyone looking for breakfast in the area.
Avocado smoothies and awesome waffle sandwiches. Vegan friendly and the food was delicious. Small hole in the wall type place.

I was looking for a quick bite and pick me up so decided to try Tiabi's on my lunch break. It wasn't busy at all and I was glad that the service was great! The guy who took my order was helpful and friendly, it made the ordering process easy. 

I ordered the signature drink - Tiff's and it was good, I like the top off of a cinnamon waffle! I ordered a savory sandwich (forgot what it was called but it had chicken cheese avocado and the house sauce) it was pretty good. 

They have a decent selection of drinks and quick eats, I'd go back if I was in the mood for waffles.

Overall the quality of food was good, the staff was friendly. The only critique is when I sat down the bench was wobbling and the table was sticky.
Never had a waffle sandwich before. Exceeded expectations. Waffles were light and soft. Plenty of delicious looking options to keep us coming back

4.5 stars!!

It's surprising how much this place has grown on me. It's really not a bad place coffee, small bites, etc. nearby UNLV. I've tried multiple items and have been satisfied each time - never have I felt I wasted my money. 

Hot White Mango Tea - I was having a huge headache and getting this hot tea definitely made me feel better. I'm not usually a flavored hot tea person but this will be my togo when I'm craving a hot and healthier beverage.

Iced Caramel Macchiato - The coffee taste here is suuuper heavy - not too much of my thing, will skip this for the future.

Tropical Siena and Just Peachy Tea - they are separate teas and I've tried them both. The taste for both were a bit subtle, can live without it in the future.

Red Velvet Frappe - holy crap is it good here or what. Per me since I don't like too much chocolate, I've asked them to lessen the Cocoa and oh my, it is delish. Per bun it's probably the best we've found out here so far.

Waffle Sandwiches:

The Waffle Dilla - add the avocado. You'll thank me later.

Cheers!

First off, Tiabi has both a Groupon and Living Social deal. The Groupon is $14.25 for 3 $8 deals. The Living Social is $4 for $8 or $6 for $12. 

The shop is in the same plaza as the Target on Maryland Pkwy. It is to the right of Target if you're looking at it straight on. The shop itself is cute with some couches and drawings on the walls. Unfortunately, that's the only good thing I have to say. 

The girl at the counter did not know how to use the Living Social deal we had. After calling 2 other workers over and charging us the wrong price she had to refund the entire order and start over. Also she never scanned the app so if I were not the good person that  I am, I could re-use the deal and get $12 of free food haha. You should probably teach your workers what to do with it!

After our food was made they placed the food on the counter and called our names, however we didn't hear them and the food ended up sitting on the counter for a couple of minutes. There were four workers in the store all standing around behind the counter talking. Take the time to bring the order out guys! It was obvious we didn't hear you and it wasn't like you were busy- it was the only new order you had.  I thought it was a little rude that you would call our name out again instead of just walking it over. 

We ordered the bananatella waffle and pac man waffle. The bananatella was good, but nothing I was impressed with/would want to go back for. The presentation of the pac man waffle was horrible. I hope there's a picture of it on here, because I forgot to take one. Who wants a waffle that's a quarter missing? 

The dirty mocha chai sounded amazing on the menu board, but it was all disappointment in my mouth. It was just a strange combination and did not work for me.

When I could be at school studying, I decided to go to Tiabi's to get a nice breakfast with friends. 

I got the West Coast. It had chicken, bacon, cheese, and avocado. Pretty delicious for breakfast and not too pricy. I do not have any other waffle sandwich locations in mind besides Bruxie, so Tiabi's is convenient since it's down the street from UNLV! 

Service was friendly, but I'd say they're a tad slow, so don't plan on rushing here to eat if you have class or somewhere to be!

I really wish this place was close to me, as their vegan waffle selection and flavors are great!

Came here on the way to the airport upon leaving vacation, and it definitely did not disappoint. I had the viva las elvis vegan style, and an avocado smoothie, and my dining partner had one of their waffle breakfast sandwich concoctions. 

my waffle was very tasty. I wish I were eating one right now instead of writing this review. The smoothie was pretty good, probably wish I would've went with another smoothie as avocado smoothies are hit and miss to me (despite loving avocados). 

My dining partner still mentions how delicious her sandwich was and that she wished the place was closer, so there is that too! all and all, great all around!.
Quaint little spot by UNLV, good coffee, enviroment and people; would come again

Staff were really friendly and welcoming. They have really yummy drinks, teas and coffees. Their waffle sandwiches are really tasty. They serve their drinks in cute little mason jars. A great little hangout for friends and also a cool place to study.
Dang ... finally a place dedicated just waffles ... The Bananatella and Waffledilla is awesome...

Friendly service with sweet treats. Enjoyed my coffee, I forgot what it was called, something like a Joe Special I think. Remembered it was sweet and satisfying. My friends had their own coffee and waffles and were happy. This place will make you smile :-)
This place serves good coffee in different fun ways! Oh and the waffles are are delicious as well! No too sweet, savory options as well!

I will and forever have a soft spot for TIABI. When they first opened, I LOVED the welcoming vibe the owners gave me and my friends. They stopped by our table and shared with us that they were UNLV alums (go rebels!) and friends who decided to open up this cute spot together!

Since their opening, I've tried plenty of their menu items. With my go to being the West Coast. It's savory and refreshing (thanks to the avocado). Other notable favorites include Kisses and the Red Velvet Waffle for those with a sweet tooth.

The only thing about this place is that you never know what to expect with service. There are times when it would be swift, friendly, and efficient. You are going to be welcomed with a bright smile from the cashier and get your order in a reasonable time. But there are times when you are greeted with a blank, cold stare as if you've obviously interrupted them with their cleaning and get your order after a longer than usual wait.

Do yourself a favor and if you are return guest, do a call-in order. You wouldn't wait as long and you have more time to eat and less stressing.

Excellent mom/pop Cafe in the Central area in Las Vegas near UNLV. The few times I've been here in the past months have been amazing. The Baristas are very engaging and accommodating to your needs. The owners are very passionate with Coffee and inventive with their food items that they offer. 

**A little FYI, I'm good friends with these former green apron workers for years. If your interested about their background ask about their story and how they come to have a coffee shop. Personal favorite is Stiles Java Jolt and West Coast Wafflewich, must try items along with Tiff's Waffle Macchiato and Coconut Truffle Iced Coffee drinks. Ambience is pretty much straightforward with emphasis on artwork and pictures of random travels of the owners with a hipster vibe. 

Cool place to hangout with friends and expect a lot of millenials and tourist here since it's near LV Blvd.

I live 6 minutes away from this place and I just happened to run into this place. When we first entered, we were instantly greeted. The guy at the the register asked if it was our first time, and it was. So he gave us a few minutes to decide, we asked a few questions and he recommended us a few things off the menu. After we ordered, the food took no longer than 10 mins for everything to come. Plus free wifi (can't say no to that lol). The food was great, enviornment was great and the staff is great. I will definitely come back here and try the other drinks and food. I highly recommend this place.
I am not a vegan but their vegan waffles are so good! And there coffees are creative and delicious. I love going back there!

Delicious! Wish they had a location in or near spring valley. The wait time is a bit long, however I understand due to amount of people eating or ordering. Very happy with this waffle house. 4 stars only because pricing is a bit higher than we'd like as well as distance.

I saw a groupon so I bought it & so glad I did! It sits in a plaza, parking was easy. I ordered the West Coast sandwich & a smoothie, the waffle bread exceeded my expectation, it had a little crunchy outside & when you took a bite it was soft and filled with lovely flavors, just the way I like a sandwich so deeeelish & the portion size is perfect! I will stop in here any time I'm in the area, even if not hungry, I'll take home for later. Can't wait to bring my family & friends here!

I've tried this place for the first time last week. A friend of mine and I came over to grab dessert and I have to say we made the right choice. 

It's very cute and clean inside. There are magazines and couches to lounge on and there are decks of cards to play with on each table. They also have board games to keep you entertained.The staff is also very nice and helpful on their suggestions. 

Their waffles are delicious! They are the perfect texture and go well with ice cream. I will definitely be coming back to try their Churronimo!

Totally digged this spot! Great service and yummy menu! I had the waffledilla and pistachio latte with soy milk. Forgot to add on avocado on my waffledilla but it was still yummy! I'll be sure to visit again when I'm in Vegas :)

Heard about this place the other day . Wow the prices here are awesome. I had the lolly waffle it's a turkey sausage wrapped in a waffle it was great. I also had the west coast wafflewhich a avacado blt so good. I als had a great smoothie. I highly recommend this place the service was awesome as well.
Cute place. Nice selection of waffles, waffle sandwiches and other items. Happy they have vegan options. The waffles were the perfect texture, light and crispy. The coffee was really good, too.

I really like this place very simple inexpensive. Food is good real friendly staff Excel they should increase their waffle maker I think it be a little bit more efficient. But other than that I think this is a great place to eat very tasty simple. Behind the strip
Fairly inexpensive    quick service  no smiles ever seen though   food is good  coffee is decent   typical local college food place    great deals thru Groupons and living social
Loved how they had vegan options. Very hipster scenery. We got banana Nutella waffles. Very taste. Really would like to try other options next time I'm in the city.

Needed to kill some time yesterday in the area so decided to give this place a try. Had the Elvis waffle which was ok but had way too much peanut butter for my taste and pretty much overwhelmed everything else. Also tried the snickers iced coffee which was excellent. Service was friendly but slow. We waited about 15 minutes for our coffee and then at least another 20 for the waffle. Definitely not the place to come if you are in a hurry. Luckily I wasn't in a rush or starving. Overall decent but not really worth the wait.

love the decoration in this place! super rad star wars paintings near bathroom done by Patrizia who I randomly know from bikram yoga! the staff was very friednly and helped my boyfriend and I picked the perfect drink.. we got their khale drink and it was refreshing and delicious! we weren't hungry enough to try a waffle but we are definitely going back!

Came in with my family of 4 (including two kids)...ordered Tiabi Red Velvet, Hashtag, two Hash Tag Sandwhiches and two mocha latee's...food was pretty good...coffee was sweet...ambiance was cute...seating was lacking...staff is nice...service was super slow...50 minutes to get 1/2 our order out!!!  Over an hour to get second half of order!!!  It's a fairly new establishment...hopefully they pick it up...it has a lot of potential.  I probably wont be back.

The place was playing classic rock which was an immediate plus. We were the first customers that day and the woman who was working at the time was very nice. I ordered a bananaetta (a waffle with bananas and nutella) and was not disappointed. The banana's were delicious. I also enjoyed the vanilla chai latte. This is one of the few places where I felt like I paid the right amount for what I received.
I love this place! Closest thing to Bruxie here in Vegas. Captain Berry Crunch a must!

When I went the second time things were missing on my to go order. I spoke to someone one the phone and she told me she would take care of the next time I went. Then when I went back I told the snobby girl about my things that were missing, and she says well that's a lot of things for you to forget, well I'm not the one making the food to go and bagging it so that was not my problem, so she acts like I'm begging her for a cookie, chips, and the waffle side that comes with the tiffs coffee. I tell her to forget about it, then she tells me it'll take 30 min for my order to be ready so I told her never mind and she has the nerve to give a 10% off for a future purchase which to me it was a joke.  I was not asking for a discount I just wanted the items I had paid for that were not in the bag. The customer service was very poor, how is it my fault things are not in my bag when I'm not the one behind the counter, you have the technology to keep track of orders and is not being used. I would never step a foot here again and waste my time.

Loved it here! 
I got lost and they were very friendly on the phone.
The menu has a lot of options and the prices were great. 
The honey latte was delicious and so was the viva las Elvis waffle. 
A must go off the strip pit stop!
I had the honey cream latte, breakfast sammich with no cheese and my guy had the West Coast sammich with a caramel machiatto...everything was delish. Cute little coffee shop with friendly staff.

OMG!!! The best Waffles ever. Went here with my beautiful daughter and ordered the West Coast sandwich with house chips and a red velvet waffle with a 20 oz Coca-Cola and a 20 oz Dragonfruit Vitamin water.

First both waffles were cooked to perfection with a crisp crunchy texture and served warm fresh from the waffle iron.

The West Coast was loaded with chicken slices, bacon slices, avocado slices and tomato slices with Tiabi Sauce and cheese. 

The house chips were very good with a awesome seasoning that was a little sweet and savory. I'm glad I ordered them and I would recommend that everyone must try it for themselves. You'll thank me later.

The Red Velvet Waffle was topped with of chocolate chips, hot fudge and whipped cream. 

They have some great coffee drinks and other beverages to choose from.

There is free wifi and a roomy seating and study area and outlets to juice up your gadgets.

We will definitely be back for the best waffles that I have ever ate.

Great place to get some waffle sandwiches or delicious drinks.  Also, the music had me feeling nostalgic, all hits from the 90s, which is a good thing.  A lot of students study here from what I saw.  Very nice workers here and they accommodated a side of eggs for my toddler.  We used the one high chair in sight.
Even worse, the response tries to make me wrong! I'm the paying customer, hello! I'll take my money elsewhere. I feel personally insulted. Awful customer service.

I have always loved unique coffee houses! They peek my interests when I travel and I enjoy when they have a good, cozy vibe. Above all, the coffee must taste great and not be ridiculously overpriced. 

This place is so delicious! They have friendly service and prices are reasonable. On top of all the yummy coffee options, they have tasty food. The second you walk in, it smells amazing. They are waffle bar and I often find myself having random cravings for their bacon waffle, but they have great sandwiches too! They have tea if you're not a coffee person. No matter your mood... you will find something here! Also, the names are fun and different. Definitely a change to your average coffee house.
The service sucked and it took at least 30 minutes to just get our drinks. Not only that but the ice cream was freezer burned and they were literally out of EVERYTHING! doubt I'll be going back again

We were on vacation and stopped in since we saw a groupon and we were glad we did! I got the banana Nutella and upgraded it to a Belgium and it was super yummy! My husband got the break the fast which was also really good. I got the red velvet drink and my husband got the pumpkin pie spice drink and both were good. We went around 1 on a Saturday and there wasn't many others in the restaurant, but the service was friendly and helpful and the food was fresh

My TIABI experience was top notch! It's locally owned by these two young girls from Guam who works there too. Mae is one of the owner & greeted us with a genuine smile. She gave us recommendations for a health nut like me and I was not disappointed! I always opt for the gluten free options and I tried their Hashtag Waffle with turkey sausage & eggs- it was delicious!!! My friend had the West Coast Waffle that had bacon, chicken, avocado with their TIABI sauce & she was speechless! The waffles had the right amount of crunchiness & sweetness at the same time- & the portions are huge! We had the Kale Champ (kale, bananas, orange, almond milk) & Tif's Waffle Macchiato that came with a cute tiny churro waffle with the drink (like an umbrella in cocktail drinks but you can eat the waffle & dip it in your coffee- yum!). Kale Champ was a champ! No bitterness & just a tad sweetness. The macchiato- Wow! Smooth, aromatic with a hint of cinnamon. The price is very reasonable- where can you have gourmet coffee or shakes with an out of this world waffle entree for just a little over $10 bucks?!  The place is simple with a local vibe touch to the interior- chalk board with cute drawings, a locker that has graffiti signatures from customers, and couches to relax or study. It's right next to Target near UNLV.

We came here after our Spartan race yesterday because we were craving for some good waffles. We heard about this place from the locals & drove there from the race site as fast as we could without getting a speeding ticket :-) We were still wearing our medals. It was such a perfect place to celebrate another successful Spartan race!

At first glance this place looks like any other privately owned coffee shop. When you walk in the mood is calm and relaxing. You're greeted with a smile and upon looking at the menu excitement builds as you can tell that this is no ordinary coffee shop. It becomes obvious that the proprietors Tiffany and Mae put a lot of effort into creating menu choices that are not only healthy, but delectable and unique. The coffee is wonderful and flavorful especially if one's tired of the over roasted bitterness of Starbucks and many others coffee. As far as the food goes I have trouble ordering anything other than either the hashtag breakfast sandwich or the mixed berry salad. My favorite smoothie would definitely have to be the kale champ as it is not too sweet and tastes incredible.  frequent this establishment as I feel others should as well. Oh yeah and if you're having a bad day you should pop in for an ice cream waffle. It makes everything better.

The best waffle combinations ever! Can't believe I haven't heard about this place sooner. Great service and loved the oldies playing in the background. Definitely recommend to anyone , and all my friends and family
Everything was awesome! Nice laid back atmosphere. Great food. Great price. Great service. I had the viva las vegas waffle. Banana, PB, and bacon. Will come every time I am in Vegas

I'm all for helping out small, locally-owned shops, but to get me to visit a second time the food has to be good. With Tiabi, I'm on the fence. On one hand the B.A.T. wafflewich ($4.95) with its bacon, arugula, and tomato was delicious. I don't know what the Tiabi sauce in the wafflewich consisted of, but in combination with the other ingredients it made it unbelievably tasty. On the other hand, the Break-The-Fast wafflewich ($4.95) was a complete disaster. The whole thing looked sad. The sausage was barely warm, the cheese looked like it was straight out the fridge having had no contact with any heat to melt it, and the scrambled eggs looked like prepackaged/pre-cooked eggs found at McDonald's.

Somewhere in between in quality were the two waffle dishes I tried. Ordered as a Belgian waffle, the maple bacon waffle ($5.99) was thick and soft, as expected, with large chunks of bacon in the batter. The savory and saltiness of it in combination with the sweetness of the batter and syrup made it a solid choice all around. The red velvet waffle ($5.50), ordered as a classic thin waffle, lacked any crispness around the exterior. The flavor was well balanced with a moderate amount of chocolate chips and whipped cream giving it enough sweetness without making it too overindulgent.

With classic, Belgian, and vegan waffles, specialty coffee drinks and frozen drinks, there's plenty of promise here. Unfortunately, some of the execution on my visit was lackluster. And, don't expect fast service. Even with three employees hustling in the back we waited a while for our orders despite being the first ones through the door in the morning.

Tell them you're staying if you want your latte in their cup with a foam design. They didn't ask me and put it in a to-go cup. Such a bummer for me since my whole reason for coming was for a fun latte. 

It was a 3 star but the menu still has me curious (half the fun) so I give it 4 stars. There are lots of vegetarian options (even a coconut bacon, bacon alternative which is shredded, roasted coconut with ketchup/liquid smoke and other ingredients that give the coconut a more savory flavor over a sweet coconut flavor. They also offer a V ice cream alternative). 

(4/5) I got a small pistachio latte because of my love for pistachio ice cream. It did not disappoint in terms of flavor. What brought me here, though, were the pictures of the fun drinks with waffles on them. Visual appeal simply makes everything taste better. My latte got defaulted into a to-go cup  even though I was never asked for here or to-go. I'd even set up my spot to study and my drink came after 3 others drinks so there was time to simply glance over and see I was staying (not populated at all, regardless of the three previous orders). So if you come and want a foam design, verbalize that it's for here. 

(2/5) I also got the kale chocolate chip cookie- the green cookie. I'm all about the healthy way of life but this did not make me want to stay on track. Yes, you could taste the kale. The cookie was fluffy (I'm thinking lots of flour), and had I not had my coffee I wouldn't have finished it. It wasn't sweet like a cookie, but it did remind me of a scone without the shape. I probably would have liked it if I was thinking I was getting into a scone, actually. Subbing out for larger chocolate chips would have also added to the texture in a positive way. 

I asked a lot of questions, some were answered with "I don't know" with no intention on finding the answer (such as when I inquired about the different types of cookies) and others were answered by the guy making the drinks. I sort of felt like an inconvenience and like I should just go and sit back down because they wouldn't elaborate much without me 'pressing.' But the cashier could be new. I don't know. 

I loved the menu. It looks really interesting and I love places that have originality. 

The restaurant didn't have a warm, cozy feel but it was nice, nonetheless. Fun, far chalk wall mural. Actually, chalk was the main art theme. I liked it. 

The music was reggae. I dig. Perhaps a little loud. Startling at times. 

Definitely give this place a try, though.

Solid food - interesting menu and concept with traditional waffles, sweet and savory waffles, waffle sandwiches and all things waffle.  Quality of food is very high with very good quality ingredients, and super friendly staff.  UNLV location and staff/ownership with UNLV connections is a major plus - they appear very committed to UNLV and the general community.  Great to see good quality, creative and fun places like Tiabi develop in this neighborhood, which benefits from this type of energy and creativity.  Highly recommended.

Came here on 3 separate occasions. Loved everything we tried! The 3rd time I came, service was a bit slow and had to get my stuff to go, but it's because so many people enjoy eating here. 
1. Green smoothies are always good.
2. I love their lollies.

I wish I found this place sooner! Excellent coffee, great food, friendly customer service and WAFFLES! What's not to love? I highly recommend the first signature coffee, Tiff's. Sooo good and comes with a small piece of waffle dipped in cinnamon and sugar on top that you can dip in the coffee for a savory treat. The lattes were also incredible, and every food item (breakfast & lunch) I have loved! Super conveniently located if you go to UNLV, literally down the street in the Target shopping center.

Absolutely love this restaurant. Officially one of my favorite spots to visit whenever I get back in town.  Waffle pack so much flavor however remain light and puffy. No one wants to feel sludgy and overfull at brunch time! According to society i have a tight restrained lifestyle of being a vegan. Tiabi provides many many options for me which don't include me yawning as i chew down, if you know what i mean. :)

We were looking for a simple breakfast place in the land of Casino breakfasts and we are glad we found Tiabi! Excellent service and very yummy food. The maple Bacon Waffle was great and reminded me of when my Dad used to make bacon waffles! Ah, sweet reminiscence! The West Coast Waffle sandwich was also delicious and it improved on a very decent chicken sandwich with the addition of waffles. If you're liking for a giant Denny's style breakfast menu this is not the place but if you want some really good waffles Tiabi is an excellent choice!

I am thoroughly impressed with this cute, small,  and quiet breakfast spot.  The waffles are oh so good!  I got the hashtag breakfast sandwich with waffles,  turkey sausage, egg and cheese.  The waffles are made fresh and they're so good.  Also I tried the waffle Macchiato and although they took a long time to make the waffle for my Macchiato they gave me an extra waffle and it was muy delicioso.  I will be back even tho I live all the way in summerlin!  I will be recommending this place!

So very disappointed.  Maybe we came on a bad day.  It took 10 mins before either of the guys behind the counter bothered to look up and say hello.  We ordered waffles and regular coffee.  25 mins to get the waffles and when I asked about the coffees, the guy behind the counter got really snarky.  He said the were slammed and the coffee would be up soon . Seriously??  It was regular non fancy coffee !?  It finally came 10 mins after we got the waffles.  Coffee was like warm and the waffles weren't very good .   Oh  and there were maybe 14 people in this place, and 7 of them was our family !
Really really good! They definitely should put more chicken on the wafflewhiches though. I indeed recommend the Waffle Macciato or whatever they call it, it's killer!

I've only recently started coming here and I love it. The people are wonderful and so is the food. I get the #hashtagbreakfastsandwhich and either the very peachy shaken tea or the Frankenstein expresso. I love this place and not to mention coming in Saturday mornings and hearing live music!

Taibi is AMAZING!! The staff and owners (Tiff & Mae) are super friendly and make some awesome food! This is gonna be one of the main things I'm going to be missing now that I've moved away from LV. 
For UNLV students: there is wifi and electric outlets for studying AND a discount if you say you're a student. 
For vegetarians and vegans: there are some great options and the variety keeps expanding. Also, they have almond milk options for all coffee drinks!
Hint: try the "Maddie in a Basket" (vegan wafflewich made with a kale waffle)

This place is amazing! As you walk in, the restaurant looks so cool the way they decorated. I love the chalk walls. Their menu is different from any ordinary waffle house. Their choices for waffles and drinks are really unique. I'm not a fan of waffles, but the B.A.T. Waffle Sandwich was so delicious. If you like iced teas, Just Peachy is perfection. Best of all, its located near UNLV. I highly recommend this restaurant!!!!

I can't stand people that bitch and complain about wait time. In every single damn place I review on Yelp there is someone ALWAYS complaining about the wait time. It's funny because I bet those are the same people that drive like dumb-asses on the road. It's fook sakes man. Your food can't be made ahead of time, or maybe your dumb-asses should call in if you know the wait time is going to be long. Are you guys the ONLY people living in Las Vegas that your food should be made and delivered fast? Does this place look like a fast food joint to you serving burgers? NO!

  They have a big demand and they can only do so much in their small confined space they have. Be grateful theres a spot like this close by. The staff knows you want your food quick because you are either hungry or an impatient child throwing yourselves on the floor over a damn latte not being hot enough, or some other monkey business you all have. Maybe the cafe should have a spot where it read, "Be aware, we aren't mind readers, but we try to make your food as quickly as possible. So please be sure to wait. To knock on Jack in the boxs phrase" We don't make it till you order it". It's like have people turned into a bunch of self-centered egotistical impatient nut jobs now that they forget that if you want great service, your gonna have to wait a little? I mean just like going for a job interview... time your shit out! Don't just go in the last minute! 

  Next time you walk in remember that you aren't the only ones waiting, and think about what your ordering and how reasonable time it should be to make it considering everyone else. This type of stupid inpatient behaviour is what replacing our cashiers and food service workers for machines. It's like fuck... this city is stressful and these comments in one way or another hit home to the owners and end up giving bad service because of your choice of words. Now the owner shouldn't take offense because they know that they have delivered and still can deliver great service. Once you stop caring about the customer maybe its time to quit, or revamp your way of doing things. But still the customer should realize when they should stay quiet and be reasonable. I mean... you do have your smart phones to keep you guys busy right? Then shut up, sit down, and wait!

  I really wish I could agree with the rest of the customers here but I just cant when it comes to something that can easily be solved if you take time to consider things. They are responsible for the wait time as much as you all are. If your in a hurry ask how much it will take. I mean these bad comments are in the minority and not much of them give off really over the top bad comments about the place. Just wait time and questionable service.

  Now on to my review... Place is nice inside. I honestly thought it was going to be tiny, but it's an okay size for the location. Parking blows, but what can you do about it. I see some people complain about the parking like if its the cafe's fault. Uhhh what? lol. Price are fine for the grub. Uhh one thing I always look for is a place to sit down for wifi and submit job applications or read with my laptop. But since this is a busy spot I kinda saw that I kind of just taking up room. So maybe I will try showing up later in the day or on a none productive Monday, or Tuesday when there aren't so many customers. I should of ordered something to eat, but had a feeling about not staying too long. I was right so good thing I did not. Waffles looked good. Place is more for a quick to medium social spot. Maybe I would say 2 to 3 hours then outsy. 

Now that I'm writing this... I realized they have playing cards so customers can be entertained, but it doesn't work anymore lol. Maybe you all should bring in a mariachi band to keep them entertained bawahahahahahaha!

I got waaaay too excited at the thought of a waffle bar, but my wafflewich ended up just being decent. Swapping bread out with Tiabi's waffles didn't really change the overall taste of my breakfast sandwich, which contained eggs, sausage, and cheese. Their waffles aren't very flavorsome alone. I doused my order with srircha. 

Despite my table's seemingly simple wafflewich orders, we were left waiting for our food for an unreasonably long time period. There were only two people working in the shop, sharing the responsibilities of taking orders, preparing and carrying out the food, and attending to guests. Needless to say, the service was definitely lacking. One of the owners actually asked my friend and I to wait before ordering, but she completely left us hanging. There was a moderate amount of people in the shop, but it wasn't terribly busy. 

By the end, I don't think anybody in my party was super impressed with their wafflewich nor their wafflnuts, which tasted super doughy and undercooked. However, all of our meals were savory. Tiabi's sweeter breakfast choices might be a better option when ordering.

Tiabi is great for a lighter version of Belgian waffle plates! It's located next to Target and there's a huge parking lot. I was a little hesitant to order the Bananatella because I thought it was going to be one of those heavy hitters that would make you feel overly full, bloated, and that it would be like having dessert instead of breakfast, but it was just perfect! The waffle was light, warm, toasty, and cleanly presented. For me, the dish was a good amount of sweetness topped with banana, almonds, and whipped cream. It definitely filled me up but if you're coming in famished, you should probably check out the savory wafflewiches. The woman taking our order was super friendly and was more than welcome to give us suggestions. I can definitely see this place being popular with UNLV students because there's a couch closer to the front of the store, free wi-fi, and random decks of cards at the tables but since it's the summer right now the place wasn't crowded. I'll probably have to come back and try some of the other items on the menu!

This place is amazing. I had Viva Las Elivs and a wafflewich - and they're both fantastic. I grew up in Europe and we don't have anything remotely similar to the waffles at Tiabi. 

I'm definitely coming to Vegas to have these again. 
Actually - I'm in the car right now driving to Taibi to get another wafflewich

The ratings are way too high for this place. It didn't seem that busy with a few tables available...yet the person that took our order said it would take 30 minutes for our small order. It took 42 minutes to get our 2 drinks and another 20 minutes for the food. I'm a pretty patient person so I didn't say anything. The employees were too busy to apologize so we just ate our food and left. The food was ok and definitely not worth the 1 hour wait. I suggest they lease or purchase at least 2 more waffle machines to speed up the process or at least be more accurate with the time.

Oh Tiabi. 

"To Inspire and Be Inspired."  My visit yesterday was definitely inspirational.

I came out here last month for the Yelp Coffee Cruise event, and have been trying to make it back since.  Yesterday, I was in the area for a birthday party a little early, so I popped in for coffee and a waffle.  

Tiabi is an adorable little coffee shop, hidden away in the strip mall near Target on Flamingo and Maryland Parkway.  Before the Coffee Cruise, I had no idea it existed, even though I frequent that area all the time. 

Yesterday, when I stopped in,  I took a look at their drink and waffle menu, and decided on the Twilight Lavender Latte, and the Golden Waffle. 

Service was super friendly.  The cashier was polite, and the girl who made my waffle had an infectious smile.  Tiffany, the owner, remembered me from the Cruise, and said hello after I had been seated.  We chatted for a minute, and then my waffle was ready.

So...the coffee.  
Light.  Flavorful.  Aromatic.   Delicious.  I may have done myself a disservice in ordering the Twilight Lavender Latte on my first time back, because I may not ever want to order another drink as long as this is available.  It is SO good...I shared a sip with a friend when I arrived at the birthday party, and her whole face lit up, it is THAT delicious.  Home Run, Tiabi.  Home Run. 

The waffle.  Oh, the waffle. 
The Golden Waffle is simple.  Its a light, crisp on the outside, fluffy on the inside, golden, perfect waffle.  Its dusted with powdered sugar, and served with butter on the side.  There was syrup on the table, but I didn't need any, and I normally drown my waffles in syrup.  

Sweet.  Delicate.  Awesome.  

Tiabi, I'm so glad I had the time to pop by yesterday.  You've excelled at making me feel welcome, and the quality of your offerings is truly inspiring.

Can I have a waffle, a waffle, and a side of waffle? :D

This coffee/waffle inspired shop is a hidden sweet tooth haven. It's tucked away in a plaza off by UNLV. When you walk in the aroma of hazelnut, baked goods, and coffee tingles your nostrils and it's goood. I ordered Tiff's Special which if memory serves me right is a caramel vanilla machiatto topped with a waffle and I had to get a loaded waffle dish (Toppings include: bananas, Nutella, almonds, and whip cream). You get two waffles which is perfect if you're hungry or to share if you're just looking to snack. The coffee was fresh/strong/sweet/milky which made for a great combo. If you're looking for sweet, comfort food on a chilly day this is the place to be.

Nice service and nice tasting food but not all ingredients are fresh. Not sure about the waffle mix but my sausage, egg, and cheese waffle had a perfectly round egg that looked like the ones that come in the frozen breakfast aisle at your local grocery store. For the price I was expecting a more "home made" taste rather than fast food. In the end, I will probably go back again though if I find myself on Maryland Avenue (#DMVnative).

This place is cute. It is catered to college crowd. The prices are pretty darn good. I ordered Tiffs special that included a caramel macchiato and small waffle garnish. You can get it iced or hot. It was 4.25! My friend ordered a waffle with chocolate and strawberries and a green smoothie. The waffle was a bit dry and smoothie was very light. But the prices and vibe in here was good enough to try again.

Used to love this place. The food tastes delicious and they have wifi, so I can study here. I introduced many of my family and friends to this place.

That being said, the service is below average. Not only is the wait time long (they only had 2 or 3 waffle makers, understandable bc they're a small mom and pop shop which I loved), but the owner/worker takes customer requests and suggestions personally. I asked for strawberries and Nutella on my waffle, as I always ordered it. When I received it, there were no strawberries. I hate to complain about food bc they have the power to spit in it when you're not looking, but I thought they'd be ok with me asking since I'd been there several times previously. When I asked, they took a few minutes and handed over a small bowl of sliced strawberries. I thought they were going to add it to my plate, so I brought it up to the counter. When she saw I did this, she grudgingly said,"Oh, you wanted ME to put those on there?" I replied that I could do it, a little embarrassed. 

The reason this was a red flag for me is because one of my earlier stops there, I heard the staff talking about a recent Yelp review. The review spoke of the bad service the customer received. The girl in question defended herself and stated she did nothing wrong. I didn't think anything of this the first time. A subsequent time I was there, a foreign couple (Italian accent?) was asking why their 2 waffles were not similar and if they could remake one because they enjoyed the crispier one. The same owner/worker who didn't take criticism well kept insisting that it was made the same and they just had to let it sit longer to get the crispy consistency. 

At that point, I hadn't been crossed by one of her moods yet, so I continued visiting to get my delicious coffee, waffles and to study. Then, that day hit as it inevitably would. I haven't returned since and don't intend to. Customer service is key, any business owner should know this. 

Since I know you (the owners) read the Yelp reviews, I'd like to offer up some constructive criticism: you should cater to your customers. If you take these comments personally and become defensive, your customers will only continue to be dissatisfied with your service.

OMG I would be here every day if Tiabi were in my neighborhood!! Waffles are one of my faaaaaaavorite foods and these waffles do not disappoint. I think these might be the best waffles I've ever had. And when they are made into a wafflewich?!? Wowwwww, that's just.....wowwwww. So freaking good!!! We ordered the breakfast wafflewich, the Thai basil wafflewich and the bananatella on our first visit here. We came here twice in 3 days. Luckily it wasn't hard to convince my husband to come back since he thought these were delicious too! Yessss! Waffles FTW!!! :)

On our 2nd visit we got another Thai basil wafflewich (obviously our favorite!!!), the west coast wafflewich, the maple bacon, and the Elvis (with bacon, honey, AND peanut butter! All were delicious, can't say a bad thing about any of these waffles. 

Thank you Tiabi for the awesome service too, we will def be back!

Bought a groupon for half price tiabi food! Was confusing but thats groupons fault. AMAZING food! I got the hashtag breakfast sandwich and strawberry sunrise smoothie. Def worth going off the beaten path to eat here :)))))
Great savory waffles. A little stingy on the fruits with the paceman. Delicious place overall

Wow. SO glad I stopped by this gem on my way out from Vegas! Small place with big flavor! I tried the West Coast with an added egg....delicious their coffee is pretty on point too, great morning after food options and the staff is simply awesome

Average at best, expensive for what you get. The coffee was below average, the guy who was at the register looked stressed and flustered, which really didn't make sense. It took a really long time to get the waffles, which again, didn't make sense as the place wasn't busy and there were 4 people working. Cool concept, poor execution.

I was so excited to go to this cafe once I saw that they had waffle sandwiches because I LOVE Bruxie's waffle sandwiches, but they don't have one in Vegas. Tiabi gives you the option of the classic waffle (thin, round waffle) or a Belgian waffle (thick, square waffle) for the sandwiches. The classic waffle reminded me of the one at Bruxie, but the quality and service were lacking. 

I ordered the West Coast sandwich and it was decent, but I felt like it was lacking flavor and thrown together a bit sloppily. I also got the red velvet wafflenut and it was super sweet, doughy, and just seemed like it wasn't fully cooked. There were only two people working, so it took us about ten minutes to order and another 20 minutes to get our food. For the amount of customers that were there, they definitely would benefit from having another employee. 

Overall, cute place, vegan friendly, but they just need to work on their consistency and their service.

i got the Hashtag Breakfast Sandwich.

waffle was crisp but not hard, the eggs and sausage also tasted great.
the only reason i didnt give them a 5 is that the waffle is way too thick esp when stacked on top of each other to make a sandwich. this made it a little too hard to eat.

Very good food at an affordable price. Just know that everything is freshly made so this isn't a fast food restaurant. Plane to be there for at least 10-15 to get your food but it's worth it! And it doesn't have all that junk you would get at other restaurants.  Try the Californian! And students get a discount! Just show your ID!
Friendly service and great Belgian waffles , must visit especially if you are  Vegan.

I purchased a Groupon in order to give this place a try on my most recent visit to Vegas. I did not get to use all three coupons, but I was able to try this place a few times. The wait can be a bit longer than expected, but the food is rather good. I had a smoothie my first time, which was delicious and filling. The second time, I had a Red Velvet frappe, which was amazing and a sandwich. The sandwich was my least favorite item. I don't know if it was the batter used for the waffle of the sandwich or the fact that it took 20 minutes to be served the sandwich, but I was not pleased. I would recommend this place, especially the Groupon if you plan on being in the area for a few days. I do suggest more staff to accommodate the orders. The same guy who took my order, also made my meal which only made the wait longer

Came here because of the reviews and the one $. Definitely lived up to our expectations!!!! While we were staring at the menu the cashier asked us if we wanted help with ordering (LOVE be asked as opposed to someone just jumping in!!) he asked what my taste preferences were and offered examples, sweet, savory, etc. he then made suggestions based on our answers. We took his suggestions and we were very pleased! He was totally on point!! I also had the coffee of the day, Guatemalan. Smooth and robust! Not bitter like another coffee place we all know and love ;) ! I cannot wait to come back try a few other items! I definitely want to try their Kale smoothie next, sounds divine!

It has a very unusual menu...My husband and I are seniors and this is in a UNLV neighborhood by Target so we are not their usual clientele.  But, if they come to Henderson I am there.  They have waffles for every kind of meal from breakfast to dinner.
