I had the bacon waffle and my husband had the Western waffle (chicken bacon avocado etc) and their coffee is excellent and he had lemon ginger tea.  Kids would love that place.  The only thing that keeps us from giving it the 5th star is that it is too small and the tables and chairs are not that comfortable and really no décor...so you are there primarily for their menu and they don't let you down there.  

PS...if you order something that requires butter, have them butter it.  Those little butter things are a bugger to open and they said they don't mind pre buttering for you.
Decided to get the groupon and try this place out and it did not disappoint! Cody got the break the fast waffles and of course I opted out for something sweet, Banana Nutella waffles! Soooo good!
I had a green tea latte and they strawberries and chocolate waffle.  Both were yummie!!!

We came here as an alternative to the constant rape and pillaging that we felt the hotels were offering and what a great option.  They make the waffles fresh and the coffees were great!  Came here twice for breakfast during our four day stay.  Tried the snicker iced coffee and pistachio latte.  Snickers ice coffee is the way to go.  Then we had the Viva la elvis, west coast, thai basil, and banana nutella.  All were good but I did think the viva elvis was very unique since they had bacon, banana, and peanut butter together on the waffle.  This place is in the Target shopping center at the corner of Maryland and Flamingo.  It has weird entrances to the mall but as long as you head for target you will this place around the corner.

Gluten free waffles at affordable prices in Vegas? What? And Nutella? Sign me up! Great coffee for an amazing price. Staff is friendly. This hole-in-the-wall coffee shop is definitely worth venturing off the strip to go try.

This is place is excellent. Great service, friendly staff, and delicious food. We had the Thai basil waffle sandwich special and the hashtag breakfast sandwich. Both delicious. And I love that the side of fruit is fresh strawberries and bananas. And when they found out we like heavy cream with our coffee, they brought us a cup to our table. I would definitely come back. Highly recommended!
This place is amazing! They have great waffles, shakes, sandwiches, salads, espressos and cookies!! There are tons of vegan friendly dishes too. It's a great spot, really happy we found it!
It's pretty good, but not a place I'm dying to come back. Very low key place. Staff are friendly. Still on the hunt for a waffle place that meets all expectations for sweet and savory.

I've only been here twice but both were good experiences. I ordered a caramel iced coffee but she heard it as an iced caramel macchiato. I didn't end up correcting her since I figured it wouldve tasted the same lol. I also ordered the red velvet waffle with no whip. The food and the coffee was good but nothing spectacular. 

When my waffle came out, the girl put whipped cream on it. I didn't complain about it but I was a little irked lol. The girl did apologize later on so it was fine. The workers are really nice and friendly!

What a cute little place! The word TIABI stands for to inspire and be inspired. I love this place for so many reasons. They have fresh juice smoothies, vegan options and WAFFLES! Yes I am conscious about being healthy but I do have a sweet tooth and this place gives me both! Plus the owners and workers are super nice which makes me want to come and hang out more often. 

My favorites:
Peanut butter banana smoothie
Vegan Belgian waffles with the toppings of your choice! 
Vegan kale chocolate chip ccookies!

This place is still pretty new so I can tell they are adding and changing the menu due to demand.. Love it! 
They have everything non-vegan as well so you can enjoy the place with vegans and non-vegans ;)
Great food and fun environment! The staff was so friendly and you can tell they enjoyed working there. I will definitely be back to try more menu items.

As I sit here recovering from the prior nights festivities, relaxed, content, and belly full from a hashtag breakfast sandwich(photo will follow), I'm actually debating whether to have a waffle dessert.  Being that I'm always in search for new and exciting places to experience, this place is now my goto coffee spot for the Vegas Road Trips. 

If you love Belgian waffles, you will enjoy these.  They make the Vegan batter here in the premises.  I'm not Vegan, but I am for the period of time it takes to scarf one. They have many of sandwiches and desserts to choose from, all made with waffles, including the Churronimo(a waffle churro), which I wolfed down yesterday.  

The coffee items that I've experienced so far are the Red Velvet Latte, speaks for itself, and the Espresso Frankenstein.  One would think the Frankenstein to be a very strong and intense drink, one would be correctamundo.  Four shots, ice, and agave, all blended together into a very light and frothy monster of a drink...don't be scared, try it!  Even though it's strong, it's not bitter strong.  You can really taste the roasted smoothness of the beans. 

Yes TIABI has hit a home run with me.  The staff is lively, informative, accommodating and diligent.  To the owners Mae and Tiffany I thank you.

This place had delicious food, tasty coffee and a cool vibe. The people working there were friendly and helpful. It was my first visit and I am glad I found it. It's a local gem and I will be frequenting this place often now! They suggested "The West Coast" sandwich for lunch and it was very tasty. I paired it with "Tiff's Waffle Macchiato" and a cool glass of ice water. I sat and read my book, ate my lunch and enjoyed the chill atmosphere and my tasty food/beverage. Thanks guys and gals for a great experience.

Time to update. Yesterday's visit wasn't very pleasing. I cannot believe how long it took to get my food...and the nice gal at the cashier took down my name incorrectly so after waiting an excruciating long time for my food, I wasn't sure if my name was being called. They keep calling "Maria" when my name is "Nadia"...I looked around and noticed no one was responding to "Maria" so I went up to the counter to clarify the name...With an attitude, one of the girls making a drink said "isn't that what you  ordered?" (as if the sandwich was exclusive to me alone)... I said "yes, but before I take the food I want to make sure it's actually my order and not some Maria that could be nearby". After taking the food I sat down and immediately overheard the same girls  gossiping about me, laughing and saying my name. Whatever. At least wait until the customer leaves to trash talk. The Thai sandwich was just okay. The waffle was too soft and when I bit into it it was unpleasantly soggy. It's been that way on each visit. The idea of a waffle sandwich is good, by if it isn't cooked crispy enough, it ends up tasting like dough. I think I'm going to scratch this place off my list.
Read the reviews and wanted to see what this place had to offer. They did not disappoint. Great coffees and amazing breakfast waffle. Five star!

So don't expect a chain style meal or speed. These are regular people cooking delicious food!  We had the maple bacon Belgium waffle, Nutella waffle nut, caramel macchiato, banaberry smoothie, and the banana Nutella waffle. WOW!

Awesome place, great service, AMAZING food!  If you haven't tried this place, you should.
Great little Cafe, The Waffles and Coffee were great, as was the service. Also dug that they had a Vegan Waffle Option!

If you like candy and everything sweet, then this is a good place for you. Their churro waffles are good, but the coffee-and I've tried multiple different ones-all taste like Bonnie Bell lip balm. They're also insanely overpriced for what they are.

This place just happens to be right next door to my favorite sushi spot in Vegas (see review for Sakana) so i'm really surprised its taken me this long to try out.

The girl working the counter was super bubbly and nice which is exactly how I want to be greeted first thing in the morning. There is nothing worse then someone working at a coffee shop in the morning who hates mornings.

We ordered:

Tiff's Waffle Macchiato- 4/5

Great flavor and I loved the cute little churro flavored waffle piece that topped off our drinks! My only disappointment came when they were presented to us in plastic drink-ware instead of the cute little mason jars we saw pictures of here on Yelp.

Bananutella Waffle- 4/5

Came out perfect with just enough crunch on the outside and soft fluffy waffle goodness on the inside. Covered in Nutella drizzle, bananas, and sliced Almonds. It was very, very rich. I ate 1/3rd of it I had to take the rest to go. I feel like this would of been better for dessert, too heavy for breakfast for me at least.
Good breakfast...the waffles are okay, not great but well made...all the items we tried did not disappoint...if you want a change in breakfast this is good alternative...

My first visit. I had the waffle macchiato with a churro waffle. It was delicious. Great combination of sweet and coffee. The menu has a lot more fun items to try. The place was inviting and had comfortable chairs. There are not too many tables so I am not sure how it is when it is super busy. Check it out.
I love this little place. Their coffee is phenomenal and the waffles are just incredible.

Disappointing. We ventured outside of the strip to try something different. In the mood for waffles so we tried this place based only on the good yelp reviews. It's only 3 miles from the strip but it's located in a very ghetto area, very seedy, didn't feel clean or safe. The waffle place was ok, low end diner. Food was average, nothing special. I don't think it's worth the drive outside of the main strip.

Viva Las Elvis! A Belgian Waffle stuffed with peanut butter, topped with bacon and bananas! Sorry, no photo. It did not last very long!

Good coffee and chai. The South American Waffle Sandwich was pretty excellent, too!
Wonderful people and excellent food! The perfect option if you're looking for delicious & affordable brunch. I would recommend the west coast if you're looking for a tasty sandwich.

I have never wanted a local business to succeed more than this one. If you are debating "Is TIABI the right place for me to eat?", I must ask you to consider the following

1. Do you like food? If not, this isn't the right place for you. Actually, you should probably go to the hospital (please see my Yelp! reviews on my favorite hospitals)
2. Do you like food that tastes delicious?
3. Do you like breakfast, lunch, and/or dinner? Do you like smoothies? Do you like coffee?
4. Are you a vegan? If not, are you an omnivore?

If you answered yes to all of those questions, then you will probably love TIABI. Waffles are cooked to a perfect texture that's not so chewy/thick that you want to die halfway through. All of the smoothies are delicious (my personal favorite are the Health Nut and the Avocado, but you do you). Breakfast, lunch, and casual dinner options. Additionally, very extensive vegan menu. Do you have an enemy? Don't tell them about this place. Do you have friends? Do them a solid and meet them there over a Waffle Macchiato and a Break The Fast sandwich.

Cool little cafe in the target plaza center. The cashier was nice and friendly. My hubby had the hashtag breakfast waffle sandwich which was awesome. I had the smores waffle which was a little too rich and sweet for me and I have a serious sweet tooth. I also had the green nut smoothie which was pretty good as well. The wait however was pretty long like 45 mins to receive our food and I was almost late to an appointment. There's vegan options for vegans that I thought was cool. I'll give them another try though to get my own breakfast waffle sandwich.

Tiabi is a unique and extremely well executed concept See below for Pros and Cons

Pros
From a very quirky minimalist design that makes the very industrial space feel like a cozy coffee shop. 
The Coffee is very good, one of the 5 best coffee shops I've tried in Vegas and I try a new coffee shop almost every Saturday.
The Waffle based food is delicious and unique
The Staff is super friendly
Meeting people in the social collision area of the shop makes meeting new people super easy!

Cons
It's location is kind of hard to find.
It doesn't have enough space to accommodate it's rush
There is no bicycle parking

Overall, everything that Tiabi can control is really really well executed, the things beyond their control they've done a great job of mitigating.

This is the spot!  Would be nice if they went organic- and some better options for sweet syrup, but great for vegan selections while passing thru Vegas on a road trip.  

lots of fun options, especially the Churro waffle.  we had the vegan wafflewich too, it was super tasty.

chilled out space, cozy seating, good music, wifi, and outlets.  good for travelers and study

Tiabi Waffles was really good. Worthy the drive. Hidden on the side of a strip mall with a a Target. I had the Banana Nutella waffle as. Late afternoon snack along with a Coconut Truffle Iced Coffee. Bother we're very nice. The coffee was very sweet. The waffle was just right. Sliced bananas whipped cream and Nutella. What more could you want?

My first time here, been wanting to try this place for quite some time! 
Vegan tiabi waffle w coconut bacon & strawberries was amazing! Tasted perfect. The syrup is just right too, not too sweet or sticky. 
Service was on point.

Yet another review to say that the customer service needs work. I came by today for a latte after finding this place on the Yelp app- it's still difficult to find, as it's in a nook of the plaza and can't really be seen from the street.
I guess their exterior signage is still being developed, because right now there's just a tarp printed with "Coffee & Waffles".

Went in and there seemed to be some sort of lounge affect going on. I made my way around a group of women clustered near the entrance talking, perused the posted menu, then stood behind a guy chatting at the front counter for a good five minutes before the woman he was speaking to realized I was a paying customer, and said she'd help me. 
I find it a little tacky that the employee (who seemed to be one of the co-owners) was not more attentive to the fact that I was waiting in line to place an order.
As it is, she excused herself in such a way that I felt I was inconveniencing her. 

Regardless, I ordered a skinny vanilla latte- originally planned on getting a sandwich, but it seemed this would have really been a problem to her, so I just stuck to the drink. It was tasty, even if the foam was overflowing along the lip of the lid.

Found a table of samples toward the back as I waited for my drink- the cinnamon sugar waffle and the bacon-cheddar waffle were both really flavorful, though the former was nice and crisp while the latter was more on the limp and soggy side. 

Location seems like it'll be good for students, and they seem to have a lock on the niche market- doubt bistro waffles are offered anywhere else nearby. Hope they succeed, maybe I'll be back when they work out the kinks- namely waiting for the novelty of business ownership to wear off enough for them to prioritize customer service. Their product seems like it'll do well.

Waffle me, please. 

Once your senses are completely overwhelmed from casino dwelling on the LV Strip, head over to Tiabi for something a bit more down to Earth: smoothies, coffee and waffles. 

It sounds a lot more decadent than it really is: an honest to goodness cafe. No gimmick, no half naked servers, no gaudy decor or slots. Plain and simple good eats, drinks, wifi and everyday people.

Tiabi opens early, around 6:30 am on weekdays. Which is good because I arrived around 7:45, parched and hungry. Strawberry banana smoothie took the edge off for a few hours, then the West Coast waffle sando took care of the rest. 

A few hours of normal does a body good. I headed back to my hotel feeling recharged and ready to take on the Strip again.

I was so excited to try this place. I always try to find unique places in Vegas and this placed sounded just like that.

Why three stars? Well, it's a great idea for a business using waffles on every single plate but unfortunately their waffles are not unique.

We ordered:
- Kisses Waffle
- Golden Waffle
- Waffledilla 
- South West Sandwich
- Breakfast Sandwich 
- Americano
- Chai Latte
- tuxedo frap
- waffle caramel ice coffee

While the whole menu idea is creative, some of the waffles were burnt and crunchy. The kisses waffle, golden waffle and Waffledilla were so toasted that it would hurt to eat them.

All others were soft and done the right way. Flavor was ok but nothing to wow anybody. I just feel that they are missing something that makes their waffles in general stand out.

Their drinks were amazing. I would definitely come back for drinks. Tasty and several options available.

The Good:
- Great cafe in a random strip mall
- Nice Staff
- Great Drinks
- Only one of the very few places that have Stevia

The Bad:
- Burnt Waffles
- We got all coffees on to-go cups although we ate there. 
- No High-Chairs available

Cute little waffle shop.  They have a big variety of toppings for waffles.  I got the elvis which had bananas, peanut butter and honey - delicious!  

On another occasion I got a green smoothie that I was a little disappointed by.  The ingredients were not blended until smooth so there was just too much texture.  Aside from that, the flavor was good.

This is located a few minutes away from UNLV. We came to study after class and check it out. The smell when you walk in... is dangerous. I can imagine it being something similar to heaven's scent. The music isn't too loud... it could be better but some of it was decent. 

We were greeted at the counter by a very nice young man. He was knowledgeable and gave us great suggestions. They have a variety of vegan options in both coffee lattes and waffles. We chose the Java Jolt and the dark chocolate lavender latte both with almond milk. They were great and I would highly recommend. Both were priced like any other coffee house in Vegas, nothing outrageous and totally fair. 

We ordered dessert to go... vegan the cinnamon churro waffle with vegan vanilla ice cream. It was so amazing. The ice cream was like nothing I've ever experienced. The waffle was made perfectly. We put it in the microwave to make it extra warm and soft, since we took it to go... and it was just so amazing. I can not wait to go back and get it again. If you've never been here, I definitely recommend giving it a try!

First here in this location people that works here are nice... The place needs a little clean up... The place is really busy than the other one. The waffle makes needs to be REPLACED already or something they been wasting a lot of waffles anyway... The drink I ordered the peachy I didn't like it at all even then have to redo my drink... The waffle churros was nothing like the one at Simmons locations..

This place is very quaint. It reminds me of a small business in northern California. My favorite is the West Coast with a Kale Champ. This it's my favorite new spot. I hope the Las Vegas residents appreciate the new private business Tiabi has to offer. Both Tiffany and Mae are awesome and super sweet. The customer service is enough to keep you returning. Thanks ladies.

Well done guys! We had the kisses and viva la Elvis and they were great!!! The viva bacon and not too salty although I was expecting really salty. We didn't have any of the gourmet drinks but definitely enjoyed the cafe like feel.
Great food and awesome service! Staff and environment are very welcoming and friendly. The Velvet latte is delicious!

I Don't Live in Vegas and found this place off the beaten path. I love it! Vegan or non-Vegan you can go and have a great meal a good cup of coffee/smoothie in a very pleasant setting. The staff here is some of the best I have encountered in Vegas. They're friendly, helpful and always seemed to have a smile (even when things got busy and everyone was under pressure).  I now make this a place I stop at when coming to visit a few times a year. So, my only caveat to anyone reading this is this, if you are in a super hurry call a head, everything is made to order and it takes some time to cook those amazing Belgian waffles to perfection. So kick back and enjoy, I did!!

I had the red velvet with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. One of the best waffles I've ever had.

They had a bunch of really unique weird ones. Like bacon with bananas which you don't think would work but it actually does.

Anyways, highly recommend if you're in the mood for something sweet.

First time trying out this place and it was amazing!! I got the bananatella waffles and the strawberry sunrise smoothie (I believe it was called). It honestly tasted like heaven. The wait was about 15-20minutes long but it was worth the wait!! Also, the environment is so peaceful like and super cute. I totally recommend trying this place out, especially if you're looking for a place to chill, study while having coffee or simply to have some good tasty snack like food!!

Service: Quick, friendly, and helpful. 

Our banana berry came out within a few minutes of ordering ($5.25). The smoothie wasn't icy at all and you could actually taste all the ingredients they put into the drink, unlike most places. IMO, $5.25 is a lot for a smoothie, but I would say it was well worth it's price.

I also ordered the west coast ($5.99). I was torn between the steak and egg waffle (a new addition to the menu) vs the west coast. I went with the west coast since the person at the register suggested it and I'm glad I did.

The west coast was the perfect balance of sweet and salty. The avocado didn't over power the sandwich which I feel most sandwiches do. It was definitely enough to make me full since I also ordered a side of house chips. The house chips tasted like kettle cooked mesquite bbq chips, but they season it themselves kinda like potato corner. Would recommend. We have a place like this in Cali called Bruxie's, but I'd rather come here because their items are more flavorful. 

P.S. They play a variety of girl power songs from Ciara, Beyoncé, Nicki Minaj, Destiny's Child, etc... lol

We've been coming to Tiabi's since they opened in 2013 and love it!  We bring all of our friends here.  

The waffles are a great small size so I never feel over stuffed.  They are so light and crispy, made hot and fresh to order.  The hashtag is my favorite.  I love their coffee too.  We have never had a bad meal.  I highly recommend this place!

It's kind of hidden back around the corner from Target.

Stopped in thanks to other Yelp reviews looking for an afternoon snack and coffee during my travels.  I prefer to stop at local places wherever I go and this is a great spot!  

At the recommendation of the staff I had the "west coast" waffle and an iced "Honey Cream Latte".  Wow!  I got more than a snack... I'll be having a late dinner.  I loved the savory option that had bacon and avocado (my favs!) on a waffle with a little cheese and grilled chicken.  SO good! 

The drink was delicious as well, although I got it half sweet per my taste.  I didn't realize it was a breve (made with half and half instead of milk) but the treat was welcomed since it's so good :). 

Great little place away from the strip.  Good anytime of day - not just breakfast!

My best friend and I came here for brunch probably around 10:30am, and it was amazing! We both had the Dirty Mocha Chai, she had the Kisses and for me, Churronimo. Dirty Mocha Chai had good flavor, right amount of strength and not too sweet. The waffles were delicious! The staff is super friendly and the place had a great atmosphere. When we went it was easy to find seating. It was a really nice place to chill and hang out. I would definitely want to stop by again.

This place is heaven. No, seriously, it is.  Where else can one find green smoothies and scrumptious waffles in ONE place?

So eat the darn waffle, and then repent by drinking blended kale. Yup, pretty much,

As we walked in, we were greeted by happy faces and the scent of warm, delicious waffles. I was very impressed by the selection of vegan goodies they offered. But luckily, im not vegan, so it was time to indulge with deliciousness. We ordered the Banana Tella waffle and sat down. They make the waffles fresh for each order so we had to wait a couple of minutes. When the waffles came out I had one regret: we had ordered one to share. And although one is actually pretty big, this is the kind of dish that should never be shared with a lived one. Its seriously good enough to break friendships and end marriages. Luckily for my husband, I had a big lunch before it, so it  wasnt so bad (the sharing, that is).

If you like waffles, GO. If you like smoothies, GO. If you like coffee, GO.

Just go. Seriously. And order the banana tella. You are welcome.
This is great. There are really good gluten free waffles if you have an allergy for gluten. I love it and you should to so go check it out.
The guy forgot my drink. The food tasted oily. Value, quality and service can not compete with Dougie J's Cafe, not even close. Will NOT recommend this place. I am going back to Dougie J's .

My second time here and still impressed ! Had "kisses" waffles with strawberries and bananas with chocolate syrup and vanilla ice cream. Came to visit Las Vegas and had to come here again. My first time was last summer. So yummy . But a tad bit pricey.
Environment is great..   coffee is great...  Food is great...  Service is great AND their kale vegan cookies are absolutely AMAZING!!!

We had The West Coast and 2 Hot Chocolates and Maple Baci  Waffle.    Everything was absolutely delicious we will definetly be back... I wish they had a patio to smell some fresh air and open later like midnight.  The staff was cool!!!

What a great place.  We were looking for something with breakfast, good coffee, free wi-fi, and popular.  First time I've ever like a waffle sandwich; had the Hashtag breakfast sandwich w/cup of fresh fruit, it was really excellent.

This little place was a great find. Chill definitely come back, next time we're in Vegas.

This is a new spot I just discovered. If you love waffles, then be here. The size is fairly large for a small-stomached person like me but I wasn't gonna waste such good finds. The food was handcrafted with love. It's not noisy thus very good for reflecting on your life whilst munching on waffles and sipping coffee. The only reason I gave a four star was because I wasn't told where the water dispenser was located, so I stayed thirsty for a min. No sign indicating where to place your used baskets so I held on to it for a little longer. But I was excited she remembered to bid goodbye as I exited this miniature-yet-cool- wafs and cof spot. I'll be there again with friends.

Every time I visit here I try something new, I have never been disappointed! The wafflewich is a must try! I love how fresh everything is made, I leave with a sweet satisfied feeling every time. I like the vegan/vegetarian options as well. Friendly and helpful staff keep a positive atmosphere, one of the reasons I really like this place

My husband and I had a terrible experience there. I purchased a goupon and thought it would be a good reason to try a new restaurant.
First: The employee who took my order put her hand inside my coffee cup when she picked it up. I asked her to please give me a new cup, and that putting her hand inside the cup is unacceptable. As she replaced the cup she said, "We wash our hands."
Second: When the same employee brought us our silverware, it was wet and dirty. I took them to the counter and asked for clean, dry silverware.
Third: The service was extremely slow. A party of four ordered before us, and they received 2 of their orders in approx 10 minutes, and the other 2 orders approx 10 minutes later. The employee explained that they can only make a couple of orders at a time, and offered some cookies as consolation.
Fourth: We got our order 30 minutes after we ordered it. I had the egg, sausage, cheese waffle sandwich. The egg and sausage were heated in the microwave and tasted like rubber.
The only good things: The gentleman that made our coffees did an excellent , and the strawberries on my husband's waffles were fresh.
I spoke to the manager, explained why we were there, our experience, and that we will not be back.
I do not recommend this restaurant.

I literally just left this place and already ready to come back for more! I had the kale champ smoothie( which was actually amazing, with 2 full cups of kale) and the Elvis Belgium waffle: peanut butter, banana, savory crispy bacon, and honey drizzled on top of this light flaky waffle! I'm glad it wasn't burnt either because I HATE burnt waffles! Friendly staff and if you're a Unlv student you get 10% off your bill! I WILL be back to try more things off their menu!
West Coast waffle sandwhich. Nom nom. It was bomb. Tiabi is located across the street from Toys R Us. Definitely a place worth trying.

I love this place! Definitely one of my fav coffee shoppes to go to. They serve great coffees & teas as well as some delicious food. Really cute place to just hang out & in a convenient central location.

Saw a Groupon for Tiabis, decided to try it. It was very good. Using Waffles for the sandwich bread is great idea. Tried the wafflezilla and now the vegan burger. Tremendous! They're homemade are pretty amazing as well. Will be hurting this place up when I'm in the area.
Wow. Everyone was telling the truth. This is a must eat place! Get the pistachio latte or you have not lived. I also loved one of the wafflewiches. I highly recommend the West Coast.
The food and drinks were very good. The service was just okay. The lady taking orders was not very friendly,  but the people putting the food out were very nice and apologetic for being slow.
Mmmmm some of the best sweet and savory waffles I've had. Very light and fluffy. Awesome cappucino. Wish they had fresh eggs though.

Perfect place for a Sunday breakfast/brunch. We ordered the Red Velvet waffle, Bananatella, Pistachio latte and the Guru Burger. Added some fresh fruit on the waffle for a dollar more.All of them were just so good! Definitely recommend.

This place is great! Today I had the west coast sandwich and it was amazing. One of the best sandwiches in the area. The chicken is perfect for the sandwich. And the waffle as bread is a cool idea. My girlfriend and I normally go in here for smoothies and this was the first time I ate food and I was not disappointed. The smoothies are really good as well the first time I had a smoothie with tofu I didn't think I would like it because of the tofu but it gets better ever time! Would  totally recommend this place to others!

Walking in you are bombarded with the smell of deliciousness that is waffles. I would go there just to soak in the aroma, it smells that good. Unfortunately, I can't eat the food there because it's not gluten free, so my review is based upon the coffee I got. My friend and I decided to come here because it was a local coffee shop and it wasn't Starbucks. Not a fan of their coffee. Tiabi's coffee selection was pretty good but their waffle selection was better. They had creative coffee drinks like the Jolt and the Snicker's bar which I got. My drink was ok...it a little more on the mocha side than I would've preferred but my friend's drink was amazing. I would definitely go back and get the Jolt next time I'm in Vegas. Definitely check this little coffee shop out. It's got a cool concept going on and who doesn't love waffles?!

Order the kisses with bacon. Its the best thing you will every place in your mouth. Think strawberry and bacon infused waffle with whipped cream and nutella to top it off. It is fabulous and they make it super cutsie. Staff here is awesome, they really know what they are doing and have a knowledge of what people like.
What a delightful find! We're semi-stranded waiting for a tire change and Tiabi came to the hunger rescue! Loved out waffle-sandwich and kale champ smoothie!
Fantastic shakes had another stores one today highly recommended a little pricy but premium shakes

Such delicious food, went here for lunch and had a delicious waffle sandwich South American wafflewich and I Had the ice cream sandwich delicious 
The smells in the restaurant was amazing

Amazing waffles and coffee, but bad decor. They need an upgrade. 

Yes I'm all about the whole experience. The look, the feel, the food.

Service is horrendous and wait time is ridiculous! AR order time, told it would be about 20 minutes,  ok. After waiting 30 minutes I got up and asked how much longer, surprise, they didn't put in my order. Girl next to me got wrong item and had to get a refund then refund wasn't right amount and had to go back to cashier to correct. People on other side of me were halfway through their meal and still hadn't received their drinks, they had to go ask for them.

Waffle itself was great tasting but insides were skimpy, like they just tossed a handful of items on it and sent it out since they knew they made a mistake. I never did receive my kettle chips. :-( bottom line is, don't bother.

The service was amazing and the ladies working, I believe owners a well, were so nice. I have had better coffee but I am from Seattle, and I hanger had much worst coffee here on Vegas. The vegan waffles were so good and moist as well. It is out of my way a bit, but could be a special treat every once in awhile

Ordered the vegan waffle sandwich and Las Elvis vegan style. The coconut "bacon" was a very nice touch added on top of the agave, peanut butter and bananas. The waffle sandwich was the perfect amount of savory. Very good! Great coffee too! Will definitely eat here again!

I went there for the first time today. The waffles are fresh and delicious. I tried the Bananatella. It is two square belgian waffles topped with whipped cream, sliced almonds, and Nutella. The waffle is crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. 

I am taking off two stars because the interior is unappealing. The decoration does not look good, the paint color is unappealing, the furniture is mismatched, the table looks old and dirty (even though it was clean). 

Overall, love the food and dislike the atmosphere/interior decoration.

I absolutely love the waffles here.  I've tried the Belgian waffle Kisses and my sister's classic waffle banana nutella.  They're both so delicious!  My sister and I can't get enough of their waffles.  Their coffees are good quality too.  Usually, I don't expect much in regards to the quality of coffee.  However, every drink we've ordered is made fresh from their espresso machine, so no acidic after taste here.  Their customer is always excellent!  Very friendly and nice!

Definitely recommended!

Been here twice, love the smoothies! and the breakfast waffles are great but the best part is you can customize anything and that's really helpful if you are on a certain diet. The staff is super cool and friendly.

Delicious! There was a quite a wait before receiving our food but they warned us. It's a good think we shared because we ordered a sandwich and a waffle and they came out separately. Both were good. It's nice see them making everything fresh in front of us.

Great food and great service! The only thing I'm not sure about the food was the TIABI sauce, which tasted a little funny, but overall I enjoyed the food. I asked a lady to take a few photos for us and she took quite a few! Very happy with this place. Can't wait to visit  again.

OMG!   The best waffle ever.  Had a Belgium waffle. It was light crispy and DELICIOUS!  I love waffles.   But it is hard to find a good one.  This is the place!  Every thing is made here including the whipped cream. Got a chai latte coffee.  It was perfect.
Creative Food.  DELICIOUS and the prices are fair.  The staff is extremely friendly.  I had Red Velvet Waffle.

I was looking for a place to do some work i with tables and Wi-Fi and came across Tiabi.

Had a great early dinner here consisting of the recommended West Coast Wafflewich with housemade chips and a Just Peachy iced tea (with less sweetener).  The Wafflewich was good (wasn't the biggest fan of the tomatoes, as I felt it was too much of a soft component, I took them out and replaced them with some chips and added the crunch I was looking for) and the peach tea was great. (next time, I'll get all the sweetener--who am I kidding). 

Later, I additionally had an Almond Milk Green Tea Latte and it's possibly my favorite Green Tea Latte I've ever had.  It was refreshingly nutty and not overly sweet.

The owners who had served me were great and friendly personalities and I can't wait to come back here again with others.

Met a friend here very early on a Sunday morning for coffee.  The cashier was friendly and very helpful especially since it was our first time there.  She even made recommendations and provided excellent customer service.  I ordered an iced hazelnut coffee sweetened, but no cream and also a maple & bacon infused waffle.  The coffee and waffle were a hearty and delicious breakfast, which surprised me as they were very flavorful!  The place has a nice coffee shop vibe, music was good but not too loud, and it was the perfect spot to have a conversation.

If you are coming for Belgium style DON'T they stop serving them over a month ago due to taking too long to cook according to the staff. 

My wife LOVES breakfast so I found this place for her. The atmosphere on a weekday morning is quiet and empty but I hear on the weekends it is a madhouse. 

We shared everything today. We started with a maple bacon waffle. I really liked it but my wife said it tasted like an eggo waffle. 

We both had a west coast sandwich despite it being "breakfast". Both really good. Warm waffle as the bread and creamy avocado with bacon and chicken unside-Yum!

We also both had coffee. I had a honey cream iced latte- awesome! My wife had a regular latte with sugar free caramel-also awesome! There coffee is amazing. No bitterness in our milk drinks for sure. 

Overall we loved this place. Great coffee and pretty decent food. Me: 5/5. Wife:4/5. I round down. 

We will be returning for sure!

Btw it is counter service but it was friendly and quick.

The Hashtag Breakfast Sandwich was pretty amazing. I didn't quite enjoy the cold brew as much as I wanted, it was a bit too bold and not very smooth. Prices were good since I had a student discount. Would definitely stop by again for the breakfast sandwiches.
Found this nice little place. The service was friendly.  The waffles were tasty.  I had the red velvet waffle.  I really enjoyed my peaches and cream latte.  Not too pricey of a place either.

Cozy, clean, coffee.....delicious and local. Waffles cooked to perfection. 
Highly recommend.
Great little place. My Belgian style bacon waffle was perfect! Plenty of parking, fast WiFi, & super-friendly folks.

I made the mistake of discovering this place on Groupon as something new to try while visiting Las Vegas. The deal was for 3 - $8 vouchers to be used by 1 person with only 1 voucher per visit. Understood. So I go over from the Strip and plan to order and leave then come right back; then I was going to come back again before leaving town. Well I get there and they tell me I can't leave and come right back because it has to be on a different day or at least a few hours later. I tell them that is not ideal because it's a $40 taxi ride roundtrip from the Strip, plus that is not what the fine print says. They tell me it's up to them to determine what qualifies as a visit. I tell them that needed to be included in the fine print since they want to stick to the fine print. They said it's their decision and I can't leave and come back within a certain time period. ((So if I order something and decided it was really good and want another one, I have to wait a few hours before I can come get another one with my Groupon. Foolishness)) At that point I didn't want any of the food because the poor customer service and the bad attitudes of the employees made me lose my appetite. So I can't comment on how it tastes. But as far as the customer service and employees' personalities are concerned, they left much to be desired. If you don't mind crappy service then go for it. But if pleasant service is an important facet of your dining experience, then don't waste your time.

The setup of the cafe is nice, there's large tables for big groups to comfortably sit at, complete with a deck of playing cards to entertain you until your food is ready. There's lots of chalk writing on the walls with a bunch of UNLV references and other scrabble, which gives it a local and laid-back feel. It was kinda cool but the colors get obnoxious if you stare at them for too long.

I was pretty impressed with the waffles here. I ordered a sugary cinnamon one, and my boyfriend had one of their waffle sandwiches. I think the only thing slightly disappointing was the coffee. I got a pumpkin spice drink, and the espresso/coffee they made it with tasted burnt and old.

I'd probably return here, but not for the coffee.
Very lit, very tasty. Got the sandwich. It was gr8. Good drinks 10/10
Delicious food and they actually have good vegan options too! The Frankenstein signature drink was the best!!
I LOVE Tiabi! I'm vegan so whenever I visit Las Vegas my options are very limited. Luckily Tiabi is so veg-friendly! Their waffles are great, the staff is friendly, five stars all the way!

There's nothing that makes me more happy than a crisp, delicious waffle and a lovely latte.  

This is exactly what I found when I wandered into Tiabi Coffee and Waffle last week.  A coffee date with a couple of friends turned into a couple of hours of eating, sipping and go-fish.  

(This place has cards on every table and when you're sitting there you can't help but pick them up and start playing card games from childhood, which was a blast.)

I ordered the smore's waffle -- which probably wasn't fair because I've made some extremely delicious smore's waffles myself in the past..  But it was quite delicious! My friend ordered the bananutella waffle (which I actually preferred to mine) and my other friend ordered a waffle sandwich + the captain berry crunch smoothie (which was bomb, but only order it if it's all you're going to have because it was dense and filling and super sweet.) 

I have already been back to this place to order the Honey Cream Latte, which was amazing and will definitely have to make a point to stop by whenever I'm in the neighborhood! 

The staff is very friendly and the place is inviting.

Great Food, Great Prices, Great Staff. Can't really ask for more. I don't even really like Waffles in general, but I love eating the kinds that they make. They are really the kings in the Waffle game. Everyone there is real nice and the service was quick.

Yummy! We decided to find something to eat for breakfast of of the Vegas strip and thanks to Yelp found this great cafe! Great waffles and great coffee! Oh and the people working there are fantastic!!
Excellent coffee drinks and great food,  as long as you like waffles.  Freshly made waffles, smell so good.   Tried the pistachio coffee, excellent.
So cute and so yummy! Always have gotten the West Coast sandwich and check in for a free lolli

Coffee and waffles? YES PLEASE!

Came across this great spot on the Yelp app - on the hunt for something sweet. We skipped the coffee, but sure got our sweet tooth craving fulfilled with one of their delicious waffles.

They have various waffles to choose from with toppings such as nutella, banana, strawberries, chocolate and other sweets. Then they also have savory waffle sandwiches with bacon, turkey - and even egg and cheese!

We stuck with the Banana Tella which has banana, nutella drizzle, almonds and whipped cream. You can make any waffle a "dessert" by adding a scoop of ice cream. YES PLEASE! The waffle was incredible. I would of liked more of a "home made" whip cream - this one was possibly from the can - but it was still great.

We got the chance to chat up the owner and she was so nice! We asked her about the concept and apparently it started as a coffee shop - then they wanted to add some desserts and decided waffles would be a good fit - then decided to hit the lunch crowd so they added the savory waffles. Genius!

Awesomee concept - great folks working there - and a delicious product! Wish I had tried the coffee! Aw, well - gives me reason to come back to Vegas!

Everything was awesome! I ordered the West Coast waffle sandwich and the BananaBerry smoothie. The only thing it lacked was that the sandwich took awhile for it to come out and it wasn't busy when I went, other than that I would definitely come back hoping for faster service!
The vegan waffles are to die for! My only complaint is that the service is quite slow, so make sure you have plenty of time scheduled for your meal.

Been a regular for a couple months because of the great team that runs this place, along with the fresh quality of ingredients they use! Always a pleasure to come here! I usually get the West Coast sandwich! Comes on a waffle or ciabbata

The coffee here is amazing, the iced coconut truffle is my favorite! 

The breakfast sandwich is what let me down. Plain dry waffle, with 3 strips of bacon, small slab of cheese and barely an egg. Not worth $6 in my opinion. I could definitely find any jack in the box and get the same exact thing for HALF the price and drive.

Bookmarked. Just wish I lived closer, then I'd be here more often. The Twilight Lavender & Pistachio lattes are my fave. West Coast Wafflewich is bomb. Customer service is always great, never been disappointed.

Customer service: 5 stars 

Food: 4 stars because this place is no different that any other waffle place around town. 

Location: 1 star because the area is horribly run 
down And completely inconvenient to get to unless you work nearby or attend UNLV. Also the inside needs some serious TLC

All around I'd give it 4 stars because it was good, but it's not worth a drive to eat there.

Best darn waffle I've ever had! If you're visiting Vegas, this place is definitely a must! Good food, great service! I subtracted 1 star only because they are so busy, they can't clean off the tables fast enough and seating is limited. Still, I would return in a heartbeat, it's so good!
Great customer service! Their Tiff Macchiato waffle really hits the spot on a chilly day...heck any day!

First visit was great- good service and strong coffees. Got the honey cream latte with soy milk (espresso, honey, nutmeg). Second and third visits were okay, and the coffee was suuuuper hot. It was still good, but had to cool it off for a bit. I guess the girl who helped us the first time we visited was so friendly, had such awesome service and made our coffee really, really well that we thought it'd be like that every visit. Coffee is still good, but give that girl a raise whoever she is!

Wonderful restaurant!! The man at the front counter was extremely helpful, as this was our first visit. We came here Tuesday afternoon for lunch. I had one of the wafflewiches and it was so delicious and filling. Also, all of their food is very reasonably priced. I wish we had some of these restaurants on the East Coast. I know my friends would love it! Such a nice concept and laid back atmosphere.

I only visited this place due to a friend wanting to try it. I've had better. The waffles came out dry. I  ordered from their savory menu and to be honest it was disappointing. The items felt like it came from a box and wasn't that much of a difference from a fast food breakfast "sandwich".

  I do not like the type of groupon they put out. You have to literally come back a couple of times to use all of them. The instructions are there but from now on I'm literally avoiding all groupons that expect you to come back each time to use. Actually I'm not even a fan of groupon but a friend convince me to try this place with her. Even she wasn't impressed due to the fact that she can make waffles at home that tasted better ( her words not mine).

  Coffee drinks is a hit or miss. Some tasted ok and some tasted bitter.
